column1: Add monitoring via JMX
column54: Statistics include socket count, byte/message in/out, etc.  Operations include socket kill, etc.
column56:
Have added management beans for all channel types.  These are implemented as separate objects from the channels themselves. 
- Xnio object may benefit from management functions as well - I haven't discussed this with DL.
- added Management tests which currently just test the Tcp channels.  It should be simple to add tests for Udp and Pipes (to be executed only on *nix type platforms).  
- noticed the close() operation is throwing an Exception when invoked from jconsole when I test against EchoClient.  I haven't figured out what this is so may need to be raised as a bug.  
- managed item names might need refactoring for more appropriate names.  

I'm starting a *real* job next week so will have less time to spend on this but will help where I can.  I'm watching this jira issue so just add a comment if you want me to do anything.;07/Nov/08 6:20 AM;RobHadfield;72000
column293: 21/Oct/08 8:48 AM;RobHadfield;Hi, would welcome feedback on the few manageable items provided.  I made the MBean name include the local and remote socket endpoints just because that's what seems would be useful to me.  There is also a single operation 'close()' on the 'Operations' pane.
column294: 21/Oct/08 9:35 AM;dmlloyd;Looks cool.  Might it be worth providing the socket addresses as attributes too, to make it easier for management software to locate a specific entry without parsing the name?
column295: 21/Oct/08 9:38 AM;dmlloyd;Also - I am curious how much the counters will detriment performance.  If it is significant, I think we probably ought to drop the "messages" counter and just stick with bytes in/out.
column296: 30/Nov/08 6:17 PM;dmlloyd;I've completed this task.  The code has been reorganized so that all common management functions are in the API.

column54:
The document http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Developer_Studio/2.1/as/html_single/index.html#tptp_support tells you how to add TPTP support to JBDS but is missing the step about installing the JBoss TPTP Profile feature.

This is required as JBDS does not contain this feature.
Without the JBoss TPTP feature TPTP may not work.

column1: SOAP Relational connector throws NPE when binding is created in Designer as part of import.

column54:
A binding is create for the model at the end of the execution of the SOAP-Relational importer.  An NPE is being thrown when the binding is created because the ExecutionContext passed to the connector is null.

The NPE is swallowed, so the user never sees it, but there is no binding there.

column1: LOCATE() function isn't being translated correctly by Oracle Connector
column11:
Issues should be logged here for the Teiid runtime and related documentation. See also related JIRAs:
  • Teiid Web Tooling
  • Teiid Web Console
  • Teiid RHQ Plugin
  • Teiid Dashboard Builder
  • Teiid Whipper
  • Teiid Designer
  • Teiid Spring Boot
column56: Changed LocateFunctionModifier.modify(IFunction function) to use i as index instead of i + 1.  Also, if i is less than 1, it will become 1.;10/Aug/09 6:14 PM;loleary;1800
column293: 06/Aug/09 2:13 PM;shawkins;It looks like the +1 on the index is a hold over from the early 5.0 days when we still were 0 index based.  On the negative index value handling, there's no consistent behavior among implementations -- Teiid, Derby, DB2, Sybase, and Oracle instr (PostgreSQL also allows negative indexing) are all different wrt to the from index parameter.  To match our behavior all of them would need to have the from index parameter translated in a case statement or have if it's a literal changed to 1 as above.
column294: 19/Aug/09 4:04 PM;loleary;Added a generic LOCATEFunctionModifier that does not perform index offset and also handles instances where start index is less than 1.  All connectors (that support LOCATE) have been updated to use the generic implementation so the behavior of LOCATE at the data source is consistent with our build-in system function.

column1: SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE function of Oracle Spatial Connector is pushing string literal to data source
column11:
Issues should be logged here for the Teiid runtime and related documentation. See also related JIRAs:
  • Teiid Web Tooling
  • Teiid Web Console
  • Teiid RHQ Plugin
  • Teiid Dashboard Builder
  • Teiid Whipper
  • Teiid Designer
  • Teiid Spring Boot
column54:
Executing a query which uses the SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE function in criteria results in an invalid query being sent to Oracle.

Query:

SELECT RECORD_ID FROM OraSpatialSrcTable WHERE sdo_within_distance(MARKER, '(SDO_GEOMETRY(2001, 8307, MDSYS.SDO_POINT_TYPE(90.0, -45.0, NULL), NULL, NULL))', "DISTANCE=25.0 UNIT=NAUT_MILE") = 'TRUE'

Results In Exception:

ERROR <com.metamatrix.core|0> [MetaMatrix][Oracle JDBC Driver][Oracle]ORA-29900: operator binding does not exist
ORA-06553: PLS-306: wrong number or types of arguments in call to 'SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE'


Executing statement:

  SELECT ORASPATIALSRCTABLE.RECORD_ID FROM ORASPATIALSRCTABLE WHERE SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE(ORASPATIALSRCTABLE.MARKER, '(SDO_GEOMETRY(2001, 8307, MDSYS.SDO_POINT_TYPE(90.0, -45.0, NULL), NULL, NULL))', 'DISTANCE=25.0 UNIT=NAUT_MILE') = TRUE
java.sql.SQLException: [MetaMatrix][Oracle JDBC Driver][Oracle]ORA-29900: operator binding does not exist
ORA-06553: PLS-306: wrong number or types of arguments in call to 'SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE'

at com.metamatrix.common.util.exception.SQLExceptionUnroller.unRollException(SQLExceptionUnroller.java:43)
at com.metamatrix.connector.jdbc.JDBCBaseExecution.createError(JDBCBaseExecution.java:147)
at com.metamatrix.connector.jdbc.JDBCBaseExecution.createAndLogError(JDBCBaseExecution.java:103)
at com.metamatrix.connector.jdbc.JDBCQueryExecution.execute(JDBCQueryExecution.java:89)
at com.metamatrix.dqp.internal.datamgr.impl.ConnectorWorker.processNewRequest(ConnectorWorker.java:274)
at com.metamatrix.dqp.internal.datamgr.impl.ConnectorWorker.processBatchRequest(ConnectorWorker.java:165)
at com.metamatrix.dqp.internal.datamgr.impl.ConnectorWorker.process(ConnectorWorker.java:139)
at com.metamatrix.common.queue.QueueWorker.run(QueueWorker.java:51)


The exception is due to the second parameter of SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE being escaped as a string.
The expected query should be:

SELECT ORASPATIALSRCTABLE.RECORD_ID FROM ORASPATIALSRCTABLE WHERE SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE(ORASPATIALSRCTABLE.MARKER, (SDO_GEOMETRY(2001, 8307, MDSYS.SDO_POINT_TYPE(90.0, -45.0, NULL), NULL, NULL)), 'DISTANCE=25.0 UNIT=NAUT_MILE') = TRUE


In the above query the first parameter was an element of type String. If the first parameter was of type Object, the function is rewritten correctly. This appears to be primarily due to the function signatures of sdo_within_distance and the query rewriter performing an implicit convert on the second parameter to make it match the function signature of String, Object, String rather than Object, String, String.
column56: Changed OracleSpatialFunctionModifier.addParamWithConversion(List<Object> objs, IExpression expression) : void to remove string escape from SQL if expression is an ILiteral with a valud who's type is String instead of only for ILiteral's with type of String.;10/Aug/09 4:58 PM;loleary;1800

column54: An issue was logged in where a function that resulted in the use of the mod() scalar function would result in a different query plan causing the queries criteria not to be pushed-down to the source.  It appears the cause of the misbehaved query plan was the DB2 connector not supporting the MOD() scalar function.
column56:
Added MOD function to List com.metamatrix.connector.jdbc.db2.DB2Capabilities.getSupportedFunctions().

Committed to R050503 patches and R050504c base.;13/Apr/09 3:54 PM;loleary;900
column293:
01/May/09 10:43 AM;loleary;Added MOD to connector's function list.  DB2 defines syntax of MOD as:

MOD ( expression , expression )

This appears to be ANSI compliant and therefore no translator was used.
column294: 15/Jun/09 5:02 PM;shawkins;There is a mismatch between our mod and db2's mod support.  db2 only allows short, int, and long.  We additionally allow for float, double, and biginteger.  The org.teiid.connector.jdbc.sybase.ModFunctionModifier compensates for this mismatch in sybase.  The same approach should work for db2.
column295: 10/Jul/09 6:43 PM;loleary;Patch to add MOD function modifier support to handle various Teiid to DB2 data types.
column296: 24/Jul/09 1:32 PM;loleary;TEIID-486_connector-jdbc_200907231854.patch represents a reusable function modifier that can be used by any connector's translator.
column297:
27/Jul/09 11:17 AM;loleary;shawkins applied https://jira.jboss.org/jira/secure/attachment/12328115/TEIID-486_connector-jdbc_200907231854.patch for 6.2 M1 with some minor refactoring.  

The patch addresses DB2 and Derby supported data types for the MOD() function.
column298: 27/Aug/09 2:59 PM;shawkins;The trunc function is supported by db2, but not derby.  It would be best to consolidate the implementation of the modfunctionmodifier with the one used for sybase/sqlserver and to use functions supported by all of those sources.  Note that the current modfunctionmodifier for sybase/sqlserver actually implements the math function modulo, but it should instead compute the remainder (which can be negative).
column299: 31/Aug/09 6:01 PM;shawkins;Consolidated the logic to perform x % y => x - sign(x) * floor(abs(x / y)) * y on non-integral types.  This will still fail on Derby prior to 10.4 however.

column54: Defect Tracker #24747: Non-deterministic functions used in the select clause of a nested view may prevent the view from being removed if the expression is used in more than one place in the upper view.
column56:
Committed changes made in R050501 to Teiid.

Updated com.metamatrix.query.optimizer.relational.rules.RuleMergeVirtual.checkProjectedSymbols() to check symbol for non-deterministic functions.

Added com.metamatrix.query.optimizer.TestJoinWithFunction and com.metamatrix.query.processor.TestJoinWithFunction TestCase.;11/Feb/09 5:26 PM;loleary;5400
column293: 12/Jan/09 10:53 PM;shawkins;The use of a non-deterministic expression is a select clause of a view seems pretty rare.
column294:
09/Feb/09 1:09 AM;loleary;Looks like this issue was raised with IT-259834 from GSS.  

The issue is with an XML mapping class resulting in extra/duplicates rows being returned due to the use of a non-deterministic function in the child view.  

In summary a mapping class transformation uses a non-deterministic function and its child mapping class is being searched due to user criteria.  This results in a plan of a JOIN between the parent and child nodes of the document.  The non-deterministic function is being pushed up to the JOIN command itself instead of the left-side of the JOIN.  In the use case the left-side of the JOIN is to bring back 2 rows and the right-side is to bring back 5 rows.  The JOIN(ed) results should be 2 rows due to the left-side symbols are the only ones being projected and the optimizer has placed a DISTINCT on the query.  The problem is due to the non-deterministic values being returned the DISTINCT doesn't do its job and we end up with a total of 5 rows post-JOIN.
column295: 09/Feb/09 1:12 AM;loleary;I have coded a patch and UnitTest for 5.5.1 and will migrate changes to 5.5.2, 5.5.3, 5.5.4, and Westport.
column296: 11/Feb/09 5:28 PM;loleary;Issue is covered by UnitTest.

column1: Cannot check entitlements as session is invalid due to fully-qualified user name not being used in cluster
column11:
Issues should be logged here for the Teiid runtime and related documentation. See also related JIRAs:
  • Teiid Web Tooling
  • Teiid Web Console
  • Teiid RHQ Plugin
  • Teiid Dashboard Builder
  • Teiid Whipper
  • Teiid Designer
  • Teiid Spring Boot
column54:
Running with entitlements enabled in a single MMServer (non-cluster) and two membership domains everything is fine.

Running with entitlements enabled with two MMServers (clustered) and one membership domain everything is fine.

Running with entitlements disabled with two MMServers (clustered) and two membership domains everything is fine.

Running with entitlements enabled with two MMServers (clustered) and two membership domains results in the following error when a client attempts to execute a query and has used a user name that has not been qualified with a membership domain name (i.e. user01 vs. user01@my.domain):

ERROR: Cannot check entitlements as session is invalid

In all cases the user name is not fully-qualified with the domain name. If the client uses a user name that is qualified with the domain name, no error occurs.

For example:

user01 results in a failure while user01@domain01 or user02@domain02 does not.
column55:
Multiple membership domains
Multiple node MM cluster
Entitlements are enabled

column54: When a server connection is created in federate-client the client connection properties are updated.  During this update process the client's host name and IP address are set in the properties object by SocketServerConnection.  Currently, SocketServerConnection is setting the client's IP address as both IP address and host name and not setting the client's host name at all.

column54: Generate WS-BPEL from a choreography description.
column57:
Dealt with some issues related to namespaces and port types not being defined.

However one problem found is that contracts defined on top level roles are no accessible in the sub-conversations. Need to provide a mapping of the role names to contracts that are updated as the sub-conversations are run/spawned.

This could be done by mapping the roles to contracts in the context related to the top level definition, and then updating these mappings when going into and back out of the run/spawn constructs.
;06/Nov/09 7:23 PM;objectiser;28800

column1: Error when deploying webservice_esb_bpel as single .esb
column54:
When webservice_esb_bpel is deployed using ant, the components of the example are deployed separately - order-manager.war, order-manager-service.jar, shipping-service.jar and Quickstart_webservice_esb_bpel.esb.

However, when deployed via Eclipse as a single .esb, so the jars and war are contained within the .esb (at the top level), they do not get deployed by default.

The attached jboss-structure.xml file needs to be placed in the .esb META-INF folder to enable the various artifacts to be detected by the deployer.

However when this is done, the example fails to run - after the example message is sent, it results in:

column296:
09/Nov/09 10:40 AM;objectiser;Heiko - assigned this to you as it appears to be a WS integration issue.

The exceptions are still occurring as of the latest invocation adapter version of trunk. You don't need to worry about replicating the original issue, just deploy the ESB example using the ant script (i.e. ant deploy-esb-examples initially, and then from the ESB4.6 samples folder, do "ant deploy" of the example itself).

Once you have fixed the underlying problem, so the webservice_esb_bpel example deployed and runs as expected, you can reassign to me to investigate the issue when deployed via Eclipse.

One of the imports goes to a WSDL with the operations/bindings/services etc, but when this URL (http://127.0.0.1:8080/Webservice_esb_bpel_RetailerCallback?wsdl&resource=Retailer.wsdl) is used in the jboss-esb.xml, in place of the previous value, then it fails to deploy complaining about unexpected characters.

column1: Resolve isolation issues using AS5 classloading metadata
column54:
Initial work provided solution for isolating riftsaw.sar to overcome version issue with xmlbeans 2.3 (in riftsaw) versus xbean-2.2 in esb.deployer. However this lead to dependent modules (riftsaw.esb) not finding the required BPELEngine interface from riftsaw.sar.

Discussion on subject can be found at: http://www.jboss.org/index.html?module=bb&op=viewtopic&t=159782

Interim solution will be to rebuild ODE jars using xbean-2.2 to remove conflict, and then work towards proper AS5.1 based isolation in the future.
column56: Depends whether the port back to ODE1.3.3 has removed this problem - otherwise finding a fix could be difficult.;13/Oct/09 12:56 PM;objectiser;144000
column293:
16/Aug/09 11:11 AM;objectiser;riftsaw.sar class loading metadata - which resolves the isolation issue against the esb.deployer, but also hides the BPELEngine interface from riftsaw.esb.

Tried adding the module capability entries to see if that would work, but it did not (see forum discussion with Ales).
column294: 25/Aug/09 7:30 AM;heiko.braun;I've added a temporary fix that replaces the xmlbeans.jar with a newer version. Please remove it from the distribution build files, when this issue is resolved. (Scan for Riftsaw-24)
column295: 12/Nov/09 8:36 PM;kurtstam;I lined up the version of XMLBeans with the one used in JBESB which is XMLBeans-2.20. New ODE-1.x-fixes artifacts have been pusblished to the jboss repository.

column1: RiftSaw should be able to run within a JBossAS Cluster
column54: It should be possible to run RiftSaw within a JBossAS cluster. This does not mean that RiftSaw should leverage the clustering capabilities, however it must enable independent RiftSaw instances to be executed on the clustered nodes.
column56: This will need to be tested in QA - but should be no reason why separate BPEL installs in clustered nodes should operate any differently to a BPEL install in a single node.;13/Oct/09 12:58 PM;objectiser;3600

column294: 02/Nov/09 7:15 PM;objectiser;Guess this needs to be raised as an ESB issue?
column295:
04/Nov/09 12:50 AM;jeff.yuchang;Updates on this task:

1. previous issue as I commented earlier can be fixed by removing the juddi-service.sar as Kev commented in the JBESB-2925.

I am trying two cluster scenarios for this task.

1) cluster nodes on separate machines.
In this scenario should be no problem. but I've just verified it in one machine at the moment, will add another machine tomorrow.
one thing to note is that if you start the server with -b ip-addree, you need to update the sample's 'localhost' into 'your ip address', so that it can be communicated correctly.

2) cluster nodes on single machine. (by updating the server's port)
In this scenario, it will throw following exception from JBoss ESB.

'2009-11-04 12:32:49,329 ERROR [org.jboss.messaging.util.ExceptionUtil] (main) Queue[/queue/ExpiryQueue] startService
javax.jms.InvalidDestinationException: Destination ExpiryQueue already exists' exception

I need to look up in the JBoss ESB's documentation to see how to deploy it in the cluster environment.

column1: Explain the difference between dataTable and extendedDataTable
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:

text from the email
"This may look confusing, but rich:extendedDataTable is a component that supports some extended features, not supported by rich:dataTable. But not all the features, "columnsWidth" is not the only such feature as I've already mentioned."
column293: 11/Sep/09 11:09 AM;OChikvina;Done.
column294:
13/Oct/09 10:55 AM;ghjboss;The documentation of different usage of rich:dataTable and rich:extendedDataTable needs to cover the following bullet points:

1) what attributes are available for rich:dataTable but NOT for rich:extendedDataTable. for example, "columnsWidth" is only available for rich:dataTable but not for rich:extendedDataTable

2) what attributes of rich:column work for rich:dataTable but NOT for rich:extendedDataTable. for example, breakbefore/colspan/rowspan only work for rich:dataTable but NOT for rich:extendedDataTable.

column1: a4j:form data="#{}" does not populate javascript data variable (data is undefined)
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54: When using the a4j:form component, the data="#{managedBean.property}" attribute is not correctly causing the javascript data variable to be populated. See example below. data is always undefined, even if the managed bean property is set to a valid value, the alert box shows undefined. I verified that when using a4j:commandButton, the data variable is correctly populated, and the alert box displays the value.
column55:
Gentoo Linux 2.6.24
Sun Java 1.6.0.0.7
RichFaces 3.2.1_GA
Facelets 1.1.14
Apache Tomcat 6.0 AppServer
JSF 1.2 RI
column56: Patched (hacked) a fix for this issue. See attached file. The UIAjaxForm class only extends UIForm JSF RI component, instead it probably should extend or delegate behavior to the AjaxActionComponent class as well, since the AjaxActionComponent class is the one that handles _data elements being returned via the AJAX response to client.;16/Aug/08 12:10 PM;lincolnthree;10800
column293: 16/Aug/08 12:08 PM;lincolnthree;Patched UIAjaxForm.java to resolve issue. This does not seem like a good fix, but I just wanted to get it working. Seems like the problem is that UIAjaxForm does not extend the AjaxActionComponent class, which handles the data element.

column1: #{rich:component('suggestion')}.callSuggestion(true) becomes practically unusable with  frequency on rich:suggestionbox
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
Very simple scenario to reproduce the problem:

1) Take from Richfaces showcase RichInput:SuggestionBox:ObjectsUsageExample
2) Just add in rich:suggestionbox frequency="10" attribute
3) Recompile & redeploy
4) Click on the arrow
5) You will need to wait 10 seconds before you see the suggestion list.

Please correct the problem or  create an alternative method as callSuggestionASAP() 

There was a good idea behind .callSuggestion(true): to  give us  some solution to emulate the "combobox" - all delays after 
clicking the arrow make very bad impression, they should be minimized always when if is possible.

Even without giving frequency parameter, we have default value of 400 ms. This, plus the requestDelay parameter in a4j:queue we cannot escape from,
plus the time for processing  the request and... the delay before diplaying the list starts to be very visible for the end user (in local network!). We need
some practical alternative to skip at least the delay from "frequency".
column55: Any rendering kit that can run correctly  Richfaces 3.3.1 showcase
column293: 15/Jul/09 9:53 AM;amarkhel;Now any call of callSuggestion() method will be executed immediately('frequency' parameter of suggestion box will be ignored).
column294: 20/Aug/09 7:40 AM;adubovsky;Verified

column1: sortOrder being evaluated even though rendered=false for rich:column
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54: I have some <rich:column> tags inside a rich:dataTable and some have the 'rendered' attribute tied to a bean field. If this bean field is false, indicating that there is no data for this column, the 'sortOrder' attribute on the <rich:column> tag is still evaluated and thus raises an exception because it returns a null value because that column doesn't exist in the data.
column288: Create a dummy value for columns that don't exist
column293:
13/Jul/09 9:04 AM;amarkhel;Not reproduced. My code:
<h:form>
		<rich:dataTable value="#{capitalsBean.capitals}" var="cap" width="300px" columnClasses="center"
		rows="15" reRender="ds">
			<f:facet name="header">
				<h:outputText value="Sorting Example"/>
			</f:facet>
			<rich:column sortOrder="ASCENDING" rendered="#{capitalsBean.stateRendered}" sortBy="#{cap.state}"> 
				<f:facet name="header">
					<h:outputText value="State Name"/>
				</f:facet>
				<h:outputText value="#{cap.state}"/>
			</rich:column> 
			<rich:column sortBy="#{cap.name}">
				<f:facet name="header">
					<h:outputText value="State Capital"/>
				</f:facet>
				<h:outputText value="#{cap.name}"/> 
			</rich:column>
			<rich:column>
				<f:facet name="header">
					<h:outputText value="Time Zone"/>
				</f:facet>
				<h:outputText value="#{cap.timeZone}"/> 
			</rich:column>
			<f:facet name="footer">
				<rich:datascroller id="ds"></rich:datascroller>
			</f:facet>
		</rich:dataTable>
	</h:form>
All rendered without errors, and after click on arrows to sort, no errors occured. Put your code to reproduce.
column294:
13/Jul/09 11:08 AM;waynebagguley;Please read my bug report carefully.

I said that the problem occurred when I tied 'sortOrder' to a bean field. In your test you just hard-coded the sortOrder.

In my code I have to tie 'sortOrder' to an object in a map:

sortOrder="action.columns['columnNameHere'].sortOrder"

Thus, if 'rendered' for this column is set to "action.columns['columnNameHere'] ne null" then this will cause an exception because the sortOrder will still get evaluated, giving a NPE.
column295: 17/Jul/09 1:44 PM;amarkhel;Fixed
column296: 20/Aug/09 8:44 AM;mvitenkov;Verified at 3.3.2.CR1
column297:
08/Sep/10 10:23 AM;robert.raksi;The resolution disables sorting even if rendered=true and visible=false.

Shouldn't column.isRendered(false) be used instead of column.isRendered()?

column1: realworld/albums: If a user tried to create the album with empty name in a shelf, this shelf would be selected in Add album window
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
1. Login to the application.
2. Create several shelves.
3. Select the shelf and click on Add album icon. --> Add album window has appeared with selected shelf name in Shelf input field. It's ok.
4. Click on Save button. --> "may not be null or empty" message is appeared. It's ok.
5. Close Add album window.
6. Select any other shelf and click on Add album icon. --> Add album window has appeared with previous shelf name in Shelf input field.

Expected result: Add album window should appear with selected shelf name in Shelf input field.

column1: The whitespace at the end of any SelectItem.value results in errors expanding rich:combobox
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
Rich:comboBox cannot be expanded, if any selectItem (in the backingBean.getSelectItems() method) contains the whitespace at the end of the value.

Steps to reproduce:

1. create backingBean, returning the SelectItem[]:
....
list[0] = new SelectItem("hello ");
return list;

2. use it on the page:
<rich:comboBox value="bye" > (for some reasons if the 'value' is not appointed, everything works ok)
<f:selectItems value="#{backingBean.selectItems}" />
</rich:comboBox>

3. result: the combobox is not expanded after clicking the "down" icon.
column288: use "new SelectItem(someValue.trim())"

To solve your problem just set style in form inside sidebar style="margin:0px;"
<f:facet="sidebar">

....
</h:form>
</f:facet>

column1: panelMenuGroup: If expanded="true" and disabled ="true", panelMenuGroup is rendered in collapsed state
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
1. Add rich:panelMenu with rich:panelMenuGroup on the page.
2. Set expanded="true" and disabled ="true" for panelMenuGroup.
3. Open the page. --> panelMenuGroup is disabled and collapsed.

For example:
<rich:panelMenu id="myPanel">
			<rich:panelMenuGroup id="pmg" label="Group 1(expanded=true)" 
                          expanded="true" disabled="true">
				<rich:panelMenuItem label="Item 1" ></rich:panelMenuItem>
				<rich:panelMenuItem label="Item 2 "></rich:panelMenuItem>
				<rich:panelMenuItem label="Item 3"></rich:panelMenuItem>
			</rich:panelMenuGroup>
		</rich:panelMenu>

Expected result: panelMenuGroup should be disabled and expanded.
column293: 26/Jun/09 1:28 PM;amarkhel;It is not a bug. In order to prevent back-compatibility it is better behaviour, but if you want change this, you may create RFC.
column294: 29/Jun/09 5:58 AM;ishchibrya;Closed. It is not a bug.

column1: cdk can generate invalid tld
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54: This is was reported as a Seam issue (JBSEAM-4192) but it's actually a CDK issue.  The generator is generating the description as the last child of the attribute element when it should be the first.  It looks to me that the problem is in META-INF/templates12/taglib.vm, though I would note that it appears META-INF/templates/taglib.vm may contain a similar problem.

instead of :

column1: Regression: "messages: globalOnly does not work properly"
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
Looks like a regression of RF-615... I've upgraded my Seam project to sue RF 3.3.1, in order to fix a number of other bugs, but now messages intended for a single UI component (via the for= ) are appearing in the global messages list at the top of my page.

My page template has:
<rich:messages globalOnly="true" id="page-messages">
...
</rich:messages>

and the controls have:

<rich:message for="my-control-id" id="my-control-id-message">
...
</rich:message>

I can switch the rich:messages to h:messages, and it behaves as it should. Also reverting back to the RichFaces 3.2.2.SR1 jars makes the problem go away, but I get the other older bugs back :(
column293:
19/Jun/09 3:31 PM;amarkhel;Not reproduced.
My code:
test.xhtml:
<h:form>
<rich:messages globalOnly="true">
</rich:messages>
<h:inputText id="my-control-id" required="true" value=""></h:inputText>
<rich:message for="my-control-id" id="my-control-id-message">
</rich:message>
<a4j:commandButton actionlistener="#{controller.generateErrors()}" value="Submit"/>
</h:form>

Controller.generateErrors(){
UIComponent root = FacesContext.getCurrentInstance().getViewRoot();
		UIComponent component = root.findComponent("mainform:my-control-id");
		FacesContext.getCurrentInstance().addMessage(component
			.getClientId(FacesContext.getCurrentInstance()),new FacesMessage(FacesMessage.SEVERITY_ERROR, "input error", "input error"));
}

column314:
28/Apr/11 1:48 AM;mano.swerts;Hi guys,

We investigated the issue further by debugging the RichFaces JavaScript code.

We noticed that both the <rich:messages globalOnly="true" /> component and the <rich:message for="inputField" /> component bind to an "onMessage" event.

When the event is triggered on tab, the "onMessage" function in "message.js.faces" is triggered for both components.

As you can see in the attached screenshots the function is called twice: once for both components. Other <rich:message /> components which have a "for" attribute related to other fields are not triggered, just as expected.
In the JavaScript code, we can see that a check is performed on the availability of the "forComponentId" attribute. If this attribute is available, a validation message is rendered for the specified component id. If this is not available, a global message is rendered.
But when a global message is rendered, we cannot see any check on the globalOnly attribute. So any message is rendered, regardless of this attribute. The attribute is nowhere to be found in the JavaScript code.

We were wondering if this is the bug or if there is an other piece of code that is responsible for checking whether only global error messages may be displayed?

Try to reRender a outer element, or to put a a4j:outputPanel ajaxRendered="true":

<a:outputPanel ajaxRendered="true" id="messagesOuter">
     <rich:messages id="richMessages" rendered="#{workaroundForGlobalMessagesBug.showMessages()"/>

If you reRender 'richMessages' the rendered is not reavaliated, only the children's 'rendered' is reavaliated.

column1: Add controls for where in the header loaded scripts are placed
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
IE8 requires some header content be located at the very top of the header.  Because RichFaces places some of the loaded scripts first this can break.

For example "<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=EmulateIE7" />" will be ignored if not the first element after the header.  Although the work around can be to just place the value in the header directly "<header name="X-UA-Compatible">IE=EmulateIE7</header>", RichFaces should have a way to control the location of the scripts in the header.

This could take the form of a new context param or perhaps a tag that RF can trigger off of for default script placement.  If not there behavior is defaulted to current.

column1: ColorPicker does not output valid XHTML
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
The XHTML produced by the new ColorPicker component fails W3C validation. I am using the awesome Validator plugin (https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/249) for Firefox, so you might want to too.

The kind of errors I see are:

* there is no attribute 'vertical-align'
* required attribute 'alt' not specified
* reference to non-existent ID

column303:
10/Jun/09 9:39 AM;OChikvina;It's decided to unify the style attributes descriptions in the following way:

style  -   Holds a fragment of a style sheet that applies to the component
styleClass  - Assigns one or more CSS class names to the component. Corresponds to the HTML class attribute.

Example:
inputClass  - Assigns one or more CSS class names to the component input field;
inputStyle  - Holds a fragment of a style sheet that applies to the component input field

column1: static webpage for richfaces components
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
the richfaces developer guideobviously attempts to demonstrate, what richfaces can do -- but on the expense of usability:
http://www.jboss.org/file-access/default/members/jbossrichfaces/freezone/docs/devguide/en/html/index.html

sections 2 to 6 are realized as collapsed trees -- one has to expand and find the entry one looks for. and if one goes back from that page, the tree is collapsed again. so one has to expand and search and click ... if you browse the entries this is a major nuisance.

so, please, could there be a static table of contents -- instead or additionally -- one could use?

column296:
22/Apr/09 10:39 AM;smukhina;For released docs:
- Release version under subtitle e.g. -  "Version 3.3.0"
- Near each component it's necessary to tell a user when it was released e.g. - "Released in 3.3.0"

For nightly docs
- Near each component it's necessary to tell a user when it was or will released e.g. 
for release components - "Released in 3.3.0"
for unreleased components -  "Will be released in 3.3.1"
column297:
25/Apr/09 11:45 AM;artdaw;I've the way the stamps could be added. In f.xsl:
<title>
				<
				<xsl:value-of select="concat($prefix,':', $tag_name)" />
				>
				<emphasis role='strong'>
				<xsl:choose>
					<xsl:when test="document(concat($lang, $separator, 'included', $separator, $prefix, '_', $tag_name, '.desc.xml'))">
						<xsl:text> available since </xsl:text>
						<xsl:value-of select="document(concat($lang, $separator, 'included', $separator, $prefix, '_', $tag_name, '.desc.xml'))/root/section/sectioninfo/releaseinfo"/>					
					</xsl:when>
					<xsl:otherwise>
						<xsl:text> available since </xsl:text>			
						<xsl:value-of select="document(concat($lang, $separator,'included',$separator,$tag_name, '.desc.xml'))/root/section/sectioninfo/releaseinfo" />
					</xsl:otherwise>
				</xsl:choose>
				</emphasis>
</title>

In html-commons.css:
h2.title a span.strong {
	color:#6e6e6e;
	font-size:0.8em;
	font-weight:100;
}

But I still get bugs with TOC. I need further investigation.

column1: dropSupport: "disableDefault" attribute doesn't work.
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
#1. Add dragSupport and dropSupport zones following way:
<h:panelGrid columns="1" id="panel1">
			<h:panelGroup id="column1">
				<a4j:outputPanel>
					<rich:dragSupport dragType="dragType1"></rich:dragSupport>
					<h:outputText value="Drag it 1" />					
				</a4j:outputPanel>
			</h:panelGroup>
		</h:panelGrid>
<h:panelGrid columns="1" id="panel3">
			<h:panelGroup id="column3">
				<a4j:outputPanel>
					<rich:dropSupport acceptedTypes="dragType1"></rich:dropSupport>					
					<h:outputText value="Drop from 1" />
				</a4j:outputPanel>
			</h:panelGroup>
		</h:panelGrid>
#2. For dropSupport set action="main", where "main" is action navigation to the main page, defined in faces-config.xml
#3. Set ondrop="window.open('http://www.jboss.org/','_blank','width=200,height=200');"
#4. Set disableDefault="true".
#5. Navigate to page and make drag'n'drop content from "panel1" panelGrid to "panel3" panelGrid.(acceptedTypes="dragType1")

Actual behavior:
www.jboss.org opens in new window, then "main" navigation action works.
Try to append by hands "return false;" to the ondrop handler's content and repeat Step #5 - works fine: www.jboss.org opens in new window, current page remains.
column293: 16/Dec/08 10:44 AM;mvitenkov;Attribute "disableDefault" should be hidden.
column294: 04/Jun/09 11:56 AM;amarkhel;It is not a bug. Attribbute 'disableDefault' should cancel only javaScript actions, but no actions, that sends request for server.
column295: 10/Jun/09 8:02 AM;mvitenkov;Verified at 3.3.2.CR1

column1: Editor: onchange, onsave, oninit and onsetup callbacks do not work if was defined using f:param.
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
onchange, onsave, oninit and onsetup callbacks do not work if was defined using f:param.

Example:
<script type="text/javascript">
    
    function myCustomOnChangeHandler(event,inst) {
    	alert("Some one modified something");
    	alert("The HTML is now:" + inst.getBody().innerHTML);
    }

</script>
<h:form>
		<rich:editor id="editorID" value="#{editor.value}" >
			<f:param name="onchange_callback" value="myCustomOnChangeHandler"/>
		</rich:editor>
		<a4j:commandButton reRender="editorID" value="reRender"></a4j:commandButton>
	</h:form>

			<rich:editor configuration="#{editorBean.currentConfiguration}" id="editor" width="400" viewMode = "#{editorBean.viewMode}" value="#{editorBean.value}">

column296:
05/Dec/08 10:59 AM;alevkovsky;For all Editor event attributes (oninit, onchange, onsave, onsetup) was added wrapping in javascript function.
First parameter of all wrappers is 'event' - Event onstance with name "Init" or "Change" and so on. Event also have event.rich.component -  Richfaces Editor component instance and event.rich.tinyMceInstance - Tiny MCE editor instance.

All other parameters same as in tyny MCE API: you can see them on http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration

So values for this attributes should contain function calls.

Usage examples:

  oninit="myCustomOnInitFunction(event);"

  onchange="myCustomOnChangeFunction(event, inst);"

  onsetup="myCustomOnSetupFunction(event, ed);"

  onsave="myCustomOnSaveFunction(event, element_id, html, body);"

NOTE: onsave fuction have html parameter - this is editor content and also should return some html to be saved. See example on http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration/save_callback. If it will not return some value - nothing will be saved.
NOTE: Not allowed to add function which submit form with your editor to onsave event - because onsave callback called after every submit of the editor form - the browser will hang up with cycling

column1: Editor: all tags (existing and non-existing) disappears from editor after rerender in Safari.
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
# Input in editor some non-existent tag, e.g. <ffffff>
# Rerender editor => tag disappears from editor and is not saved to model.  And It is not visible in source mode.
# Input in editor some existent tag, e.g. <a>
# Rerender editor => tag disappears from editor but is saved in model. And It is visible in source mode.

If repeat this steps in any other browser, e.g. Firefox, the result wil be another: any tag is saved to model and all special characters like '<', '>' are decoded in "<" and ">".
column293:
05/Dec/08 12:32 PM;alevkovsky;This is Safari bug. Safari creates child tags in textarea on XHTML pages after rerender.

This bug was posted to Safari bug tracking system under number: 6422051.
https://bugreport.apple.com/cgi-bin/WebObjects/RadarWeb.woa/74/wo/SDO9svtL9arfMDT5Zzy3C0/29.57.20.0.3

column1: Editor does not render in Seam under Safari.
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54: Editor does not render in seam under Safari.
column293:
02/Dec/08 5:36 AM;alevkovsky;The problem was in in loading tinyMCE scripts on xhtml pages in Safari and Mozilla Firefox 2.0.

Following javascript error not allow Editor to render:
"Value undefined (result of expression document.write) is not object."

To avoid it we add tinyMCE parameter 'strict_loading_mode : true' to default Richfaces Editor configuration in https://jira.jboss.org/jira/browse/RF-5192

You can override this parameter for Editor using configuration property file or using f:param child.

strict_loading_mode parameter is described on http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration/strict_loading_mode.

column1: FF3 a4j:poll memory leak
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54: See forum reference posts by pdpantages.
column55:
Linux nebula 2.6.18.8-0.9-bigsmp #1 SMP Sun Feb 10 22:48:05 UTC 2008 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux
Firefox 3
Jboss 4.2.2.GA
Seam 2.0.1.GA
Richfaces 3.2.1.GA
column293: 17/Sep/08 10:36 AM;pdpantages;Plot showing memory consumption, with onsubmit on poller.
column294: 18/Sep/08 2:08 PM;nbelaevski;http://www.jboss.com/index.html?module=bb&op=viewtopic&t=127124&start=10
column295:
23/Sep/08 10:28 PM;pdpantages;I modified the seam-booking example for this test. I will attach jboss-seam-booking.ear

I replaced the richfaces 3.1.3 jars in the seam dist with 3.2.1.

I added two pages. 

http://<host>:8080/seam-booking/mytable.seam
http://<host>:8080/seam-booking/mytable2.seam

There is a one line difference between mytable.seam and mytable2.seam:

onsubmit="if(getPollEnabled()==false){return false}"

The onsubmit is in mytable.seam only.

- Deploy the ear 
- Point FF to mytable.seam
- You should see a table with 500 rows of dummy data.
- Ignore the buttons as these were from another test.
- There should be a "polling" status in the upper right every 4s.
- Make sure that the poller is running and just leave it alone.
- Watch FF memory 
- Repeat for mytable2.seam

mytable.seam should leak FF memory on each poll.

mytable2.seam should not leak FF memory or leak much less than mytable.seam


PdP

column296: 30/Apr/10 12:58 PM;pyaschenko;hidePopupOnScroll was added to calendar component. Does not affect on document body scroll. This attribute allow to hide popup when user scrolls content. Default value is true. If false opened popup wouldn't be closed on scroll but component should be placed into a relative container, otherwise popup wouldn't be scrolled.
column297:
10/Jun/10 12:42 AM;laubai;Documented as a fixed issue in the WFK 1.1 release notes:
            SuggestionBox, Calendar and ComboBox popups had fixed positions within scrollable 
            containers, and would not appear on-screen if a user had scrolled too far. These
            popups are now hidden when a user scrolls surrounding content.

Feedback/corrections appreciated!

column1: ContextMenu: when attachTiming="immediate" menu incorrectly works with h:outputText
column11: RichFaces is a rich component library for JSF and an advanced framework for easily integrating AJAX capabilities into business application development. You can find forum support here.
column54:
<h:outputText id="text1" value="Some text with context menu1">
         <cm:contextMenu attachTiming="immediate">
<mc:menuItem value="a">
<f:param name="cmdParam" value="a" />
</mc:menuItem>
         </cm:contextMenu>
         </h:outputText>
         
         
<h:outputText id="text2" value="Some text with context menu2">
         <cm:contextMenu attachTiming="immediate">
         <mc:menuItem value="b">
<f:param name="cmdParam" value="b" />
</mc:menuItem>
         </cm:contextMenu>
         </h:outputText> 

Click first, then second text. Both shows "b" menu item, but the first should show "a"
column293:
04/Jun/09 11:59 AM;amarkhel;It is not a bug.
When first context menu rendered, wrapped div yet not constructed so javascript error arised and first contextmenu not created. When second context-menu rendered all markup is accessible, so his creation successfull. So only one context-menu is created and showed in both cases. You must use attaching='onload' instead

<rich:panel id="dirView" style="margin-left: 310px;width:830px;height:420px;position:absolute;top:65px;overflow:auto;padding-bottom:0px;padding-left:0px;padding-right:0px;padding-top:0px;">
<rich:dataTable id="lineItemTable" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" var="element" value="#{treeBean.folderData}">
.......


In one column I have context menu :

<rich:column style="width:580px;">
<s:div id="fileName" rendered="#{element.nodeType=='F'}">
<rich:contextMenu id="fileNameContextMenu" event="oncontextmenu" attached="true"
submitMode="ajax" hideDelay="60000">
<rich:menuItem value="History"
action="#{treeBean.setSelectedDocument(element)}"
oncomplete="Richfaces.showModalPanel('versionModalPanel');"
id="showVersion" status="statusDirView"

<h:graphicImage value="/images/iconFile.gif">
</h:graphicImage>
<h:outputLabel value="#{element.name}">
</h:outputLabel>
</s:div>
</rich:column>
</rich:dataTable>
</rich:panel>

column304:
27/Nov/08 8:50 AM;smukhina;Language and content of the component suggestionbox should be improved 

below there are comments of Max Anderson on this component, use it also:

*Description*

"The component adds on-keypress suggestions capabilities to any  input text component (like <h:inputText> ). When a key is pressed  in the field Ajax request is sent to the server. When the  suggestion action returns a list of possible values, it pop ups  them inside the <div> element bellow the input."
Initial description is ok, but a bit vague (e.g. what is the point  of this box)

 "in the field Ajax request is sent" is broken english.

"pop ups them" is broken english.

"bellow the input" is misspelled (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bellows ) and the input is missing a adjective or reference, should be  "below the input component"

My suggestion: "<rich:suggestionbox> allows you to have a list show   up when the user is typing in a input text component (like  <h:inputText>) to provide suggestions to the user to quickly fill  in the text component. The component works by sending a ajax  request to the server when an on-keypress event occurs and if the suggstion action returns a list of values these values will be  shown as a list inside a <div> element below the input. The user  
can then either continue typing or select one of the suggestions  which will then be used as the value of the input text component."

The image is good, but shows a complex suggestion which is not   described in the following example. The example does not describe  what the values inside the returned List should be - readers would  assume a List of Strings when reading the Java code, but looking at  the example there is a property named "text".
After reading the text multiple times, looking at the livedemo and  reading some more I realize that if just the Java code example had  shown that it would return a list of non-string elements it would  have made sense much faster. In other words the Java examples  should be as complete as possible and not just a single line comment.

 *Details of usage*
 ""var" - a collection name that provides access for inputting into  a table in a popup"
I guess what is meant here is: "variable name that will be used for  each element in the returned suggestion collection. Can be used in   the <h:dataTable> and "fetch" attribute"

"There are also two size attributes ( "width" and "height" ) that  are obligatory for the suggestion component. The attributes have   initial Defaults but should be specified manually in order to be   changed."
That sentence is broken english. If they have initial defaults why  are they obligatory ? And what usage is it to be told that to  change a value you have to specfiy them ?

 Note: It also look like from the examples that the <div> element   will actually be rendered as if inside a h:dataTable - that is  actually never written anywhere. Just implied.
column305:
27/Nov/08 9:06 AM;smukhina;Also have a look at this case, noticed by Max 
"Example of correct but confusing technical thing is
http://www.jboss.org/file-access/default/members/jbossrichfaces/freezone/docs/development/userguide/en/html_single/index.html#PlugnSkin which seem to refer to maven/java property names as  D<propertyname> instead of just <propertyname>. Small things but  anyone who has technical java experience would consider that weird  and confusing."

column54: @Path("{id:\d+}") gets converted to "{id:d+}."  This is caused by internal calls for regex replacements that remove the '\'.  The solution is to escape '\' before calling the regex replacements.
column56: tracked this problem down, fixed and committed the solution.;29/Dec/08 3:24 PM;sduskis;7200
column288: There are other ways to write regexes that don't require a '\'.  For example: \d+ can be re-written as [0-9]+
column293: 05/Jan/09 2:10 PM;bill.burke;"\d" is an illegal escape sequence in Java.  It won't compile.  I did try @Path("{id:\\d+}") and that worked fine.

column1: Exception thrown when REST URLs contain + or @
column54:
When I include the + or @ characters in my REST URL, I get the following exception thrown:

java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
        at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1768)
        at org.jboss.resteasy.specimpl.UriInfoImpl.<init>(UriInfoImpl.java:99)
        at org.jboss.resteasy.plugins.server.servlet.ServletUtil.extractUriInfo(ServletUtil.java:65)

(Note that the line numbers may be wrong as I tried many times to fix the problem, but the problem is here alright.

From what I know, I should be able to "GET /foo+bar@gee", which should be decoded as "/foo bar@gee". However I get this exception and no amount of tinkering on my part managed to find an appropriate fix. 

What happens is that the request URI "/foo+bar@gee" is given to UriBuilderImpl which escapes these characters (even though they are allows in the path segment from what I think), which leads to the unescaped absolutePath "/foo%2Bbar%40gee" being compared to the _encoded_ path "/foo+bar@gee" which throws this exception.
column56: Getting around maven, and figuring out why Acme.Serve is broken mostly.;22/Oct/08 11:37 AM;FroMage;18000
column293: 22/Oct/08 5:47 AM;FroMage;I'm working on it now
column294:
22/Oct/08 11:36 AM;FroMage;This patch fixes the issue I've noted.

Note that the unit test doesn't work because Acme.Serve decodes URLs before passing them to the servlet (which is wrong) and does it wrongly by unencoding + as a space. The URL/URI RFCs don't say anything about + being the encoding of a space although the first URI RFC mentions it used to be used as such in query strings, which would explain why legacy code would act that way for a query, but certainly not in the path.

column1: <programlisting> language should be specified by attribute "language" not "role"
column11: PressGang is the centralized hub all JBoss community projects can use to get assistance with documentation services.  If you have any questions about writing professional JBoss project documentation using DocBook XML, you've come to the right place.
column54:
This is actually an issue in jbossorg-docbook-xslt but I can't seem to find a JIRA entry for that.

The <programlisting> tag has the attribute "language" for specifying the language of the listing.

The xslt files in jbossorg-docbook-xslt 1.1.0 use the attribute "role"

xhtml-common.xsl
<xsl:template match="programlisting[@role='XML']|programlisting[@role='JAVA']|programlisting[@role='XHTML']|programlisting[@role='JSP']|programlisting[@role='CSS']">

pdf-xsl
<xsl:template match="programlisting|programlisting[@role='XML']|programlisting[@role='JAVA']|programlisting[@role='XHTML']|programlisting[@role='JSP']|programlisting[@role='CSS']">

Currently for compatibility with Publican, authors need to specify both "role" & "language" in <programlisting>

Can support for "language" be added & the use of "role" deprecated for this ?

Also I notice that the pdf-xsl template has an additional "programlisting|" at the beginning that the xhtml-common.xsl doesn't have.  Is that possibly an error?
column56: Applied the patch submitted by Darrin Mison. Thanks Darrin for taking the time to submit this patch.  Scheduled for addition to the 1.1.1 ;29/Jul/10 9:02 PM;jaredmorgs;600
column293:
29/Oct/09 10:45 AM;sebersole;The issue is not with the jboss.org team either.  It is actually the library they use for colorization/styling (jhighlight I think it is called).

So unless you can convince them to change there code, or convince jboss.org team to develop new highlighting code or develop new highlighting code yourselves there is really not much to do here.  

And for the record I agree with you.  I asked Mark the same exact question when I first saw this..
column294: 21/Nov/09 7:17 PM;dmison;I'm having a look at this now ... so far it looks like all you have to do is change the xsl so it matches and passes the value of language instead of role.  It seems to work ok for xhtml.

22/Nov/09 9:58 PM;dmison;patch attached for http://svn.jboss.org/repos/jbossas/projects/docs/docbook-support/jbossorg-docbook-xslt

 - selecting the attribute "language" instead of "role"

column296:
26/Jul/10 5:05 AM;ge0ffrey;+1 We in drools now use role too, but I 'd much rather use language. I 'll do the migration.
Also, it looks like it's case sensitive: "JAVA" works, but "java" doesn't. Lowercase "java" should work.
column297:
26/Jul/10 6:47 PM;jaredmorgs;Hi Geoffrey.   Because PressGang is all about trying to get Publican to work well with jDocBook, it might be worthwhile looking at the way Publican requires the language attributes to be processed.  

Publican uses the Syntax::Highlight::Engine::Kate:: tool to process all highlighting.  The module is pretty awesome (supports over 100 languages), however it isn't a Java app.  It does require the  language attribute values to be written according to the list of syntax highlighting it supports.  So in summary, anything for java code must be language="Java" (note the case).  XML has the same case requirements as jDocBook currently: language="XML".

http://jfearn.fedorapeople.org/Publican/en-US/Publican/2.0/html/Users_Guide/chap-Users_Guide-Frequently_Asked_Questions.html#id738340

IDK how we would make this work in the Maven build system, but it would be awesome if we could plug this into jDocBook somehow.

column1: [Perf] Excessive ClassNotFoundException signalling in PortletExternalContextImpl
column54:
This happens when PBR is used without Seam on classpath.
If above is true than in method getScopeForName an attempt to find the "org.jboss.seam.Component" class fails each time.
This happens excessively in the JSF application that the issue was found (not using Seam).
It results in almost 30,000 throws of ClassNotFoundException on single user interaction. With deep stacks typical for JSF and portal applications this results in serious performance degradation.

The lack of such class should be cached somehow (probably per classloader) and the attempt should not be retried.

column1: jDocBook does not load DTDs
column11: Issues pertaining to the Maven jDocBook plugin. If you have issue with a particular project's style use whatever JIRA project that project has designated for style issues. For the base JBoss.org styles, use https://jira.jboss.org/browse/PRESSGANG
column54:
JDocBook is not parsing the majority of predefined DocBook DTD entities as listed at: http://www.oasis-open.org/docbook/xml/4.5/ent/isonum.ent

A comparison of the JDocBook-Maven and Publican outputs of these entities can be found here: 
https://svn.devel.redhat.com/repos/ecs/Hibernate_Migration/JDocBook_entity_test/ 

For example, ; should produce a semicolon, however it is currently ignored and outputs nothing.

This has come to light while working on the Hibernate Core document translations at Red Hat.
column293: 16/Dec/09 1:28 AM;rwilding;Attachment of example book with outputs from JDocBook and Publican
column294:
16/Dec/09 11:27 AM;sebersole;No clue where to start looking for this.  There are DTD entities being processed for certain though these are defined within the document.  I'd have to assume this is either an issue with the XML parser being used (Publican and jDocBook use different parsers, so this is totally feasible) or a missed parser config parameter.

Anyway, I am not really an "XML guy".  I have no idea what to do here.  If you can point me to the proper thing to correct this behaviour I'll see how to incorporate this into jDocBook
column295:
17/Dec/09 7:37 PM;rwilding;Hi Steve - looking through the source for JDocBook we found the following in src/main/java/org/jboss/jdocbook/util/FileUtils.java:

// Disable DTD loading and validation
reader.setFeature( Constants.DTD_LOADING_FEATURE, false );
reader.setFeature( Constants.DTD_VALIDATION_FEATURE, false );

As an experiment, setting those two constants to 'true' has allowed JDocBook to parse the predefined entities correctly but causes some other issues -- most notably errors on xi:includes and doctype declarations in chapters and much slower compiling -- so it's not a fix obviously. However it might give a clue as to loading the DTD.

Another take on the issue from Ruediger Landmann who works on Publican with Jeff here at Red Hat:

"In this specific case, the problem is that JDocBook is not honoring the 
entities defined by the W3C here -- http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-entity-names/

In RHEL and Fedora, these are provided as .ent files in the "ent" 
directory shipped in the docbook-dtds package. They install to (for 
example): /usr/share/sgml/docbook/xml-dtd-4.5-1.0-48.fc12/ent/

JDocBook needs to swap in entities from these files as well as the five 
entities defined in the XML standard (which it already does) and any 
local entities defined in the doc (which it already does). Publican for 
Windows ships with these .ent files and installs them in a subdirectory 
of the %ProgramFiles%/Publican directory -- maybe a similar strategy 
might work for JDocBook?"

Loading the DTD from a local directory might improve the compiling speed hit we experienced with enabling DTD  loading.

column296:
03/Apr/09 9:46 AM;sebersole;The reason it tries to resolve as 'jar' seems to be due to the fact that the packaging defines a custom ArtifactHandler which may have not been doen correctly:

http://viewvc.jboss.org/cgi-bin/viewvc.cgi/labs/labs/jbossbuild/maven-plugins/tags/maven-jdocbook-style-plugin-1.0.0/src/main/resources/META-INF/plexus/components.xml?revision=13341&view=markup

06/Apr/09 9:27 AM;sebersole;The code is in place to apply (in 'proper order') transitively defined jdcobook-style deps.  The issue is that there is a bug in Maven itself where transitive deps to custom packagings are not recognized/allowed.

So the support for this is in place in jDocBook, but we have to wait until Maven can actually support this, if ever.

column1: General cleanup

column1: allow easy disabling of processing translations from profiles etc
column11: Issues pertaining to the Maven jDocBook plugin. If you have issue with a particular project's style use whatever JIRA project that project has designated for style issues. For the base JBoss.org styles, use https://jira.jboss.org/browse/PRESSGANG
column293:
11/Mar/09 8:23 PM;sebersole;added a new configuration setting called ignoreTranslations:

<plugin>
    <groupId>org.jboss.maven.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-jdocbook-plugin</artifactId>
    <extensions>true</extensions>
    ...
    <configuration>
        ...
        <ignoreTranslations>true</ignoreTranslations>
    </configuration>
<plugin>


Though something like the following would be more generally useful I would think:

<plugin>
    <groupId>org.jboss.maven.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>maven-jdocbook-plugin</artifactId>
    <extensions>true</extensions>
    ...
    <configuration>
        ...
        <ignoreTranslations>${skipTranslations}</ignoreTranslations>
    </configuration>
<plugin>

...

<properties>
    <skipTranslations>true</skipTranslations>
</properties>

<profiles>
    <profile>
        <id>processTranslations</id>
        <activation>
            <property>
                <name>processTranslations</name>
                <value>true</value>
            </property>
        </activation>
        <properties>
            <skipTranslations>false</skipTranslations>
        </properties>
    </profile>
</profiles>

With  this second set up, processing of translations is disabled by default but can be enabled either by:
1) enabling the processTranslations profile
2) setting the processTranslations system property to true

column1: always set 'base.dir' and 'manifest.in.base.dir' for (x)html-based formats even if not doing chunking
column11: Issues pertaining to the Maven jDocBook plugin. If you have issue with a particular project's style use whatever JIRA project that project has designated for style issues. For the base JBoss.org styles, use https://jira.jboss.org/browse/PRESSGANG
column54:
We should always set 'base.dir' and 'manifest.in.base.dir' for (x)html-based formats even if not doing chunking.  The reason being that some chunking can still be happening (see http://www.sagehill.net/docbookxsl/LegalNotice.html for an example).  In those cases, the chunks are being written to PWD :(

In my investigation so far I have not seen anything showing that always settings those two will have any negative impact.

Here at work, where I'm sitting behind an http proxy server, the maven-jdocbook-plugin takes a very long time to perform the jdocbook:generate task to finally terminate with a: SEVERE: Error with opening URL 'http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/images/draft.png': Connection timed out.

I've set the proxy server correctly in my .m2/settings.xml configuration file, but the plugin seems to go directly without using my http proxy settings.

The stack trace:

	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.<init>(HttpClient.java:233)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(HttpClient.java:306)
	at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(HttpClient.java:323)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(HttpURLConnection.java:788)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(HttpURLConnection.java:729)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(HttpURLConnection.java:654)
	at org.apache.fop.apps.FOURIResolver.resolve(FOURIResolver.java:152)

column11:

column54: I am trying to pass an mtom/xop attachment on a webservice call, but the attachment is not being correctly received.  When I step through the JbossWS code, it gets to the org.jboss.ws.extensions.xop.jaxws.AttachmentUnmarshallerImpl class.  When the isXOPPackage() method is called, the return value is false, so the getAttachmentAsDataHandler() method never gets called.  If I force the isXOPPackage() to return true, then getAttachmentAsDataHandler() is called, and I can see the attachment data in the web method.  So, it looks as if there is a bug in isXOPPackage() which is preventing it from recognizing the attachment.

column11:

column54:
When you create a Bottom up webservice and you normally want the existing wsdl to be used by the deployed service. 
On  JBoss [Trinity] 4.2.2.GA (build: SVNTag=JBoss_4_2_2_GA date=200710221139) combined withjbossws-native-2.0.1.GA  or jbossws-native-2.0.2.GA the deploy of a EJB webservice endpoint with an wsdlLocation fails with the following error:

org.jboss.ws.WSException: Cannot publish wsdl to: C:\<masked>\jbossxxx-node1\data\wsdl\echo.ear\echo-service.jar\echo\EchoService.wsdl
...
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot get URL for: META-INF/wsdl//echo/EchoService.xsd
	at org.jboss.wsf.common.URLLoaderAdapter.findChild(URLLoaderAdapter.java:106)
	at org.jboss.wsf.framework.deployment.ArchiveDeploymentImpl.getMetaDataFileURL(ArchiveDeploymentImpl.java:99)

If you don't use the hand written wsdl  and let jboss generate it everything works just fine.
The META-INF directory contains the following files:
META-INF/
    wsdl/echo/
        EchoService.wsdl
        EchoService.xsd

When you place the Wsdl and xsd directly in the wsdl directory everything works fine. However this is not an option because the real usecase is much more complicated with lots of other schema files to import.

Sample code will be attached.

column1: Using JRE from vendors other than Sun the Remoting key store and trust store algorithms are not propagated
column11:

column54:
When we use JVMs other than Sun the Remoting properties are not reset from the default. For e.g., using IBM JRE and https SE URL the following exception is thrown. Currently there is no way to set the Remoting SSL Socket Factory parameter REMOTING_ALGORITHM or REMOTING_TRUST_ALGORITHM

java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Error creating Remoting SSL Socket Factory:SunX509 KeyManagerFactory not available
	at org.jboss.remoting.util.socket.RemotingSSLSocketFactory.getSupportedCipherSuites(RemotingSSLSocketFactory.java:657)
	at com.ibm.jsse2.ExportControl.checkCipherSuites(ExportControl.java:10)
	at com.ibm.net.ssl.www2.protocol.https.b.afterConnect(b.java:3)
	at com.ibm.net.ssl.www2.protocol.https.c.connect(c.java:62)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getOutputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:866)
	at com.ibm.net.ssl.www2.protocol.https.a.getOutputStream(a.java:25)
	at org.jboss.remoting.transport.http.HTTPClientInvoker.useHttpURLConnection(HTTPClientInvoker.java:163)
	at org.jboss.remoting.transport.http.HTTPClientInvoker.transport(HTTPClientInvoker.java:81)
	at org.jboss.remoting.RemoteClientInvoker.invoke(RemoteClientInvoker.java:143)
	at org.jboss.remoting.Client.invoke(Client.java:525)
	at org.jboss.remoting.Client.invoke(Client.java:488)
	at org.jboss.ws.soap.SOAPConnectionImpl.call(SOAPConnectionImpl.java:185)
	at org.jboss.ws.jaxrpc.CallImpl.invokeInternal(CallImpl.java:689)
	at org.jboss.ws.jaxrpc.CallImpl.invoke(CallImpl.java:398)
	at org.jboss.ws.jaxrpc.CallProxy.invoke(CallProxy.java:164)
	at $Proxy57.vmsdkGetBrowseInfoFromHost(Unknown Source)
                     .................
Caused by: 
java.io.IOException: Error creating Remoting SSL Socket Factory:SunX509 KeyManagerFactory not available
	at sun.security.jca.GetInstance.getInstance(GetInstance.java:158)
	at javax.net.ssl.KeyManagerFactory.getInstance(KeyManagerFactory.java:20)
	at org.jboss.remoting.util.socket.RemotingSSLSocketFactory.loadKeyManagers(RemotingSSLSocketFactory.java:288)
	at org.jboss.remoting.util.socket.RemotingSSLSocketFactory.init(RemotingSSLSocketFactory.java:177)
	at org.jboss.remoting.util.socket.RemotingSSLSocketFactory.getSupportedCipherSuites(RemotingSSLSocketFactory.java:653)
	... 65 more

Please allow this and other properties to be set in SOAPConnectionImpl.java and CallProxy.java

In newer Remoting version we have more properties that can make a difference:

REMOTING_KEY_ALIAS
REMOTING_CLIENT_AUTH_MODE
REMOTING_SERVER_AUTH_MODE
REMOTING_SSL_PROTOCOL
REMOTING_SSL_PROVIDER_NAME
REMOTING_SERVER_SOCKET_USE_CLIENT_MODE
REMOTING_SOCKET_USE_CLIENT_MODE

column1: WSDL-JAVA Derivation of a complex type from a Simple type: bas64Binary is not mapped to byte[]
column11:
Show my open issues sorted by version.

Bug only filters:
All open bugs
Native stack open bugs
CXF stack open bugs
column54:
According to the Appendix section in JAXRPC specification TABLE 18-1 XML Schema support in JAX-RPC specification:

XML Schema: Derivation of a complex type from a simple Type

Example of XML Schema fragment and/or XML Schema instance:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
<xsd:element name="internationalPrice">
<xsd:complexType>
      <xsd:simpleContent>
           <xsd:extension base="xsd:decimal">
                <xsd:attribute name="currency" type="xsd:string"/>
           </xsd:extension>
       </xsd:simpleContent>
</xsd:complexType>
</xsd:element>

Support in JAX-RPC 1.1: Required

When it is extension from simpleTypes like xsd:string, xsd:integer etc from the JAXRPC Spec TABLE 4-1 Java mapping for the built-in simple XML data types, that are mapped to a Java Type which are Wrappers, wstools works properly with the mapping, but when the types are mapped to simpleTypes like xsd:int, xsd:boolean they are mapped to their wrappers which is wrong according to the Table 4-1 in the spec and when the simple type is xsd:base64Binary or xsd:hexBinary instead it fails to map properly to its Java Type byte[]. Instead it maps the type as [B and the source becomes uncompilable.

column1: Address in WSDL is now always replaced regardless of 'alwaysModifySOAPAddress' value.
column11:
Show my open issues sorted by version.

Bug only filters:
All open bugs
Native stack open bugs
CXF stack open bugs
column54:
Address in WSDL is now always replaced regardless of 'alwaysModifySOAPAddress' value.

If the property 'webServiceHost' is commented out the address is always replaced with the address used by the calling client.  

If the 'webServiceHost' proprty is set then this value the address in the WSDL is always replaced with this value.

It should be possible to keep the original behaviour which allowed the address to be set in the WSDL and this address would always be returned so the three required scenarios are: -

 1 - Use the hostname specified in the -beans.xml.
 2 - Use the hostname already in the WSDL.
 3 - Use the hostname of the calling client.

The output of http://localhost:8080/jbossws/services should also use the same addresses.

The Jira tasks which caused this change in behaviour are JBWS-1399 and JBWS-1178.

column11:

column54:
Consider the following WSDL: 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<definitions name='MySEIService' targetNamespace='http://javatype.mycompany.com' xmlns='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/' xmlns:ns1='http://other.com' xmlns:soap='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/' xmlns:tns='http://javatype.mycompany.com' xmlns:xsd='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema'>
 <types>
  <schema targetNamespace='http://other.com' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema' xmlns:soap11-enc='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/' xmlns:tns='http://other.com' xmlns:xsi='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance'>
   <complexType name='TestException'>
    <sequence/>
   </complexType>
   <element name='TestException' type='tns:TestException'/>
  </schema>
 </types>
 <message name='MySEI_testException'/>
 <message name='MySEI_testExceptionResponse'/>
 <message name='TestException'>
  <part element='ns1:TestException' name='TestException'/>
 </message>
 <portType name='MySEI'>
  <operation name='testException'>
   <input message='tns:MySEI_testException'/>
   <output message='tns:MySEI_testExceptionResponse'/>
   <fault message='tns:TestException' name='TestException'/>
  </operation>
 </portType>
 <binding name='MySEIBinding' type='tns:MySEI'>
  <soap:binding style='rpc' transport='http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http'/>
  <operation name='testException'>
   <soap:operation soapAction=''/>
   <input>
    <soap:body namespace='http://javatype.mycompany.com' use='literal'/>
   </input>
   <output>
    <soap:body namespace='http://javatype.mycompany.com' use='literal'/>
   </output>
   <fault name='TestException'>
    <soap:fault name='TestException' use='literal'/>
   </fault>
  </operation>
 </binding>
 <service name='MySEIService'>
  <port binding='tns:MySEIBinding' name='MySEIPort'>
   <soap:address location='REPLACE_WITH_ACTUAL_URL'/>
  </port>
 </service>
</definitions>

Using the following wstools config:

<configuration xmlns="http://www.jboss.org/jbossws-tools">
<global> 
         <package-namespace package="com.other" namespace="http://other.com"/>
         <package-namespace package="com.mycompany.javatype" namespace="http://javatype.mycompany.com"/>
   </global>
    <wsdl-java file="MySEIService.wsdl">
      <mapping file="jaxrpc-mapping.xml" />
    </wsdl-java>
</configuration>

The TestException class is not generated in the com.other package.

column1: SOAP response and WSDL differ
column11:
Show my open issues sorted by version.

Bug only filters:
All open bugs
Native stack open bugs
CXF stack open bugs
column54:
The WSDL file is generated by SUN's jwsdp-1.6 and contains this complex type returned by a WS-call:
<complexType name="ServiceResponse">
<sequence>
<element name="errorCode" nillable="true" type="int"/>
<element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="errorMessages" nillable="true" type="string"/>
<element name="numRowsError" nillable="true" type="int"/>
<element name="numRowsSuccess" nillable="true" type="int"/>
<element name="numRowsWarning" nillable="true" type="int"/>
<element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="successMessages" nillable="true" type="string"/>
<element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="warnMessages" nillable="true" type="string"/>
</sequence>
</complexType>

The WS-Response contains an additional element 'errorMessagesAsString:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
 <soapenv:Body>
  <ns1:determinationOfDeterministicRequirementsResponse xmlns:ns1="http://planning.ws.fn.mbisoftware.biz">
   <result>
    <errorCode>-1</errorCode>
    <errorMessages>invoke of the implementing class not implemented yet.</errorMessages>
    <numRowsError>1</numRowsError>
    <numRowsSuccess xsi:nil="1"/>
    <numRowsWarning xsi:nil="1"/>
    <successMessages xsi:nil="1"/>
    <warnMessages xsi:nil="1"/>
    <errorMessagesAsString>[invoke of the implementing class not implemented yet.]</errorMessagesAsString>
   </result>
  </ns1:determinationOfDeterministicRequirementsResponse>
 </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

There is a method 'public String getErrorMessagesAsString()' in class ServiceResponse, but it does not return a class property directly. It returns the errorMessages string array as one string.
So I think jwsdp is correct that it should not be in the soap response.
column293: 05/Jul/05 8:46 AM;thomas.diesler;Please show us how the complex schema type ServiceResponse is mapped to Java in jaxrpc-mapping.xml. Since wscompile relies on reflection it may be possible that there is a mapping for errorMessagesAsString defined.
column294:
05/Jul/05 1:53 PM;lafr;The mapping file, also generated by wscompile.
It does not contain a mapping for errorMessagesAsString.
column295: 06/Jul/05 4:01 AM;thomas.diesler;Please also attach biz.mbisoftware.fn.wstypes.ServiceResponse
column296: 06/Jul/05 4:02 PM;lafr;OK, here it is.
column298:
30/Oct/05 9:02 AM;lafr;I checked this with my example.
Now the SOAP message is OK.
Thanks.

column1: Deployment interceptor cannot fail deployment
column11:
Show my open issues sorted by version.

Bug only filters:
All open bugs
Native stack open bugs
CXF stack open bugs
column54:
The WebServiceInterceptor delegates to the appropriate web service deployers for EJB, EJB3, WAR endpoints. An invalid endpoint configuration that causes an exception during the deployment process does not take the entire deployment down.

The deployment is left in the incomplete deployment list, which denies redeployment of the same package.

IMHO, any uncought exception in a deployment interceptor should fail the entire deployment.
column293:
24/Jun/05 11:52 AM;dimitris;The interceptor fails the deployment normally, but we need to undeploy to remove the FAILED deployment context from the MainDeployer.

This is normal behaviour seen when we directly deploy URLs with the MainDeployer, rather than dropping packages to ./deploy, in which case the scanner will undeploy()/deploy().

So org.jboss.test.webservice.jbas897.JBAS897TestCase is fixed in HEAD.

There is also a new baseclass org.jboss.deployment.SubDeployerInterceptorSupport
that handles the dynamic interceptor attachment/detachment to one or more SubDeployers.

This is described in the linked JIRA tasks.

column296:
08/Jun/05 10:18 AM;thomas.diesler;jaxrpc-mapping.xml does not need to contain mappings for standard jaxrpc types. wscompile does not generate such mappings either.

Removing this mapping, lets me deploy your endpoint.

    <java-xml-type-mapping>
        <java-type>int</java-type>
        <root-type-qname xmlns:rtq="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">rtq:int</root-type-qname>
