column297:
13/Jan/10 2:54 PM;kukeltje;Thanks for the addition of the java code. It really plays an important role HOW things are done in the api. I still have a remark though. It is not a unit test (although everything is embedded, thanks) the JbpmTestCase class does a lot of these things for you. So you can make even less mistakes ;-). Have a look: 

http://fisheye.jboss.org/browse/JbpmSvn/jbpm4/trunk/modules/test-db/src/test/java/org/jbpm/test/activities/ForkJoinInSameTransactionTest.java

I initially get the same error as you do on hsqldb. So I'll see what causes this. Might be a user error or a bug.
column298: 13/Jan/10 3:24 PM;kukeltje;Adapted real testcase that still demonstrates the problem...
column299: 13/Jan/10 3:48 PM;kukeltje;If an additional state is added between the join and end, it works. So it looks like it is related to https://jira.jboss.org/jira/browse/JBPM-2570 https://jira.jboss.org/jira/browse/JBPM-2335
column300: 13/Jan/10 7:25 PM;kukeltje;Have been digging into this, but the internals of jBPM/PVM in this regard are kind of unkown to me. It definately is related to the combination of a join, task with swimlane and going to an end state.
column301: 14/Jan/10 1:50 AM;atim;Thank you for your attention to this problem. This error occurs when real business process was executed. Unfortunately there is no state or task between join and end. You right - it related to the combination of task with swimlane and going to an end from join. It works too if task2A and task2B (in attached example) havn't swimlanes.
column302:
18/Jan/10 7:02 PM;kukeltje;I have some more info....  the first thing is that there is a kind of workaround where you do not need to make changes to the jBPM source. Make the join async by adding the continue attribute to it with the value 'async'. 

Now the real cause is that the task is not fully ended when the process reaches the end state. This should not be a problem since all child executions should be ended first. Strange thing is that the query for the active process instance, or any other query triggers a hibernate flush so all kinds of updates/deletes are done. In one of these, the swimlane is to be deleted, but since the not deleted task still references it, a constraint violation is thrown.

What solves this is explicitly setting the swimlane to 'null' in the execute method of the TaskActivity. Not sure what impact this has on the rest, but at least all tests are still green.
column303: 19/Jan/10 8:07 AM;atim;Sorry, but I not understand how can I set the swimlane to 'null' in the execute method of the TaskActivity. Give an example, please.
column304: 19/Jan/10 8:54 AM;kukeltje;By downloading the jBPM source, changing that class, building it and running it. In other words, it is maybe not a real solution for you, but on for the 4.4 release. You should use the workaround I think
column305: 20/Jan/10 7:43 AM;kukeltje;So deleting the task earlier would have been an acceptable solution to... Hmm... tried that myself and indeed worked (tests still green) but was afraid of the possible consequences...
column306: 21/Jan/10 5:26 AM;atim;Thanks. I will try to use the workaround. Will the bug be fixed in release 4.4?
column307: 21/Jan/10 7:18 AM;kukeltje;Yes. as you can see in the 'fix version' field at the top

column1: Make duedate accept EL and support business duration calculations
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
jBPM 3 already supported this syntax for duedate expressions (since JBPM-1097):
<timer duedate='#{targetDate} + 1 business day' />

It would be nice to have this feature in jBPM 4 too.

In addition, it should also support subtractions of business durations, which was not implemented in jBPM 3 (see JBPM-1776):
<timer duedate='#{targetDate} - 1 business day' />
column56: Implemented in code and wrote documentation;20/Jan/10 6:20 AM;kukeltje;21600
column293:
19/Jan/10 12:16 PM;kukeltje;I've almost implemented this for jBPM 4 (partial copy past ;-))

The negative business durations are still not supported since this is something for the business calendar...  Although I understand the usecase mentioned in JBPM-1776, I have no time to implement it. Please file a new issue for this...

Negative durations are supported. I'll make sure it is clearly stated in the documentation. (luckily copy past to ;-))
column294: 19/Jan/10 2:40 PM;kukeltje;Ok, implemented this. Will check it in soon, but there is one remarkable thing, duedate on tasks is not parsed. It is also not present in the docs as an attribute on task, but task query has a nice example selecting tasks and sorting them on duedate.... strange... So duedate for tasks is not supported yet....
column295: 20/Jan/10 2:44 AM;tom.baeyens;i believe there is another issue planned for this release that is about fixing the duedate for tasks

column1: Ability to add timer to transitions in <custom> activity in the same way that they can be added to the <state> task.
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54: It should be possible to add a <timer> as the child of the <transition> element contained within a <custom> activity in the same manner that it is for <state> activities. If a custom activity executes a waitForSignal() inside the execute() element (as is the case in our use case) then we need to be able to put a timeout on this activity such that if no signal is recieved within a specified period the timeout will fire and action can be taken. This is possible in a <state> activity but currently not in the custom activity.
column293: 31/Dec/09 8:26 AM;jedizippy;Changing our custom actvity to a state had the effect of allowing the timers to work but then the signalling does not work. The signalling was working fine when it was a custom activity.
column294:
06/Jan/10 3:54 PM;kukeltje;Last comment by Martin should be ignored, this was due to a usererror.

'custom' element should be changed to:

			<element name="custom">
				<annotation>
					<documentation>Uses a user defined, custom implementation of
						ActivityBehaviour
        </documentation>
				</annotation>
				<complexType>
					<complexContent>
						<extension base="tns:wireObjectType">
							<sequence>
								<element ref="tns:on" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" />
								<element name="transition" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded">
									<complexType>
										<complexContent>
											<extension base="tns:transitionType">
												<sequence>
													<element ref="tns:timer" minOccurs="0" />
												</sequence>
											</extension>
										</complexContent>
									</complexType>
								</element>
							</sequence>
							<attributeGroup ref="tns:activityAttributes" />
						</extension>
					</complexContent>
				</complexType>
			</element>

column1: jbpm4 user guide : small errors in doc
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
forum : http://www.jboss.org/index.html?module=bb&op=viewtopic&t=159875

two points I noticed :

1/
http://docs.jboss.com/jbpm/v4.0/userguide/html_single/#deployingaprocess

the given example is :
"
long deploymentDbid = repositoryService.createDeployment()
.addResourceFromClasspath("org/jbpm/examples/services/Order.jpdl.xml")
.deploy();
"

but in fact deploy() returns a String ;-)

could someone correct it ? 


2/
same kind of inaccurracy : the id in table 5.1 and 5.2 has a format like
{key}:{version} (with : between key and version)
whereas the text above states :
"The id will have format {key}-{version} with a dash between key and version"
and paragraph 5.6.2 seems to use this "dash" format too 



if I may insist doc quality really matters... ;-) 


a third point :

3/  in § 6.2.3.1. Decision conditions there should be an image with url 
http://docs.jboss.com/jbpm/v4.0/userguide/html_single/images/process.decision.png

but there is nothing at this URL, so that the image does not show. I suppose the correct URL would be :
http://docs.jboss.com/jbpm/v4.0/userguide/html_single/images/process.exclusive.png

idem with the two follwing images

4/ Figure 6.20 is not accurate eithet, I'd say

5/ Figure 6.24 also not correct  

6/ in the listings and comments §6.5.1. Event listener example there is 
"LogListener will maintain a list of logs in a static member field:"
but it is obviously not a static field. But those comments may be confusing, because the concept of process variable is new for most reader, I think. Plus it is wrong ;-)

column1: Join  multiplicity  FIX
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54: the JPDL JoinBinding  is broken.  the string multiplicity is spelled wrong, i.e. "multiplicicty".  This causes the multiplicity to never be set in the JoinActivity, so it always has a default value.   To reproduce this, simply create a process which has a join which has several possible incoming transitions, and set the multiplicity to something.
column56: added a constant MULTIPLICITY to the JoinBinding class to avoid spelling errors.;10/Jul/09 2:15 PM;kedzie;600
column293: 10/Jul/09 2:14 PM;kedzie;updated JoinBinding class, which spells "multiplicity" correctly.
column294: 14/Jul/09 6:58 AM;tom.baeyens;Joram,  make sure you make a test for this.
column295:
16/Jul/09 2:58 AM;jbarrez;Fixed typo in JoinBinding + added tests for join multiplicity

Mark: thanks for the excellent issue post!

column1: Fork Activity FIX.  PVM trunk.
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54: Fork activity is broken in the jbpm4 pvm module under the svn trunk.  This is caused by a recent commit to org.jbpm.pvm.internal.model.DefaultIdGenerator.   My patch is included.   The hibernate save happens before the execution.id is set, resulting in a UniqueConstraintException on the commit.
column56: Set the execution.id before the hibernate save.  Seems to be fixed.  the fork now works.;09/Jul/09 11:48 AM;kedzie;1800
column293: 09/Jul/09 11:46 AM;kedzie;New java source for DefaultIdGenerator that sets the execution.id before the hibernate save.  avoiding the UniqueConstraintException.   Also included an svn patch.
column294:
09/Jul/09 12:45 PM;jbarrez;Mark,

Do you have an example process in which the fork activity fails?

The fork tests in our test suite aren't failing.
column295:
10/Jul/09 2:10 PM;kedzie;my process looks like this:  

 <fork g="670,397,48,48" name="fork1">
      <transition name="fork_upgrade" to="Add Upgrade Work Item"/>
      <transition name="fork_conversion" to="Conversion Scheduled"/>
   </fork>
...
   <join name="join1" g="817,123,48,48"  multiplicity="2">
      <transition to="Set Status Completed"/>
   </join>

I am running in JBoss 5.1.0.GA.  Using Microsoft SQL Server (by the way I have db schema scripts for mssql).  A recent commit to DefaultIdGenerator added a call to session.save to save the new child process.  But the save call was happening before the id was set on the execution.  This resulted in a UniqueConstraint exception when saving the child process.  all i did set the child execution's id before the save occurs.      I also fixed a separate fork/join issue which shouldn't work in your tests.  i'll make a separate JIRA issue.
column296:
11/Jul/09 6:53 AM;tom.baeyens;Mark,

When we applied your fix, we got a number of errors on the test suite.

Please include the full process and the full test case.  then we have more chance that we can reproduce this.  as long as we cannot reproduce this problem, we cannot include the fix.

regards, tom.
column297: 14/Jul/09 5:58 PM;kedzie;maybe it is something to due with the fact i'm using SQL Server?   i'll try and get a test case goin.

column1: Some bidirectional associations do not use inverse="true"
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
Currently couple of bidirectional associations do not use inverse="true" on one-to-many side (collection)

The examples are 
- ProcessInstance.instances
- CompositeLog.children

I'm sure there are more of them.
Lack of inverse="true" results in additional "UPDATE" statement being issued by hibernate to create a relationship from a one-to-many side.
This is not necessary when java code is updating both ends of an association.

Some use-cases where lots of new processes are being created would see a performance improvement.
CompositeLog logging overhead will decrease (only INSERT will be issued - no UPDATE)

Please consider reviewing all of your bidirectional associations with respect to this optimization.
column55: Tested with MySQL with query log enabled in JUnit.
column56:
Review bidirectional associations. Define one end as inverse or disable inserts and updates, where needed. The affected associations were:
* Action.event
* Node.superState and .arrivingTransitions
* ProcessDefinition.definitions
* Transition.from
* Comment.token and .taskInstance
* RuntimeAction.processInstance
* TaskNode.tasks
* ProcessLog.parent
* ModuleInstance.processInstance;13/Dec/10 8:32 PM;aguizar;9000
column293: 08/Dec/10 1:35 PM;aguizar;This one is *critical* in order to deliver the best possible performance, especially given the simplicity and innocuousness of the solution.

column1: jobexecutor (threads) not stopped when JobExecutorServlet is destroyed
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
According to the javadoc of the jobexecutor servlet:

/**
 * starts the job executor on init and closes the 
 * jbpm configuration upon destroy.  The closing of the
 * jbpm configuration will also shut down the job executor 
 * thread pool. 

There is no destroy method, so nothing wil happen. Threads keep running. Secondly, I'm not sure closing the jBPM context is what we want there. Can't we just call jobExecutor.stop()? In case we just want to stop it? 

A stop/start method on the servlet with a param is also handy.... e.g. from the webconsole????

column1: support templates for assignment and reminder mail
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54: jBPM supports templates for mail nodes and mail actions, but not for task assignment and reminder mail. In our company we've run into this and (ab)use mail nodes now to send a kind of assignment mail. Would be nice if templates are supported as well for reminders and assignment mail
column56:
took me 1 hour to 'fix' this as proposed AND have a deploy (parse) time warning if a configured mail template is not found.

Still have to finish the tests for this, but this seems very interesting.;08/May/08 6:37 PM;kukeltje;3600
column293: 08/May/08 5:22 PM;kukeltje;an easy change without having to introduce an explicit template attribute is to have the core search for a 'task-reminder-<taskname>' template first and if none found, use the default 'task-reminder' template. Any comments? This could be implemented very easily and extended in 3.3  (or 4) to use explicit templates. But we could also leave it in 3.3/4 like proposed here
column294: 08/May/08 5:26 PM;kukeltje;hmm... I see that the template is only resolved run-time (not deploy time), so it is not possible to detect a non existent template and to a fall back. Would it be better to change this to do a deploy time check? I personally think so.
column296: 14/May/08 12:02 PM;kukeltje;3.2.3 was to ambitious as it seems, 3.2.4 is ok. Better than 3.3

column1: EL duedate extension should also accept Calendar
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.

column1: Make duedate accept EL in addition to the already existing businesscalendar
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
currently the duedate in a timer and task only accept a businesscalendar. Sometimes (often?) you want it to be based on e.g. a processvariable as well. So a format of

<timer name="pension" duedate="#{dateOfBirth} + 65 years"></timer>
<timer name="pensionReminder" duedate="#{dateOfBirth} - 1 year"></timer>
<timer name="pension" duedate="#{pensionDate}"></timer>

Are examples of how it should work (and does now if using the cvs version)

Changes still needed:
- accept Calendar besides date (String will not be done by me because of format issues
- generate an exception if in the old duedate format, a minus is prefixed. (currently the date will be in the past!!!)
- ...
column293: 12/Dec/07 8:26 PM;kukeltje;Issue of dates in the past not solved. Can also happen with a basedate.... So behaviour currently is undefined

column1: session closed before jbpmContext close
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
Session hsession = jbpmContext.getSession();
try {            
            hsession.save(businessReport);
            ProcessDefinition pd = jbpmContext.getGraphSession().findLatestProcessDefinition("RNDFProcess");
            ProcessInstance pi = pd.createProcessInstance();
            //pi.getContextInstance().setVariable("username", from_username);
            TaskInstance ti = pi.getTaskMgmtInstance().createStartTaskInstance();
            jbpmContext.close();//here is exception
            ti.setVariable("report_id", businessReport.getReportId());
            ti.end();
} catch (Exception e) {
	System.out.println("Unknown error in the SaveGo().");
	e.printStackTrace();
	jbpmContext.setRollbackOnly();
}finally{
            jbpmContext.close();
}

column1: manage process definitions
column11: jBPM is a flexible business process management suite.
column54:
One entry in the jBPM Administration submenu should be 'Manage Process Definitions'.

Following features should be offered in this page

* deploy a new process archive (file upload)
* view all the versions of all process definitions.
* (re)bind subprocesses to super processes
* delete process definitions
* show all process instances for a given process definition

This will probably by too much for one page.  I would prefer a split of the page into submenuitems just like the JEMS projects in the jboss.org site (see attachment)

column297:
15/Oct/05 5:03 PM;kukeltje;
I currently have something working on this part. I'ts all jsf based and the forms.xml is not there just the faces-conig.xml

The mapping between the process and the forms is done via the state names and transition names. Each task can have it's own form by  giving an outcome from the taslist the same name as the task-instance (this requires tasknames to be unique in the process is this a problem???, maybe a reason to not use the name as visible items but the description or use the name but introduces an 'id'... hmmm)

One can also add specific pages as the outcome of a taskpage by giving the outcome the same name as the transition. So one can easilly add a 'thank you for submitting....' or anything like that. 

It's also possible to show the process variables at any place in the form by using a tag like <t:inputText value="#{taskBean.formParameter['<variable-name>']}" 

If nothing is specified for the task, the current default task page is shown. If nothing is specified for the transitions, the default is to directly go to the tasklist as it is currently working

The nice thing is that we do not have to build a page editor/designer since ANY jsf capable designer (like myeclipse or exadel or bea Nitrox) Maybe some validator could be build that checks the outcomes in the faces-config and compares them to state/transition names.

regards, tom.

column1: EAP 5.0 Transactions Web Services Programmers Guide derived from wrong release
column11: Application Edition of the JBoss Enterprise Platform versions 4 and 5
column54:
The version of the Transactions Web Services Programmers Guide linked from the EAP product page http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Enterprise_Application_Platform/ is based on the openoffice document taken from JBossTS 4.3.0. The version which should have been used is the release from which the the JBossTS XTS code is taken, currently 4.6.1.GA.CP01. This is substantially revised and contains extra, critical sections missing from the older version.

If this guide is included in the downloadable EAP bundle then it would be prudent also to verify that the bundle contains the correct version.

column1: Server does not start if PATH contains directories with spaces
column11: Application Edition of the JBoss Enterprise Platform versions 4 and 5
column54:
I installed EAP a tried to run it by clicking a desktop icon. I started the server but then it ends up with this error.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Files\Java\jdk1/6/0_1
1\bin;C:\testing\apache-ant-1/7/0\bin;C:\WINDOWS\MsNfs\;C:\WINDOWS\SUA\common\;C
:\WINDOWS\SUA\usr\lib\;C:\Program
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;C:\testi
ng\apache-ant-1.7.0\bin;C:\WINDOWS\MsNfs\;C:\WINDOWS\SUA\common\;C:\WINDOWS\SUA\
usr\lib\;C:\Program
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:252)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:320)
Could not find the main class: Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;C:\testing\apache-ant-
1.7.0\bin;C:\WINDOWS\MsNfs\;C:\WINDOWS\SUA\common\;C:\WINDOWS\SUA\usr\lib\;C:\Pr
ogram.  Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

Problem is probably in script, which starts server (run.bat). This script probably can not process correctly PATH variable, when this variable contains directories with spaces. When Java is installed in directory containing space (Program Files) and this directory path is on PATH, the server ends up with error. But this error may be generated by any directory with spaces in name  when such directory  is added to PATH variable.
column57: Testing GUI installer, starting server through desktop icon;11/Aug/09 3:10 AM;bbelovic;9000
column288: This issue occurs mainly on windows machines. The solution is not using spaces in directory names which are used in environment variables (especially in PATH)
column293: 11/Aug/09 11:23 AM;patrickmacdonald;As mentioned, the installation guide makes note of the fact that you shouldn't have spaces.
column294: 13/Aug/09 6:29 AM;bbelovic;I think we dont understand each other. I installed the server into directory without spaces. When PATH variable contains a path to Java and Java is installed in directory with spaces in its name (Program Files), the server ends up with exception mentioned above. When I moved Java installation to directory without spaces in its name, the server started correctly. So the main problem is probably with Java installation path, when it contains spaces and is included in PATH variable.
column295: 13/Aug/09 7:28 AM;mbaluch;Actually the problem may be connected to all programs which have a record in the path variable and contain spaces in the disk location. I think it would be appropriate to escape all spaces in the Path variable somehow.

column1: Logger in HTTPClientInvoker should be static
column11: Application Edition of the JBoss Enterprise Platform versions 4 and 5
column54:
Fix for http://jira.jboss.com/jira/browse/JBREM-750

This JIRA has become the roll-up for the following:

JBPAPP-364 (Logger in HTTPClientInvoker should be static)
JBPAPP-415 (Address in WSDL - Port value is -1 when server is requested with default port 80)
JBPAPP-387 (jms server failover with tibco ems)
JBPAPP-363 (Configurable JSESSIONID Cookie Name)
column257:
PATCH NAME:
        JBPAPP-364
PRODUCT NAME:
        JBoss EAP / Application Platform
VERSION:
       4.2.0 CP01
DESCRIPTION:
For JBPAPP-364
Corrects NPE coming from uninitialized (non static) Logger

For JBPAPP-415
Corrects WSDL URL 

For JBPAPP-387
Corrects failover problem when integrating with TIBCO EMS 

JBPAPP-363
Supports configurable JSESSIONID

MANUAL INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS:
For JBPAPP-364
Copy the attached jboss-remoting.jar file over the version in %JBOSS_HOME%/client, %JBOSS_HOME%/server/default/lib, %JBOSS_HOME%/server/all/lib, and %JBOSS_HOME%/server/production/lib of a JBoss EAP 4.2.0 installation.

For JBPAPP-415
Copy the attached jbossws-client.jar file over the version in %JBOSS_HOME%/client and the attached jbossws-core.jar file over the version in %JBOSS_HOME%/server/%SERVER_CONFIG%/deploy/jbossws.sar of a JBoss EAP 4.2.0 CP01 installation.

For JBPAPP-387
For EJB 2.x MDBs, replace your JBOSS_HOME/server/<server-config>/lib with this jboss.jar To configure this capability you will need to add three elements to your jboss.xml descriptor:

<ForceClearOnShutdown>true | false</ForceClearOnShutdown>

This will enable the general behavior to move past the issue of outstanding Server Sessions

<ForceClearInterval>n milliseconds</ForceClearInterval>

This value, in milliseconds is the amount of wait time between each attempt to clear the ServerSessionPool. This should be set to something reasonable for your environment, I would suggest starting with something like 5ms and incrementing this value if this is too short.

<ForceClearAttempts>n attempts</ForceClearAttempts>

This is the number of attempts that JBoss will allow in waiting for the pool to clear. Once this threshhold has been met, the pool will be recycled regardless of whether or not there is outstanding work in the pool.

For EJB 3.0 MDBs, replace your JBOSS_HOME/server/<server-config>/deploy/jms with the attached jms-ra.rar To configure this capability you will need to add new ActivationConfigProperties forceClearOnShutdown, forceClearInterval, and forceClearAttempts. 

JBPAPP-363
Copy the attached jbossweb.jar file over the version in %JBOSS_HOME%/server/%SERVER_CONFIG%/deploy/jboss-web.deployer of a JBoss EAP 4.2.0 CP01 installation. 

COMPATIBILITY:
        None
DEPENDENCIES:
       JBoss EAP 4.2.0 CP01
SUPERSEDES:
        None
SUPERSEDED BY:
        None
CREATOR:
        Ron Sigal, William DeCoste
DATE:
        Tue 10/23/2007 15:34:47

column1: EJBTHREE-994 - Multiple remote bindings is not working
column11: Application Edition of the JBoss Enterprise Platform versions 4 and 5
column54:
With a change in EJBTHREE-795 multiple remote bindings on a bean have stopped working.

All remote proxy factories from a single bean are registered into the dispatcher using a single target id.

24/Feb/06 4:40 PM;mazz;Ryan,  can someone over there take a look at this?

Trying to test HA - its failing when I attempt to import my first platform.  Going against oracle 10g - the first few comments in here were due to an oracle misconfiguration, we fixed that.  But we are now getting other things.
column300: 01/Mar/06 2:44 PM;leec;Mazz, this is looking like maybe the data got corrupted?  There appears to be some entity look up errors, etc.  Are you getting this error importing the platform after you've started fresh without the database problems?  Is the agent pointing to the master node or the data node?  (I don't mean where you import, as you would always import on the master node, where the GUI is)
column301:
01/Mar/06 4:28 PM;mazz;I did this twice, and the same thing happened both times:

1) install master node fresh (told it to "overwrite/create new database")
2) install data node fresh (told it to "update" database)
3) start master and data node servers
4) start master and data node agents
5) import the agent (and only the agent)

I get the error at this point - the dashboard shows me an error and the log is attached.  I can't remember if the agent was pointing to the master or data node.

But it was definitely with a clean slate database.  Fresh install without database problems.
column302:
01/Mar/06 6:05 PM;jsachs;Mazz,
I was not able to reproduce the problem using the 2.2.22 installer against an Oracle 9i database.

Steps I took:
1. install cluster master on Linux box A against Oracle 9i (overwrite/create new)
2. start master server
3. install data processor on Linux box B (upgrade database)
4. start data processor
5. install agent pointing to data processor
6. import the platform and agent server

I get no dashboard error and all else appears to be working normally (platform services auto-discovered, can navigate to all resources, see green lights, etc)
column303: 02/Mar/06 8:58 AM;mazz;Ok, maybe we'll try with  Postgres.  We were going against Oracle 10g - to avoid any possible problems that might arise with Oracle access, we'll try against Postgres.
column304:
02/Mar/06 2:46 PM;mazz;I just realized something as I am trying to replciate this again.

When I setup the agent, the answer to the question, "What IP should the JON server use to contact the agent", I set it to 127.0.0.1

I did that for both agents.

I wonder if the same IP for both agents causes the problem.  they are both obviously auto-discovered and make their way to the AI tables.
column305: 02/Mar/06 3:01 PM;jsachs;That is the problem.  Specify a real ip address so the server knows how to contact the agents.  The server->agent communication is done master->agent.  So the master would be trying to communicate with the remote agent over 127.0.0.1 and getting access denied.  I dont even recommend putting 127.0.0.1 as the communication interface for the agent on the master server platform.  I'll update the HA docs to reflect this.  If you have any other info you would like to see in the HA docs, let me know.

column308:
02/Mar/06 4:03 PM;mazz;OK.  I have a postgres standalone on my master node.  Install master and data node.  Start both servers and agents.

I can now import both agents.

However, the data node agent is "red" in the GUI.  I am seeing this data node server log:

14:35:33,176 ERROR [SRNCache] Agent's reporting for non-existing entity: 1:10002
14:35:33,176 ERROR [SRNCache] Agent's reporting for non-existing entity: 2:10007

1:10002 is the data node platform. 2:10007 is the data node's agent resource.

column316:
02/Mar/06 6:38 PM;mazz;Looking better.

Our data node's clock was about 40 minutes behind the master node.  Once we synced the clocks, and I deleted/reimported the agent, all lights turned green.
column317: 02/Mar/06 7:35 PM;jsachs;Good, because I tried again to reproduce and could not.  Was able to import resources, collect metrics, delete resources, etc
column318:
02/Mar/06 7:55 PM;mazz;Was definitely due to the clocks being out of sync.  At least this exercise found some things that we need to document:

a)  the agent IP setting must NOT be considered local to the datanode, thus you cannot use localhost/127.0.0.1 - it must be routable by the MASTER node (this is important because the docs (AFAIK) just state that the agentIP setting needs to be routable by the "Server".  This is an important distinction because now the Server MASTER has to be on the same subnet as (or at least must be able ot see) all ALL Agents.

b) we need to call out more strongly that all clocks must be in sync.  Originally we thought this was only so metrics don't get skewed in time.  But it also affects resource importation.
column319: 07/Mar/06 11:25 AM;mazz;HA issues described here have been taken care of.  There is another problem but I'll doc in another JIRA.  We can close this issue.

column1: Postgres detected deadlock
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Client problem. Client is seeing logs of deadlock errors in the server log.

   org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR:  deadlock detected

sf issue: https://na1.salesforce.com/50030000001jyVu


I noticed that the RtManagerEJBImpl.addData method is marked NOTSUPPORTED, but the jdbc stuff is using a local-tx. This probably means that the connection is not be enrolled in the current transaction (from the MDB MonitorRTEJBImpl.onMessage) and therefore probably running in autocommit mode.


The interesting bits from the hqdb.log is (which happens many times:

ERROR:  deadlock detected
DETAIL:  Process 24872 waits for ShareLock on transaction 113386174; blocked by process 24639.
	Process 24639 waits for ShareLock on transaction 113386230; blocked by process 24872.
CONTEXT:  SQL statement "SELECT 1 FROM ONLY "public"."eam_error_code" x WHERE "id" = $1 FOR UPDATE OF x"


The other interesting thing is:
LOG:  checkpoints are occurring too frequently (4 seconds apart)
HINT:  Consider increasing the configuration parameter "checkpoint_segments".

Perhaps we need to up the checkpoint_segments to more like 10-30 as some recommend for large feeds of data.
column56: Agreed.  Mark transaction type as REQUIRED and fix transaction declarations for other methods.;30/Jan/06 12:59 PM;leec;900
column293: 10/Jan/06 4:35 PM;ghinkle;Server log with deadlock errors
column295:
26/Jan/06 3:09 PM;rpm;
Assign to Charles to take a look.
column296: 27/Jan/06 3:01 PM;leec;I think this was a bad decision to mark this as NOTSUPPORTED given the multiple SELECT and INSERT statements in the code.  This definitely has the potential to deadlock.  The original author of this probably was modeling it after DataManager's addData, which has since been marked as NEVER, because it's meant to do single INSERT at a time and autocommit.  I'm inclined to either mark this method as REQUIRES or SUPPORTS.  Thoughts?
column297: 27/Jan/06 3:05 PM;leec;Actually, on a closer look, it's declared incorrect.  It has "@ejb:transaction-type="NOTSUPPORTED"" rather than "@ejb:transaction type="NOTSUPPORTED"", which means that it's using SUPPORTS.  However, the logic is still not good.  I'm inclined to change this to REQUIRESNEW rather than NOTSUPPORTED anyways.
column298:
27/Jan/06 3:54 PM;ghinkle;Yea, this is a bit strange. It definitely seems like its enlisting in the transaction as it should be. I think REQUIRES is probably the way to go... this should be part of the MDB onMessage transaction.


Now the DataManagerEJB i'm a little confused on. Its using the local-tx defined datasource, but managing the txn. I think if your going to do manual tx mgmt you should be using a no-tx datasource.

Also, I noticed that the isolation level appears to not be properly set in either case. Checking the connection with a debugger shows its actually a TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITED isolation level. Thoughts?
column299: 27/Jan/06 4:03 PM;ghinkle;Of course postgres doesn't support READ_UNCOMMITED anyway, so never mind about that part.
column300: 30/Jan/06 1:09 PM;leec;Transaction type changes will be in 2.2.22

column1: Update Agent to support v1.4 JRE's not from Sun
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54: If  I understood the comments from JBNMAN-314 correctly we can't run the JBN EM agent on a v1.4 JRE which does not come from Sun. Won't Hyperic also need this feature so in the futue you can support things like WAS6.0 on AIX which I believe requires v1.4.2 of IBMs JDK?
column293:
07/Dec/05 2:15 PM;dougmaceachern;I have the agent working w/ IBM 1.4 JRE.  Changes so far:
- changed agent certificate generation code to use keytool rather using deprecated com.sun classes
- changed com.sun.ssl.* usage to javax.ssl.* (agent and lather)
- removed lib/jdk1.3-compat libs

I just need to do some more testing and cleanup.
Also, on our side of the problem, works fine w/ WebSphere 5.1, not sure yet what we'll do about WebSphere 4.0
Since this does not impact you guys, I expect the changes to be in the next code drop, I'll mark this resolved once they are in.
column294: 07/Dec/05 2:20 PM;dougmaceachern;I will also update the bundled AIX jre to the latest 1.4 from IBM
column295: 07/Dec/05 7:05 PM;dougmaceachern;The IBM 1.4.2 jre only works on AIX 5.1, 5.2 and 5.3.  It does not work on 4.3.x.  This is an issue for us, can you guys checks which version(s) your AIX customers are using?
column296: 07/Dec/05 8:03 PM;ghinkle;Yea, that would figure... well, if this is correct [http://www.softwaredevelopment.ca/fyios.shtml] IBM doesn't offer support for AIX 4.x anymore so I would think we could make the same decision. It was released over six years ago (though there probably are plenty of people still using it). The one AIX support customer said 5.2.. so it'd be ok for them.
column297:
13/Dec/05 4:50 PM;dougmaceachern;The 2.1.17 build contains changes for the 1st step, which is to use keytool instead of com.sun classes to generate the agent certificate.
I haven't yet included the rest of the changes, need to see if we can somehow continue to support 1.3 for WebSphere 4.0.  I can provide the current patch if you'd like it sooner that the next (2.1.18) drop.
column298: 13/Dec/05 4:54 PM;ccrouch;The next drop will be fine.
column299:
19/Dec/05 2:40 PM;dougmaceachern;All changes to support IBM 1.4 JRE will be in the 2.2.18 drop.  This includes the most current 1.4 AIX jre:
./jre/bin/java -version
java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM AIX build ca142-20050929a (SR3) (JIT enabled: jitc))

It is no longer possible to use the IBM 1.3 JRE.

column1: free files metric reporting total files on Solaris
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
I haven't tested this myself so I can't say if its true - but I figured I'd ask Hyperic if they already know about this; it seems pretty cut and dry what the customer says he is seeing.

Customer reports the following:

The Free Files metric reports the wrong numbers. It reports the total files instead of the number of free files available on the filesystem.  The agent and server is installed on a Solaris SPARC server.

Here is the output of the df.

-> df -g .
/ips (/dev/dsk/c0t1d0s4 ): 8192 block size 1024 frag size
8263732 total blocks 1245654 free blocks 1163018 available 502848 total files
73514 free files 8388620 filesys id
ufs fstype 0x00000004 flag 255 filename length

The Free files metric is reporting the 'total files' number and not the 'free files' number.
column293: 28/Nov/05 10:18 AM;mazz;Tested on Linux and the Total Files/Free Files metrics work fine.  No problems detected.  Need to check to see if SIGAR has a problem on Solaris.  If its not a problem with SIGAR on Solaris, I don't know what the problem could be.  I don't see how the customer could mistakenly see the wrong numbers in the GUI.
column294: 28/Nov/05 10:57 AM;dougmaceachern;The bug was in the solaris sigar impl.  Attached a binary with the fix, new binary w/ fix will be in the next drop.
column295: 28/Nov/05 7:45 PM;dougmaceachern;fix will be in the 2.1.15 drop

column1: SNMP v3 protocol should not require Authentication and Privacy
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
At the moment if you specify SNMP Protocol Version 3 in the SNMP Server Configuration Properties then you are required, for the SNMP traps to be sent successfully, to specify an authentication and privacy protocol, along with pass phrases for both. 
However requiring use of the privacy protocal forces all snmp traps to be encrypted before being sent, which increases usage of system and network resources. 

Some customers may want to run v3 protocol without encryption, or even authentication, so we should give them that option.
column56: Add option to have no authentication protocol.  Initialize protocols to NULL so that UsmUser will know to not authenticate messages;21/Nov/05 8:48 PM;leec;1800
column293:
18/Nov/05 12:29 PM;rpm;
To Charles.
column294: 21/Nov/05 8:49 PM;leec;Should be in next code drop

column1: No validation of SNMP properties
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
There are a number of SNMP settings which if not specified correctly will result in the configuration silently failing to work:

SNMP Server Configuration Properties
1) When specifying an OID if you don't use correct dotted notation, e.g. 1.2.3.4, then a NumberFormatException is produced in the logs, but no indication of error is given to the user.
2) If you are using v3 protocol and you don't specify a Authentication PassPhrase and a Privacy PassPhrase a NPE occurs, but no sign of any problem is shown to the user.

Per Alert SNMP Trap settings
3) When specifying an OID if you don't use correct dotted notation, e.g. 1.2.3.4, then a NumberFormatException is produced in the logs, but no indication of error is given to the user.


If 1) or 2) occurs then *any* alert which is configured to send SNMP traps will stop getting logged in the alert history when it fires.
If 3) occurs then just the alert whose SNMP settings are misconfigured will stop getting logged in the alert history when it fires.

Interestingly if you have a configuration problem which causes Alerts to stop getting put into the history, then on the Monitor tab, you will still see the Alert trigger conditions being logged as events!

On top of adding validation to prevent these configuration problems, a check should be made that Alert actions which throw things like NPE don't cause the Alerts to not get put into the history
column56: Validation of System Configuration page properties;21/Nov/05 1:43 AM;leec;3600
column57: Apply validation to specifying SNMP variables for individual alert definition;21/Nov/05 2:38 AM;leec;1800
column58: Validate engine and generic IDs to be integers.  However, they are not currently required.;22/Nov/05 5:16 PM;leec;900
column293:
18/Nov/05 12:20 PM;ccrouch;SNMP Server Configuration Properties (cont)

4) For v1 protocol, Generic ID needs to be an integer
5) For v1 protocol, Specific ID needs to be an integer

column1: drive letter getting lost, cannot discover things on Windows drive X: if agent is on drive Y:
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Customer said asked the following:

"For example, the config file that the scan is looking for is located on D:\Catalyst\jboss\server\catalyst\conf (on a specific node). If I do a file scan with scanDirs set to D:\, it doesn't seem to locate a jboss 3.2 server. A side question...if I want to specify two scanDirs, can I specify "C:\,D:\" or how do you specify?"

As of today, you cannot auto-discover things on one drive if the agent is installed on another drive.  If the agent is installed on drive C:, then you cannot autodiscover things on drive D:

We will need to correct this behavior.

3) when to q:\jboss\bin and ran Jboss, it started fine.

column1: you cannot delete LDAP users that did not previously exist in the DB
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
I'm playing around with the LDAP integration.  The registration of new users was neat - if I log in with a username that exists in LDAP but that user does NOT exist in the database yet, a "registration" page comes up when the user logs in.  The user can enter his name, phone number, etc. and a new user is created in the database.

If I log in as the admin user, and I view all users, I can now see the new user that was created from that LDAP user.  BUT!  I don't have a check box next to it that lets me delete that user.

This seems OK, since we don't allow our system to delete anything from the LDAP server.

However, how can we purge this user from *our* database?  For example, what happens when that user is actually deleted from the LDAP Server?  I just tried this - I deleted my user using my LDAP client tool.  I then tried to log in to JBN EM and as expected, the user was no longer allowed to log in, the login failed.

But, when I log into JBN EM as the admin user, I can still see that old LDAP user.  And I still can't delete it.

Unless I am missing something or I don't see the feature that allows you to delete these types of users, this should be considered a bug.  We need to be able to clean up the list of users by cleaning out old, obsolete LDAP users from our database.  I think we should still provide a checkbox next to that user that allows an admin to delete the user - but we should show a message to make it clear to the admin person that, "this only deletes the user's record in the JBN EM database, any record of this user that still exists in the LDAP server will remain as-is - the LDAP server is not modified by this delete action".
column56: Removed suppression of checkboxes next to LDAP user names so that they can be selected for removal.  Then, try-catch FinderException when we try to remove the Principal, because LDAP users do not have Principal.;27/Oct/05 5:46 PM;leec;3600

column1: Availability metric getting corrupted?

column54:
We have a client monitoring the availability of one of their solaris machines and they are seeing some strange results, e.g. availability indicator is red, while the availability metric is showing crazy things like "12,039,212.0%".

Having got them to send us the logs I found the following in the server.log


2005-10-17 11:07:51,825 ERROR [org.jboss.ejb.plugins.LogInterceptor] RuntimeException:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: 3505576.0 is not a valid availability state
	at net.hyperic.hq.bizapp.server.session.MeasurementBossEJBImpl.getSummarizedResourceAvailability(MeasurementBossEJBImpl.java:2825)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor488.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.jboss.ejb.StatelessSessionContainer$ContainerInterceptor.invoke(StatelessSessionContainer.java:683)
	at org.jboss.resource.connectionmanager.CachedConnectionInterceptor.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.StatelessSessionInstanceInterceptor.invoke(StatelessSessionInstanceInterceptor.java:72)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.AbstractTxInterceptor.invokeNext(AbstractTxInterceptor.java:84)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.TxInterceptorCMT.runWithTransactions(TxInterceptorCMT.java:267)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.TxInterceptorCMT.invoke(TxInterceptorCMT.java:128)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.SecurityInterceptor.invoke(SecurityInterceptor.java:118)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.LogInterceptor.invoke(LogInterceptor.java:191)
	at org.jboss.ejb.plugins.ProxyFactoryFinderInterceptor.invoke(ProxyFactoryFinderInterceptor.java:122)
	at org.jboss.ejb.StatelessSessionContainer.internalInvoke(StatelessSessionContainer.java:331)
	at org.jboss.ejb.Container.invoke(Container.java:700)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor136.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.jboss.mx.capability.ReflectedMBeanDispatcher.invoke(ReflectedMBeanDispatcher.java:284)
	at org.jboss.mx.server.MBeanServerImpl.invoke(MBeanServerImpl.java:546)
	at org.jboss.invocation.local.LocalInvoker.invoke(LocalInvoker.java:101)
	at org.jboss.invocation.InvokerInterceptor.invoke(InvokerInterceptor.java:90)

So it looks like an invalid value is getting into the DB. For the agent side on first glance everything looks ok, I see lots of availability metrics like this...

2005-10-17 11:08:54,665 DEBUG [ScheduleThread] [1:10051] Metric='Solaris:system.avail:Type=Platform:Availability' -> 1

But then I found...

2005-10-17 11:07:19,389 DEBUG [ScheduleThread] [2:10044] Metric='JBN Agent:camAgent:Monitor=agent:JVMFreeMemory' -> 3,505,576

Note the similarity between "3505576.0 is not a valid availability state" and "JVMFreeMemory' -> 3,505,576", it could be a coincidence, but I think its unlikely.
Searching further for 3,505,576 found it in the debug output of the SenderThread

2005-10-17 11:08:17,942 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=3,505,576

Now I don't know how relevant the 'd' and 'r' values are but for this particular pair, the logs show...

2005-10-17 11:08:17,929 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1

2005-10-17 11:10:21,790 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=2,291,088

2005-10-17 11:12:27,862 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1

2005-10-17 11:15:33,473 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1,131,112

2005-10-17 11:17:34,709 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1

2005-10-17 11:20:39,562 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=3,059,392

2005-10-17 11:21:42,007 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1
2005-10-17 11:21:42,039 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1

2005-10-17 11:25:45,727 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1,778,336

2005-10-17 11:26:47,223 DEBUG [SenderThread]     Data:  d=13760 r=13759 v=1

The values > 1 all look to be JVMFreeMemory metrics for the Agent. I'm guessing but it looks like valid platform availability data is sometimes getting overwritten by Agent specific JVM metrics???

Any thoughts on this issue?

I will attach a zip of agent and server logs.

column1: how to access a secured  jmx-invoker-adapter-service
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Have a customer that asks:

"We have secured the jmx-invoker-adapter-service. Therefore the JBoss Network Agent throws the following exception:

java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.SecurityException: Failed to authenticate principal=null, SecurityDomain=jmx-console

Is it possible to setup username/password with the JBoss Network EM or the Agent?"

So - the JBoss instance is locked down in such a way that requires credentials to remotely access the MBeanServer.  This seems appropriate - but I don't know of a way to get the agent to securely access this remote service.  Does the agent require the  jmx-invoker-adapter-service to be unsecured?
column293: 11/Oct/05 7:12 PM;dougmaceachern;Haven't run into this before, but I'm sure we can easily enhance the plugin to support this.  I just need to figure howto configure jboss this way, any pointers would be great.
column294:
11/Oct/05 7:24 PM;mazz;http://wiki.jboss.org/wiki/Wiki.jsp?page=HowDoISecureTheJMXConnection

This shows you how to configure the invoker so it is secured using a JAAS domain.

Your JMX client then needs to propogate the credentials to the server - using the initial context factory that contains Context.SECURITY_PRINCIPAL and Context.SECURITY_CREDENTIALS.  This is probably going to have to be config properties on the server, along side of the JNP URL.
column295:
11/Oct/05 9:29 PM;dougmaceachern;Added config properties for username/password.  User will have to fill these in and check the box for service discovery.
jboss-plugin.jar will need to be deployed to both the server and agent.

column1: duplicate service attempting to be added in inventory
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
I started the JBN EM Server and imported it and all its services.  I then started another JBoss 4.0.2 instance on the same box (its from another JBoss installation and I ran the "default" config).  Asked the agent to run another auto-discovery which detected the new JBoss 4.0.2 server.  I then imported the new JBoss server.

It failed to import the services - I got several exceptions in the server log that looked like this:

14:26:29,837 ERROR [RuntimeReportProcessor] RRP: failed to merge service: {serverId=10051 serviceTypeName=JBoss 4.0 JMS Destination customProperties=null productConfig=[B@911265 controlConfig=[B@4ed043 measurementConfig=[B@4adedd responseTimeConfig=null name=192.168.0.5 JBoss 4.0 default DLQ JMS Destination description=null id=null mTime=null cTime=1128536784710}
net.hyperic.hq.appdef.shared.AppdefDuplicateNameException
	at net.hyperic.hq.appdef.server.session.ServiceManagerEJBImpl.createService(ServiceManagerEJBImpl.java:145)

It looks like because I ran another JBoss 4.x server (which makes two on this box, the JBN EM Server is the other), the names of the services are the same (since both my servers are using the "default" config - so the service names all have the same host address - 192.168.0.5 - and config name - default).  This causes the server to barf when it tries to create the new services.

This will probably happen on ANY platform (not just the one running JBN EM Server).  If I have two JBoss instances, each running from different distributions but running with the same config (e.g. 'default'), this error will occur.
column56:
Fix sorting problem where resource names are presumed to be unique, so same name resources got filtered out.

Change the display to show host name rather than type when we do compatible servers or services.;30/Jan/06 4:40 PM;leec;10800
column293: 30/Nov/05 12:37 AM;ccrouch;Looks like JBNMAN-308 and JBNADM-295 are duplicates to me. Just need to decide which one to close
column294:
13/Dec/05 6:08 PM;ghinkle;After some consideration, I'm going to suggest that we get rid of the server name uniquness setup. 

a) Its only used for CLI access, and then only as a shortcut since an ID can be used

b) Appending the port number for JBoss instances would not necessarily fix all cases. File scan may indicate one port while, when running, a different port can be bound by cli argument.

c) It may be non-intuitive for plugin writers.


I suggest we remove the constraint and name access from the shell.

Mazz?
column295:
13/Dec/05 10:42 PM;mazz;To make sure I understand, you are suggesting that we remove the ability from the CLI to do things like:

cli-command -server "My Server Name"

as opposed to

cli-command -server 10001

I would recommend that we keep this ability.  Even though some of the names can get very long (and you might end up using the ID for those because they are tediously long) being able to specify the resource 'by name' is much more user friendly.  Otherwise, you'd have to run a separate command (resource list -server) and scan the list to find the one you want and find its ID.  Or, you'd have to be expected to know the ID ahead of time.  I wouldn't want to have to force the user to go learn the IDs of the resources he wants to manipulate.  Plus, the ID numbers can get confused since platforms, servers and services all share the same set of IDs (that is, a platform can have an ID of 10001 and a server can have an ID of 10001 as can a service).  It can get confusing if all the user has is a 5-digit number.  In addition, using names helps make scripts more readable (someone maintaining a CLI script would be able to make more sense of what the script is doing if he sees the commands operating on a human-readable name as opposed to a ubiquitous 5-digit number).

Perhaps the CLI should allow for -server "Name" but, if it detects a name is used by multiple resources (which is not going to happen the majority of the time anway) then the CLI can error out and say, "duplicate name - due to this ambiguity, please use the ID number instead" or something to that effect.

In short, still allow the use of the name but spit out an error if the name is not unique.
column296:
15/Dec/05 5:16 PM;rpm;
We are in the process of removing the unique constraints from the server and service tables.  It's a change that's long overdue.  This will also fix the issues seen in JBNMAN-341.

The behavior for the shell will be the same as before when using a name to lookup a resource when only a single match is found.  When multiple resources are found, an error message is printed with the possible ID's that match.

This should make it into 2.2.18, I'll update the ticket when it's complete.
column297:
16/Dec/05 11:46 AM;rpm;
The change to remove the unique constraints has been put in, and will be in 2.2.18.
column298:
27/Dec/05 11:22 AM;mazz;We need to pay close attention to this one and put it through a good deal of testing.  Looks like the change in keys is going to have some unintented consequences.  As the example below proves.  We need to check things about - how does group views look?  If I have a compatible group whose type has controls, and I have a group of resources with the same name, will the controls trigger properly on all of them?  What about alerts?  What about setting metric collection intervals (where resource A and A' (same name but different resources) have different intervals?  And other things I'm not able to think up right now...

Here's what I just saw - follow the replication procedures to see it:

1) Import two JBoss 4.x servers with the same server config name (in my case, I imported JBN Server 4.x and another JBoss 4.x server with the "default" config)
2) Go to Browse Resources and ask to create a group
3) create a compatible group of type JBoss 4.x JCA Connection Pool
4) notice that the screen to select the resources is correct - I can see two JCA Connection Pool resources each with the same name (I verified that I have two resources in inventory with the same name but different entity IDs - side note: would be cool if this selection screen made the names <a> links so I can click on them to go to their inventory tabs - as it stands now, there's no way for me to know what resources go to what servers, but that's a minor issue)
5) Select both JCA Connection pools that have the same name
6) Click the Right Arrow to move the resources into the group
7) ERROR! Notice that only ONE resource made it to the right side, as a member of the group.  It should have moved both over, but as this screen shows, only one made it.  Additionally, BOTH resources were removed from the left side (so I can't select them again) - that would be the correct behavior, if the right side had accepted both.

If, in step 5, you only selected one of the resources, clicked the right arrow button, then selected the second resource, and clicked the right arrow (in effect, add the resources as members to the group one at a time as opposed to both at the same time) the same problem occurs.  Only one shows up on the right side, and both are removed from the left side.
column299: 27/Dec/05 11:27 AM;mazz;Follow up on the last comment - even though the right side only shows one resource, if I hit OK - both actually DO make it into the group.  The group view shows me two members of the group - the two that I selected.  So, this looks like its just a rendering problem in the GUI.  But again, we'll need to look at the rest of the GUI to see if any other weirdness like this occurs.
column300:
29/Dec/05 1:52 PM;rpm;
Good catch Maz, we are currently investigating this issue.
column301:
29/Dec/05 4:53 PM;rpm;
As for your earlier questions, control actions, schedules, alerts, etc, are not affected by the names all being the same.  Everything in the backend uses entity id's, which are still unique.

As I see it, there are two problems here:

1) On the group add resources page, clicking on multiple names causes only a single name to show up on the right side.  The good news is that it still works, but it's likely a javascript issue that charles can fix pretty easily.  I'll see what he thinks.

2) It's impossible to tell what resource you are adding on the group add resources page.  You can work around this by going to the resource itself, then the inventory tab.  From there you can add the resource to any group you choose.  The fix for this could be making the link on the group pages clickable (as you suggest), or maybe adding some hover text to show the platform name and installpath.

30/Dec/05 12:34 AM;rpm;

19/Jan/06 11:53 AM;rpm;
Charles is handling Bug #9918
column304: 30/Jan/06 4:40 PM;leec;Fix should be available in 2.2.22
column305: 02/Feb/06 12:33 PM;mazz;very nice solution to both issues.  the GUI now works and the selection screen for the group members shows you the host server (in the case of service group) or the host platform (in the case of server group) in the list so you know what belongs to what.

column1: Error.jsp only dumps at most two layers of exceptions
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
It seems Error.jsp will only dump at most two layers of exceptions (the top most exception thrown and its cause).  For instances where there are more than two levels of exceptions, this will usually not be helpful (that is, where the cause exception has a cause itself, and so on).

Is it possible to get Error.jsp to dump ALL layers of exceptions?
column56: JSP file is misleading.  The root cause section is not accurate, most of the time it is NULL, because it only works when exception is a ServletException.  Furthermore, getStacktrace() uses Throwable's printStackTrace(PrintWriter s), which says "The backtrace for a throwable with an initialized, non-null cause should generally include the backtrace for the cause."  I think it ends up cutting off at 2 or 3 levels.  So from now on, we go through the nested causes reiteratively to make sure that all levels are displayed.;04/Jan/06 11:21 AM;leec;7200
column293:
05/Oct/05 3:07 PM;rpm;
Not sure if this is possible or not.. Pass to Charles.
column294: 06/Dec/05 4:49 PM;leec;Can you provide a test case where there are more errors not shown?  The exceptions are displayed with getStack() method.
column295: 06/Dec/05 7:34 PM;ccrouch;As discussed in the 12/6 meeting, Hyperic will work on a resolution for this along with JBNMAN-361
column296: 04/Jan/06 11:22 AM;leec;Code has been checked in and will be available post jboss-2_2_19_2006_01_03.

column300:
01/Oct/05 12:24 PM;dougmaceachern;Given that we haven't seen this problem on linux before, I'm hoping I can reproduce the problem by using the customer's /proc files.  The attached script will create a .tar.gz of /proc/*/{cmdline,stat,statm,status,maps}
Run like so:
% perl tar_proc.pl
files saved to /tmp/copy-proc.tar.gz
to cleanup, run: rm -rf /tmp/copy-proc

And please attach copy-proc.tar.gz to this ticket.
column301: 04/Oct/05 7:01 PM;ccrouch;Back to Greg to get required info from client
column302: 07/Oct/05 4:08 PM;mazz;attached are the results of the sigar run. The stack looks famililar with issue #JBNMAN-305.  I'm going to ask him for the /proc info - looks like we haven't asked him for that yet
column303:
07/Oct/05 7:42 PM;dougmaceachern;Using the /proc data (ended up attached to JBNMAN-305), I believe I found the problem.  The linux impl of getProcArgs uses /proc/$pid/cmdline.  This file has \0 delimited arguments and is supposed to be terminated by a lone \0.
Seems this is not always the case, on their system at least.  Customer can apply the attached patch in the agent directory like so:
% ./hq-agent.sh stop
% gunzip libsigar-x86-linux.so.gz
% mv libsigar-x86-linux.so pdk/lib/libsigar-x86-linux.so
% ./hq-agent.sh start
column304:
07/Oct/05 7:46 PM;dougmaceachern;Note: the attached binary is a patch against sigar 1.1.21, which ships in JBN 1.0 and HQ 2.1
This binary will not work with sigar 1.1.22 that is in the current builds for JBN 1.2
For the next code drop (2.2.8) I will include a sigar 1.1.23, you'll be able to use sigar-bin/lib/* with the 1.0 product and the current branch.
column305: 10/Oct/05 12:10 AM;mazz;send patch to customer -  we'll see what he says.
column306: 10/Oct/05 2:28 PM;mazz;customer applied patch and the agent started up fine (I think that's half the battle - I don't think he was able to start up the agent before).  We'll see what happens after he runs it for a while.
column307: 04/Nov/05 11:48 AM;ghinkle;We believe that the customer had no problems after getting the patched sigar libraries.

column1: JCA DataSource Service: descriptor field only being populated for DefaultDS
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
After importing a regular JBoss 4.0.2 server into the inventory, I can browse the resources to find the single JBoss 4.0 JCA Data Source service representing the DefautDS data source. Viewing the inventory of this service shows the 'descriptor' configuration property to be set correctly to 'deploy/hsqldb-ds.xml'.

I then deployed three more datasources into the 4.0.2 server and caused a service auto-discovery to be run, but hitting OK on the Edit Configuration Properties page of the Server. The three datasources were picked up fine,  JBoss 4.0 JCA Data Source services were created for them, but on none of them was the 'descriptor' configuration property set.

I tried deleting the entire JBoss server and reimporting it into the inventory. Same result. The DefaultDS datasource was the only one which had the 'descriptor' property set.
column55:
JBoss AS 4.0.2, default server instance.
Using Binding Service with 'ports-01' setting.
column293: 25/Aug/05 7:28 PM;ccrouch;For hsqldb-ds.xml descriptor property is set
column294: 25/Aug/05 7:29 PM;ccrouch;For msaccess-ds.xml descriptor property is *not* set
column295:
25/Aug/05 7:37 PM;rpm;
Assign to Doug.
column296:
02/Sep/05 6:49 PM;dougmaceachern;I dropped the msaccess-ds.xml into my jboss-4.0.2/servers/all/deploy directory and the discovered Data Source service add the correct properties auto-configured:
name  	MSAccessDS   	descriptor  	deploy/msaccess-ds.xml

It is possible the problem you saw was due to the cache of listDeployedModules not being cleared.  That is, if you deployed msaccess-ds.xml after the other JBoss services had been discovered, the cache used by the plugin was stale.  I made a change to refresh the cache which will be in the 2.2.1 build.
If this is indeed the problem you are seeing, restarting the agent should workaround it.  Otherwise will need to do some more digging as it is working as expected for m.
column297:
07/Sep/05 4:52 PM;ccrouch;I did deploy the msaccess-ds.xml after the other JBoss services have been discovered. Doing a full rebuild (empty DB, restart) then reimporting the JBoss server causes the Datasources services to show up correctly.

I will retest dropping a -ds.xml file into an already inventoried server with the 2.2.1 build and check it gets picked up correctly.
column298: 13/Sep/05 3:40 PM;ccrouch;Tested after the 2.23 drop. The cache change must have fixed the problem. I can now drop a new -ds.xml into a running, inventoried JBoss App Server, and have it picked with the descriptor field set correctly.
column299: 13/Sep/05 3:41 PM;ccrouch;Confirmed fixed after Hyperic drop 2.2.3
column300: 13/Sep/05 3:41 PM;ccrouch;Confirmed fixed after Hyperic drop 2.2.3

column1: Auto discovery of internal Tomcat services getting switched on without specifying it
column11: JBoss Network Management project.

This may be related to JBNMAN-259, but having Auto-Discovery of internal services turned on by default may just be masking this problem

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1) Import into the inventory an Embedded Tomcat instance which has non default http connector port, say 8180.
2) When browsing the Tomcat server it will report that the server is not configured properly
3) Edit the Configuration Properties to be the correct value. Note that the check-box "Auto-Discover Connectors, Servlets, and other services? " is not checked. Hit the OK button.
4) You go back to the inventory page and you get a message saying your updates were saved. Note the label "Auto-Discovery for Connectors, Servlets, and other services is OFF"
5) Hit the edit configuration properties button again.
6) Now the check-box "Auto-Discover Connectors, Servlets, and other services? " is checked??

column1: Tomcat Connector support
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Once JBNMAN-217 was fixed I came across some more things...

1) JK connectors don't seem to be getting autodiscovered in Tomcat 4.1 standalone, http connectors get autodiscovered fine.
2) No connectors (http/jk/https) are getting autodiscovered from Tomcat 5.0 or Tomcat 5.5 when those servers are embedded inside of JBoss.
3) What would be the effort to add support for a Tomcat 4.0 Connector service?
column293:
02/Sep/05 3:39 PM;ccrouch;More on 2)
The problem, no autodiscovery of connectors, extends to Tomcat 4.1 running inside of JBoss 3.2.3 also. The Tomcat server inside the JBN EM Server setups a http, https and jk connector but none of these are discovered by JBN EM when the Tomcat server is imported.
column294:
14/Sep/05 6:42 PM;rpm;
For #1, Tomcat 4.1 does not support monitoring of the JK connectors by default.  For #3, Tomcat 4.0 does not have any support for monitoring connectors.

Both of these are possible, but would require us to package custom catalina.jar and connector jars.

#2 should be possible.  I'm not sure why those mbeans are disabled when the Tomcat 5.0 or 5.5 is embedded within JBoss.  I'll look into it, but may not have a solution before the 2.2.4 code drop (9/19/05)
column295:
21/Sep/05 4:15 PM;rpm;
The connector mbean names change when Tomcat is embedded.  They can be found using the query *:type=GlobalRequestProcessor,* from the JMXConsole.  I'll try to get support for detection and monitoring of these into the next drop. (2.2.5)
column297: 27/Sep/05 12:53 PM;ccrouch;Since this will require deletion and re-importation of services I'm marking this as affecting Documentation and Compatibility.
column298:
27/Sep/05 4:47 PM;ccrouch;Testing this change against the JBN EM embedded Tomcat 5.5 instance:
http connector on port 7080 getting discovered fine and metrics are collected.
jk connector on port 9009 getting discovered fine and metrics are collected. [Though I'm not sure who is requesting on this port to cause bytes to be sent, any thoughts?]
https connector on 7443 getting discovered as a *http* connector. Metrics seem to be collected fine, just the connector type is wrong.

Haven't tested yet on an embedded Tomcat 5.0 instance.
column300:
06/Oct/05 10:49 PM;rpm;
As for the 443 connector being listed as http, we get this directly from the MBean server, so either it's as they designed it, or a bug.  Either way, metrics are collected as expected in HQ.
column301:
17/Nov/05 12:23 PM;ccrouch;All the following configurations appear to have correctly funtioning Tomcat connector services.

Embedded Tomcat 5.5
Standalone 5.0
Embedded Tomcat 5.0
Standalone 5.5

Problems seen yesterday with Standalone 5.5 (The problem is: Invalid configuration: Invalid request: Instance not found Catalina:type=GlobalRequestProcessor,name=http-15509) Did not occur when retesting today.


The only remaining issue is the https connector being identified as http (as discussed above), which if necessary should be tracked by a separate issue.

column1: Administration features not fully secured
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
If you know the correct urls to the administration pages of the JBNEM server then you can access them and make updates, even if your role doesn't have sufficient privileges.

To reproduce the problem:
1) Create a role which is not a JBN EM Server Administration, assign it a user and a group.
2) Login is as that user
3) Paste the following URL into the browser window:
http://localhost:7080/admin/config/Config.do?mode=edit
4) The server settings page comes up and you can successfully make changes.

The problem occurs also for 
http://localhost:7080/admin/config/EditDefaults.do?mode=monitor

column56:
Permissions checking assumes that everything has to be in a group.  In the cases
where the operation is at the system level, rather than resources, the "resources" (users, roles) that we are operating on are not in groups.  Must take that into account.;14/Dec/05 9:41 PM;leec;3600
column293: 17/Aug/05 4:54 PM;ccrouch;Moved to JBNMAN-252
column294: 18/Aug/05 6:23 PM;ccrouch;Some how this got closed in the move from JBNET
column295: 18/Aug/05 6:25 PM;ccrouch;I tried this as well and set my role up to have all user and role privileges. Still saw the same problem described above. I don't think it was anything to do with the groups assigned to the role.
column297:
18/Aug/05 7:24 PM;jsachs;This is a valid bug.  I have logged it as #9791 in our bug database.

The user gets created but the problem is on the assign user to roles page.  You can work around this by going backwards.  Navigate to the role you wish to add the user to and click the "Add to List..." button in the "Assigned Users" section and add the user that way.

Assigning to Javier to add a fix.
column298: 30/Sep/05 6:47 PM;jsoltero;The problem here is the fact that the gui is throwing a stack trace because the user in question has the ability to create users, but lacks any visibility into any roles. Hence, the "Ok and Assign User to Role" action is bombing out because the user tadmin can not see any roles to assign to the newly created user.

column300: 04/Oct/05 10:20 AM;jsoltero;Simply adding the permission to view roles isnt the issue. Please follow the workaround described earlier to accomplish this. The stack trace will be corrected in a future build. Separately, I'm curious to know why this sort of delegated administration is desired. Customers should leave the role definition to the super user role so they can control more directly who is defining what levels of access to specific users. This makes the ongoing administration of HQ/JBNEM much simpler.
column301: 04/Oct/05 10:26 AM;kbarfield;The use case is a large company that has many applications on JBoss under different teams.  In this case, they want to delegate authority to create users to the leads for each project team, but not give them authority to create users for resources outside of that project.  I have had customers ask me about this, which is why I tried it in the first place.
column302: 14/Dec/05 9:41 PM;leec;Code merged for next code drop

column1: auto-discovery does not work after removing platform from dashboard (aiqueue)
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Had a customer complain that auto-discover did not work on  Solaris.  Here's the customer comment:

"Running "New Auto-Discovery" on Solaris with "Filesystem Scan" option didn't work - an exception was thrown (see "auto-discovery-failure.txt" attached). I had to re-start the agent in order to re-run the "Auto-Discovery".

I will attach the file that includes the stack trace.

This is all the information we have on this.  I doubt we will get much more.  See if we can do anything, even if the info we have is light on details.
column293: 17/Aug/05 9:40 AM;mazz;stack trace a customer got when they tried to run auto-discovery on solaris
column294:
17/Aug/05 11:16 AM;rpm;
I believe this is caused by:

1) Clicking remove on an auto-discovered platform on the Dashboard
2) Attempting to run a file scan after that

Re-starting the agent fixes the problem because it re-populates the AI tables.

This is logged in Hyperic's bug database as well, and we are currently looking
into possible solutions.
column295:
17/Aug/05 11:23 AM;mazz;Link to Hyperic's bug #9785:

http://bugz.hyperic.net/show_bug.cgi?id=9785

Text of that issue's description follows:

if you have a platform in the ai dashboard portlet and you click the REMOVE
button, the platform gets removed from the eam_aiq_platform table and the ip
addresses for the platform get removed from the eam_aiq_ip table.  this is not
good for several reasons.  the first and foremost is that you get an error on
the autodiscovery page for that platform if the platform is not in those tables.

the remove button should remove the resource(s) from the portlet display, but
not remove them from the database tables.
column296:
19/Aug/05 2:40 PM;ccrouch;I've just seen this problem on my setup.
With respect to step 2) in Ryan's comment, attempting to run an immediate system scan can trigger the exception also.
column297: 24/Aug/05 5:31 PM;dougmaceachern;this patch will be in the 2.1.24 build.
column298: 25/Aug/05 12:48 PM;dougmaceachern;The patch I attached does not apply to this problem.  I thought on the concall the problem was described as deleting a server from inventory, much different problem than what is described here.  Charles Lee had been looking into this problem.  Sorry for the confusion.
column299: 25/Aug/05 12:49 PM;dougmaceachern;change description, problem is not related to solaris.
column301:
14/Sep/05 3:24 PM;mazz;ryan, can you describe in some more detail what this change means?

I know we have had occasion to delete a server/platform, restart the agent to force a new AI, and then re-import the server/platform again.  In fact, just yesterday I had to get a customer to do this to get platform resource to show a green light for availability (I had him delete a platform and then restart the agent to re-import it).

I know for servers we do the same thing - we'll delete a server and get the agent to do another AI to pick it up again so we can re-import it.

Is the change you guys implemented going to ignore a server forever, ad-infinitum?  So, if I remove a server, I can never get it back?  Or are you saying only if I hit the "remove" button on the Auto-Discovery portlet will that server get ignored forever?  In other words, if I've auto-discovered a server, and rather than import it, I remove it - I will never again see that server?   If so, that's not as bad, although we should still put some hook in there (be it a CLI command or a GUI way) to "un-ignore" a resource.  Cause you know someone's gonna want to import something that they've ignored previously.
column302:
14/Sep/05 6:04 PM;rpm;
The use cases you give about deleting platforms, servers, etc from the inventory to allow for re-import will still work the same as before.

This change only affects servers in the AI queue.  If on the dashboard you click 'remove' on a server from the AI queue, it will be removed from the queue permanently.   This fixes issues with the AI queue resources coming back over and over when the user has clicked the remove on the portlet.  (Due to the AI auto-scan running ever 15 minutes) The previous behavior made the portlet unusable in large environments.

If for some reason a server is ignored that shouldn't have been, it can be recovered by going to the auto-discovery results page for that platform.

Platform->Inventory->Auto-Discovery->View Results

On this detailed page all servers (included the ignored ones) will be shown.  On this page the ignored servers will default to 'Do not Import'. To import them, switch the drop down to 'Import Server' and click 'Ok'.
column303:
14/Sep/05 11:53 PM;mazz;We've had a customer for the past week have pretty bad AI problems importing platforms - this stuff sounds familiar.  Is the following problem description going to be solved by the fix for this issue?  I'm not sure if you can even tell, but I'm at a loss so I'm grasping at straws...

---
I've attempted to add yet another platorm (so, platform c). Platorm is autodiscovered, but I cannot import it into the manager. So, from the dashboard, I click on the platform (lxdapa02) and I get the screen with what items it will import. I click on the 'ok' button and I get :

The page requested cannot be displayed due to some error. You can view the stack trace, Return to the previous page, Dashboard, or Browse Resources page.

The stack trace is:
