column304:
15/Sep/05 12:09 AM;rpm;
I don't think the two are related.

If you can, email engineering with:
1) desciption of the problem
2) server.log
3) general system info (os, arch, etc).  You can get a detailed listing by having the customer run './jre/bin/java -jar pdk/lib/sigar.jar sysinfo' from the agent directory.
column305:
27/Sep/05 11:55 AM;mazz;With code drop 2.2.6, I removed a server from AI portlet.  Then ran another AI scan.  I select Platform->Inventory->Auto-Discovery->View Results and I see it is "Do No Import".  I think that's the fix for this issue.  So I'm closing.

BTW: selecting  Platform->Inventory->Auto-Discovery->View Results resulted in a NullPointerException the first time I tried it.  The second time worked.  I've submitted issue #JBNMAN-297 to report that NPE.

column1: syntax error products ArrayIndexOutOfBounds
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
According to the help of alertdef list, I can  provide "-platform" as an  argument without giving a resource ID.  I think this is wrong - please double check the help text and correct.  It is

   alertdef list [-group | -platform | -server | -service <resource>] [-enabled | -disabled]

but I think it should be (notice you group the "-group | .. | -service" and they all take a required <resource> arg):

   alertdef list [<-group | -platform | -server | -service> <resource>] [-enabled | -disabled]

Anyway, I tried it based on the current help text (gave -platform without a <resource>) and I was expecting it to list all alertdefs for all platforms (if the original help text was correct) OR it should give me a syntax error (if, as I suspect, the help text is incorrect and you need to give a resource ID).  Instead, it gave me an ugly ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception.  Need it to give a prettier error message explaining the problem.

jbnem-shell::jbnadmin> help alertdef list
Syntax: alertdef list [-group | -platform | -server | -service <resource>] [-enabled | -disabled]

    List alert definitions.

    -enabled    Show enabled alert definitions only
    -disabled   Show disabled alert definitions only

jbnem-shell::jbnadmin> alertdef list -platform
Unexpected exception processing command 'alertdef': java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
        at net.hyperic.hq.bizapp.client.shell.ClientShell_alertdef_list.processCommand(ClientShell_alertdef_list.java:55)
        at net.hyperic.util.shell.MultiwordShellCommand.processCommand(MultiwordShellCommand.java:58)
        at net.hyperic.hq.bizapp.client.shell.ClientShell.processCommand(ClientShell.java:158)
        at net.hyperic.util.shell.ShellBase.handleCommand(ShellBase.java:292)
        at net.hyperic.util.shell.ShellBase.handleCommand(ShellBase.java:246)
        at net.hyperic.util.shell.ShellBase.run(ShellBase.java:228)
        at net.hyperic.hq.bizapp.client.shell.ClientShell.main(ClientShell.java:317)
column293:
15/Aug/05 7:30 PM;rpm;
Syntax help has been fixed.

Arguments are now checked before they are used to avoid ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.  When this occurs, the syntax help is now printed.

This will be in the 2.1.13 code drop.

column1: CLI resource list -group lists duplicate groups
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
I have one mixed group defined called "My Group" (it has 2 members, a Linux platform and a JBoss 4.0 server).  In the CLI, if I execute "resource list -group", I get this:

jbnem-shell::jbnadmin> resource list -group
[ Group listing ]
Id      Name       Type                                         Description
--      ----       ----                                         -----------
10002   My Group   Mixed Group - Platforms,Servers & Services
10002   My Group   Mixed Group - Platforms,Servers & Services

It lists it twice.  After stepping thru in a debugger, I tracked it down to a specific SQL.

PermissionManagerEJBImpl.findScopeBySQL(AuthzSubjectValue, Integer, PageControl) line 807 where it says:

stmt = conn.prepareStatement(SCOPE_SQL)

The SQL ends up being (I examined the actual SQL so the actual values are shown here in place of the ? markers);

SELECT res.instance_id, res.sort_name FROM eam_resource res, eam_operation op, eam_subject_role_map srm, eam_role_operation_map rom, eam_role_resource_group_map rgm, eam_res_grp_res_map grm WHERE srm.role_id = rom.role_id AND rom.role_id =  rgm.role_id AND rgm.resource_group_id = grm.resource_group_id AND grm.resource_id = res.id AND (srm.subject_id = 1 OR res.subject_id = 1 ) AND rom.operation_id = 28 AND res.resource_type_id = op.resource_type_id AND op.id = 28 ORDER BY res.sort_name

The resultant PageList object that is returned has 4 rows: [10001, 10002, 10002, 0].
I confirmed this by executing this raw SQL from dbVisualizer tool - the results were:

instance_id	sort_name
10001	CAMPRIVATEROLEGROUP:10001
10002	MY GROUP
10002	MY GROUP
0	(null)

Notice it is giving me my group row twice.

In my eam_resource table, the "My Group" appears only once:

id	cid	instance_id	resource_type_id	subject_id	name	sort_name	fsystem
10026	(null)	10002	3	1	My Group	MY GROUP	false

In eam_resource_group, there is only one "My Group" row as expected:

id	cid	name	sort_name	description	location	resource_id	fsystem	grouptype	group_ent_type	group_ent_res_type	cluster_id	ctime	mtime	modified_by
10002	(null)	My Group	MY GROUP			10026	false	13	-1	-1	-1	1122959392447	1122959430892	jbnadmin

In eam_res_grp_res_map, this seems weird - there are three rows for My Group (which is resource group id of 10002):

resource_id	resource_group_id	cid
10026	10002	(null)
10006	10002	(null)
10001	10002	(null)

10001 is my Linux platform resource ID and 10006 is my JBoss 4.0 server resource ID - that's correct.  10026 - it is listing itself in the group.  Unsure if that's right or not - just wanted to bring it to your attention.
column57: Confirmed that this problem required modification in SQL.  Added DISTINCT keyword to PermissionManagerEJBImpl's SCOPE_SQL.;26/Oct/05 5:51 PM;leec;1800
column293:
13/Aug/05 12:12 AM;mazz;I ran a quick test in dbVisualizer.  I took that exact SQL statement, but added the DISTINCT keyword after SELECT:

SELECT DISTINCT res.instance_id, res.sort_name FROM ....

When I did that, I got the expected results:

instance_id sort_name
10001 CAMPRIVATEROLEGROUP:10001
10002 MY GROUP
0 (null)
 
I'll let you figure out if that's the appropriate fix or not.  I did not modify any code in the JBoss code base - I don't want to mess with SQL that's this complex without knowing the full implications of the change.

column1: CLI command resource view -properties failed with bad SQL error

Executing CLI command "resource view -server 10002 -properties" results in an SQL error on the server side:

22:59:03,054 ERROR [CPropManagerEJBImpl] Unable to get CPropKey values: ERROR: column b.value does not exist

org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: column b.value does not exist

	at org.postgresql.util.PSQLException.parseServerError(PSQLException.java:139)
	at org.postgresql.core.QueryExecutor.executeV3(QueryExecutor.java:152)
	at org.postgresql.core.QueryExecutor.execute(QueryExecutor.java:100)
	at org.postgresql.core.QueryExecutor.execute(QueryExecutor.java:43)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc1.AbstractJdbc1Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc1Statement.java:517)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:50)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc1.AbstractJdbc1Statement.executeQuery(AbstractJdbc1Statement.java:233)
	at org.jboss.resource.adapter.jdbc.CachedPreparedStatement.executeQuery(CachedPreparedStatement.java:46)
	at org.jboss.resource.adapter.jdbc.WrappedPreparedStatement.executeQuery(WrappedPreparedStatement.java:304)

Looks like a bug in CPropManagerEJBImpl - the SQL selects B.value but there is no "value" column in EAM_CPROP.  There is a value_idx column which I assume is what this wants.
column293:
12/Aug/05 11:19 PM;mazz;Change line 359 in

Properties CPropManagerEJBImpl.getEntries(AppdefEntityValue)

the SELECT had B.value when it should have been B.value_idx

Reassigning to Javier so he can confirm that this was the appropriate fix (this is the column you wanted to select right?  value_idx???).  Also, you'll want to fix your own code base with this change as well.

column1: delete and create appdef events not always triggered
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
If I shutdown the agent, and I add a resource (either thru inventory import or manual addition), an AppdefEvent is still triggered successfully (I see two - NEWCONFIG and UPDATE).

However, if I shutdown the agent and I delete a resource from the inventory, an AppdefEvent is NOT triggered.  I would have expected at least a AppdefEvent.ACTION_DELETE to be triggered.

See issue #JBNMAN-230 for the discussion that preceded the submission of this bug.
column56: Send AppdefEvent for ACTION_DELETE when platform, server, service, and application resources are removed.;09/Sep/05 5:58 PM;leec;3600
column57: Added code to send create event when platform, server, or service is manually created;07/Dec/05 10:30 PM;leec;3600
column293:
08/Aug/05 10:42 PM;mazz;To  the question "does an appdef event get triggered if the agent is down and you add a resource to inventory"... the answer is "YES".

I submitted a bug since it would seem the appropriate behavior would be that if you delete a resource from inventory even if the agent is down, an AppdefEvent should also be triggered.  But it is not - no AppdefEvent is triggered.  See issue #JBNMAN-231 for the bug report.
column294: 09/Aug/05 2:12 AM;mazz;More info - I saw the same symptom while the agent was running.  If I delete the actual Agent resource itself from the inventory, I did not get an AppdefEvent triggers even when the agent itself was running.
column295:
09/Aug/05 2:34 AM;mazz;Well, now its all falling apart.

I'm not seeing events with other resource deletions even if the agent is running.  So, what I said earlier was wrong - it doesn't necessarily work even if the agent is running. 

In addition, I'm starting to see failures when I *manually* add platforms.  When I add resources from inventory import, I see the events.   But I'm not seeing events when I manually create resources.

I don't know the pattern - but I do see it failing to emit events in many places.
column296:
09/Aug/05 11:32 AM;mazz;OK - I performed some better, more controlled steps so I can document exactly what I did and the test results.

First - I cleaned and rebuilt and I cleaned out the DB so it was empty.  I then started the server and the agent.  The agent auto-discovered some things.  Now the tests:

[note that the agent is running]

1) From Dashboard, I elected to import an auto-discovered JBN Agent resource.
RESULTS: I got a series of AppdefEvents - one for the JBN Agent, and a few for the platform and its services.  This is good - it worked.

2) Manually deleted that JBN Agent resource from the "Browse Resources" page.
RESULTS: *no* events - I would have expected a AppdefEvent.ACTION_DELETE but did not get it

3) Manually added a platform (that is, it was not auto-discovered nor imported from Dashboard page, I added it from "Browse Resources" page)
RESULTS: *no* events - expecting AppdefEvent.ACTION_CREATE but did not get it.  Note that no agent was running on this platform but I provided a valid IP and FQDN - I don't think this matters though.  But just to be complete in my description of the test environment, I mention it here.

4) Manually add a JBoss 3.2 server, configure it and eventually delete it.  The server is actually running and when its added, the monitoring tab shows green lights, so it is getting picked up properly.
RESULTS: *no* events - expecting AppdefEvent.ACTION_CREATE when I added it and expecting AppdefEvent.ACTION_DELETE when I deleted it, but I saw neither message.

[note - after those tests, I then shutdown the agent, so the following tests were run with the agent down]

5) select to import an auto-discovered resource from Dashboard AI portlet
RESULTS: I successfully see the ACTION_CREATE event.  This is good - it works.

6) delete that new resource I imported in the above step
RESULTS: *no* events - expecting AppdefEvent.ACTION_DELETE but did not get it

7) manually add a JBoss server
RESULTS *no* events.  This may be because currently you can't add things if the server isn't running, and because the agent is down, we can't determine if the server is running.  So, I can't say if this test actually tells us anything that's useful.

---

So, in the end, I think whether the agent is running or not is a red herring - I don't think it really matters.  I think it has to do with manually manipulating the inventory.  If I use the Dashboard to import new resources, events flow.  If I manually do things, no events flow.

Finally, after each step listed above, I looked at the actual DB tables (eam_platform, eam_server).  Each time, the DB was updated properly - so that all worked.  When I added a resource (either through AI import or manual add) the new rows appeared in the DB appropriately.  When I removed a resource, the rows were deleted from the DB appropriately.  So, the DB add/delete seems independent of the JMS message publishing code.  But, I just wanted to make that clear - the DB access is working fine - its only the JMS messages that are getting lost.
column297: 09/Aug/05 11:44 AM;mazz;we'll need this fixed for R2 since it will be needed to help manage the WebDAV repo.
column298: 09/Aug/05 12:17 PM;mazz;The code is in - but it relies on JBNMAN-231 to be fixed before the code can work.
column299:
10/Aug/05 1:31 PM;mazz;As per Ryan's comment during the conf call yesterday, I'm assigning this to him since I'm not sure who to give it to.

Ryan - spoke to Javier about this issue yesterday and he agreed that its something you guys will want to/need to fix.  Not  sure who would be appropriate to assign this to fix it.
column300:
15/Aug/05 4:08 PM;rpm;
Re-assign to Charles.
column301: 09/Sep/05 5:58 PM;leec;The group does not currently send event because of the way the code is structured.  Please reopen issue if that is necessary.
column302:
12/Sep/05 8:58 AM;mazz;Yes, we need it (hence, why I created this issue).  I talked to Javier about this when I first created the issue and he concurred about this - and in fact he said the HQ core product will eventually need this bug fixed as well since there are plans to also do things with these events.

As perJavier, (see Issue #JBNMAN-230), "The true decoupled way would be to create an MDB which listens on the Events Topic which is registered to respond to Appdef events."

So, the way you are supposed to be able to know when resources come and go is via MDB listening to events.  Unfortunately, the code has problems in that in some cases those events are not triggered when they should be.  I've documented those cases in this issue.
column303:
12/Sep/05 9:03 AM;mazz;After reading Charles' last comment, I think I may have been confused.  I thought you were closing the entire issue as a "will not fix".  But reading:

" The group does not currently send event "

Does this mean CREATE and DELETE events will now flow correctly for platform, server and service?  You are only not sending events for groups or applications?

If CREATE and DELETE are getting emitted propertly for platform, server and service then the majority of the problem is fixed.

If the only thing now is that groups and applications aren't emitted events, then I will close this issue and submit an enhancement request.  I don't know if we'll need it - but it seems like a typicaly thing you'd want to do.  Perhaps we could implement a new AppdefGroupEvent that gets emitted when a new group or application is created.  Again, if that's the only thing missing now, I'll close this out and submit a new ER issue.

15/Aug/05 10:52 AM;ccrouch;Comment from a customer who I believe is running into this bug. Once this issue is fixed we should check that the usability issues they describe below have been resolved.

I have two servers JBoss and Tomcat, I'm doing a search on resource name "Tomcat" - the JBoss server is disappearing from the list.
The problem I see here - there's a "Tomcat" filter applied on the list of servers but there's no way to see or clear it !

clicking "All Server Types" in "View" drop-down causes no effect, the same about clicking the "Servers (2)" link (btw, this "(2)" is the only indication of some filter applied - there should be 2 servers in the list while only one appears there).
Currently, the only way to "refresh" the list of servers is to search for empty filter ("") or to enter Browse Resources -> Servers again.
As I've mentioned, keeping the filter ("Tomcat") in the search box would help reminding the operator that it's currently applied. In addition, some "Clear Filter" button (enabled only when some filter is applied) would be helpfull as well."

column1: "start" control action says it failed when it actually succeeded
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
I issued a "start" control on a JBoss instance.  I can see that it actually did start up, but the control history says that the control action failed - it thinks its still in the stop state.

I think its because the control subsystem didn't wait long enough for the JBoss server to start up.

This looks like a bug but maybe there is a way to configure how long the control subsystem waits before determining if a resource has started before claiming it failed?  How can I tell the control action to wait longer before considering the action failed?
column293: 03/Aug/05 10:57 PM;mazz;I'm going to change this to a bug.  The fact that the control action actually succeeded when the GUI says it failed is invalid behavior.
column294:
15/Aug/05 10:53 PM;mazz;I think I know why this occurred and a possibly easy solution.  My timeout was set to the default of 30 seconds.  My JBoss server took more than 30 seconds to come up.  I can change the timeout and see what happens (I suspect it will be OK now).

But, the situation still exists when the timeout is too short.  We need someway to tell the user that the control didn't necessarily fail.  Rather than have  the control history say the control "failed", it should say something to the effect of, "timeout - results of control action unknown".

This would let the user know that the server was not told to wait long enough to determine the completion status of the control.  Seeing a "timeout" result would let the user know to reconfigure the control configuration to have a longer timeout.  Seeing "failure" tells the user the control actually failed and send the user on a chase to fix a problem that doesn't necessarily exist.
column295:
15/Aug/05 11:01 PM;mazz;confirmed that changing the timeout value allows the control action result to show "completed".

So, the solution to this would be to create a new "status" for a control action - that being, "timed out-unknown".
column296:
01/Sep/05 4:04 PM;mazz;Ryan - assign to whom you deem fit.  I think this is a bug - saying the control "failed" when it didn't is probably not what was intended.  I think if the timout failed, we shouldn't mark it as failure because in some cases (as mentioned in this issue) it didn't fail, it actually succeeded.

We had a customer see this behavior, which is why I'm touching this issue.
column297:
07/Sep/05 5:50 PM;richardfriedman;Three items
1. Extend timeout
2. Change message to indicate timeout
3. update status to timeout
column299: 14/Sep/05 4:25 PM;mazz;confirmed new timeout of 600 seconds and a nice message appears if a timeout actually triggered the failure.

column1: Rebranding the Apache SNMP module configuration file.
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
The configuration file of the Apache SNMP module, APACHE_INSTALL_DIR/conf/snmpd.conf, has the vendor name embedded in directives such as syscontact and syslocation as well as in comments.  For example, the config file for the pre-built module we had received earlier contains the name "Covalent." 

The configuration file in Covalent's SNMP module also sets the Apache-embedded SNMP agent's listen port to TCP/1610 (the default SNMP agent port seems to be UDP/610).  Is this what your build process would do as well?  If so, we need to capture this in our Apache product documentation.
column293:
26/Jul/05 5:08 PM;richardfriedman;Ajit checking out the latest build to review. 
Doug - checking out the apache 2.0 stuff.
Debian next drop.
column294: 26/Jul/05 5:09 PM;rpm;To doug.
column295:
27/Jul/05 9:59 PM;dougmaceachern;removed all vendor references in the snmpd.conf file.
removed 'covalent_' prefix from the 2.0 module names (used in LoadModule directives).
these changes will be in the 2.1.11 build.

our snmpd.conf file defaults to 1610 rather than 161 because:
- 161 requires root privs
- 161 may clash with existing snmp agents
The HQ apache plugin also defaults to 1610, but will parse the port from snmpd.conf if it is changed to something different.
column296: 27/Jul/05 10:31 PM;dougmaceachern;one more clarification: Apache SNMP agent listens on UDP, not TCP.
column297:
28/Jul/05 5:32 PM;amandalay;The SNMP module build process uses the prefix "covalent" in the names of the SNMP DSO's.  These names are user-visible as they need to be specified in the LoadModule directives the user is required to add in httpd.conf:

LoadModule covalent_snmpcommon_module modules/snmpcommon.so
LoadModule covalent_snmpagt_module modules/snmpmonagt.so

Can we drop the prefix in the Unix build scripts and also from the pre-built Windows modules?
column298: 16/Aug/05 3:48 PM;amandalay;The module names no longer have the "covalent_" prefix, but the directives on the Edit Configuration page still use the old names.  This just needs a simple change in the hq-plugin.xml for the Apache plugin (which I can make if there won't be any conflicts with future code drops).
column299: 16/Aug/05 3:51 PM;dougmaceachern;'"covalent_" prefix was removed from hq-plugin.xml help text right after the last drop we gave you, so that fix will be in the next (2.1.13)

column1: mousing over "Add Content" icon produces a javascript error
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
On the dashboard if you remove a portlet, a new section appears titled "Add content to this column". In this section there is a dropdown of portlets which you have previously removed and an icon of a large blue plus sign. Mousing over the plus sign produces the following Javascript error:

Error: path is not defined

This is presumably because the onmouseover event calls 
    imageSwap(this, path + 'dash_movecontent_on', '');
and the 'path' variable is not getting defined somewhere else.
column55: This problem occurs in both Firefox 1.0.4 and IE6
column56: AddContents.jsp was using the wrong JSP variable name.  In addition, the image file names were incorrect.;27/Jul/05 2:04 PM;leec;900
column293: 27/Jul/05 2:04 PM;leec;This has been fixed and will be in the next code drop
column294: 05/Aug/05 1:04 PM;ccrouch;Confirm fixed in Hyperic drop 2.1.12

column56:
There were three problems here:

1. The numbers were not working correctly because the validator was using a faulty deprecated utility class, ValidatorUtil.  It has been switched over to using the updated utility class, ValidatorUtils.

2. Whenever there are actual errors, a NullPointerException results from the null ActionErrors passed in.  This is due to the fact that the validator interface has changed and is now using ActionMessages.

3. The validation.xml was not including checking for spaces, so created a rule that no spaces are allowed.;21/Jul/05 3:26 PM;leec;4500

column1: cannot pipe commands to hq-shell.bat
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
I was going to document how you can perform scripting for those IT administrators who want to perform automatic command execution without having to enter commands interactively into the CLI shell.

I mention three things: 1) ~/.hq/shellrc, 2) the source command and 3) pipe commands to the shell.

I verified that 1) and 2) work as advertised.  However, 3) doesn't seem to work.  We need 3) because it will allow admins to execute the CLI shell in their own scripts as well as allow the CLI shell to execute commands without forcing the admin to go into interactive mode.

I have a file named bulkcmds that has 4 simple commands in it (version and help).  I first used it with the source command to make sure it was valid (it ran fine).  But then I piped that file to the shell and the shell hung after logging in (due to executing my login command in ~/.hq/shellrc).  Note below that once it hung, I hit Control-C a few times which prompted Windows to ask me to terminate it.  Notice that my commands did get piped to the shell because they appear as answers to the Windows terminate prompt!  I'm wondering if this has something to do with SIGAR's getline native stuff?

C:\mazz\eclipse\projects\jboss-network\jbn-admin\hyperic_hq\build\shell>type bulkcmds | hq-shell.bat
Successfully logged in as jbnadmin at localhost:2099
Terminate batch job (Y/N)? version
Terminate batch job (Y/N)? help resource list
Terminate batch job (Y/N)? version
Terminate batch job (Y/N)? help alertdef
Terminate batch job (Y/N)?
column293: 20/Jul/05 10:21 AM;mazz;I just tested on Linux and it works fine.  This bug only appears when attempting to pipe a file to the hq-shell.bat on Windows platforms.
column294:
20/Jul/05 10:31 AM;mazz; I tried disabling the SIGAR getline native stuff by passing in -Dsigar.getline.native=false in hq-shell.bat and the behavior is different but still fails to work.  This time, it seems the shell goes into an infinite loop (probably due to an error reading the input stream I would presume) after all commands are executed.  However, note that the commands in my file actually DO get executed this time, with SIGAR getline native off.  So that's a good thing.  The shell just needs to know when to stop reading stdin.  Here's what I got:

C:\mazz\eclipse\projects\jboss-network\jbn-admin\hyperic_hq\build\shell>type bulkcmds | hq-shell.bat

column295:
20/Jul/05 10:33 AM;mazz;Adding "quit" command as the last command in my bulkcmds file that I pipe in fixed that "infinite" loop issue.  Note that:

1) this still only works if I disable the SIGAR getline native code
2) you do not need to explicitly quit on UNIX, when the file is done, the shell exits cleanly on UNIX
column296:
20/Jul/05 10:38 AM;mazz;To be clear - here's the workaround until this bug is fixed:

---

If you want to run the CLI shell on a Windows platform and you want to pipe commands to that shell, you must do two things:

1) edit hq-shell.bat such that SYS_PROPS has "-Dsigar.getline.native=false":
        SET SYS_PROPS=-Dorg.apache.commons.logging.Log=%LOG% -Dsigar.getline.native=false
2) ensure that you explicitly pass the "quit" command as the last command piped to the shell

column300: 27/Dec/05 9:48 AM;mazz;confirmed fix.  Used jbn-shell.bat as is (i.e. native flag is true) and set native flag to false in jbn-shell.bat.  Both work OK now.

column1: Web apps running in embedded Tomcat cannot be controlled
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Trying to start, stop or restart a web application which is running inside a Tomcat instance which is embedded inside of a JBoss server will fail with an error similar to the following:

Error invoking method stop: javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: Catalina:j2eeType=WebModule,name=//localhost/jmx-console,J2EEApplication=none,J2EEServer=none is not registered.

This is because the MBean being searched for is not present in the JBoss MBeanServer. 
Since the only part of the MBean name which a user may change via the portal is the Service name,  e.g. //HOST/CONTEXT_PATH. There is no way to specify the correct MBean name e.g. 'jboss.management.local:J2EEApplication=null,J2EEServer=Local,j2eeType=WebModule,name=jmx-console.war'
column293: 19/Jul/05 5:48 PM;ccrouch;Moving to R2 since I suspect the solution is non-trivial.

column1: CAM_SMTP_HOST doesn't change after a hq-server.conf mod
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
This probably isn't a problem - just wanted to ask HQ folks so they can tell me if this is or is not working properly.

In eam_config_props DB table, there is an item "CAM_SMTP_HOST".  It was set to "mail.localhost" when I installed the product.  Its an invalid host name - I don't have a host called mail.localhost.  No biggie, I wasn't sending emails via alerts at the time.

However, I want to now change it to just "localhost" because I installed an SMTP server on my box and I want it to be used so I can see the alert emails work and see what the emails look like.

There is no way to change this SMTP host value in the GUI, so I just went to hq-server.conf and changed the server.mail.host to "localhost".  I restarted the server and now things work perfectly - I'm getting alert emails sent via my local SMTP server.

However, when I look at eam_config_props database, that CAM_SMTP_HOST is still mail.localhost ??

Not sure what, if any, problems will occur now or if that CAM_SMTP_HOST value is simply being ignored.  What should have happened with the DB value?

column1: Embedded Tomcat servers should have their Control Actions fully disabled
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
When you go to the Control tab for the Tomcat 4.1 instance which is bundled with JBNEM, you get the following message:

"Control Actions are not enabled. To enable control, set Configuration Properties in the Inventory section."

However going to the Configuration Properties page does not reveal anything which will enable control. I believe this is because the Tomcat instance is embedded inside of JBossAS and therefore not controllable independently.

The message should be changed to be "Control Actions are not enabled" or the Control Action tab itself should not be enabled for embedded Tomcat instances.

column1: Typo in default jmxURL configuration property for Tomcat 4.0
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
After installing Tomcat 4.0.6 and configuring it following the instructions I checked the 'Auto-Discover webapps'  box hit the OK button on the edit configuration properties page. I then received the following message:

"The configuration has not been set for this resource due to : Invalid configuration: Invalid request: Incorrect response from monitored server"

This is because the jmxURL is defaulted to:

http://localhost:8008

changing the port on the jmxURL to be 8080 and hitting the ok button, causes the configuration to be saved correctly and the tomcat webapps to be imported.

I've tried this with Tomcat 4.1.31 and 5.0.30 and did not observe this issue.

column1: support monitoring JBoss 3.x and 4.x on same agent platform
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Based on conversations/comments from some internal JBoss consultants, we need to fix the problem that restricts the ability for the agent to be able to monitor/manage JBoss installs of different versions (3.x and 4.x).  Today, you can only have the agent monitor one or the other, you cannot have an agent access different versions of JBoss (and presumably, this could be a problem for any Java app with different class requirements).

The issue is usually the fact that the JMX versions are different between the 3.x and 4.x JBoss installs.

Some of our customers run multiple versions on the same boxes (e.g. a beefy server may host department A's JBoss 3.x application and department B's JBoss 4.x application, as an example).  Or for testing/staging/QA machines, multiple JBoss instances of differing versions may be installed.  These are situations our consultants have already seen in the field.

I don't know what type of effort it would take to fix this.  Clearly, the problem does not reside in the server code - its in the agent code since it is the thing that actually communicates with the JBoss instances.  The solution may involve either:

a) playing games with classloaders so each JBoss instance gets associated with its own classloader in the agent

or

b) maybe consider running MULTIPLE agents on a box - one configured to monitor all JBoss 4.x instances and another to monitor JBoss 3.x instances (this would require the box to be multi-homed - since each agent would need its own IP that the server would communicate with).
column56: Updated the JBoss plugin to utilize the EMS libraries for jmx activities.;01/Nov/05 4:14 PM;ghinkle;432000
column293:
08/Jul/05 10:25 AM;jsoltero;Assigning this to Doug.

Based on what I know, this will be quite difficult because of the lack of binary compatibility even across point releases of JBoss. Since there's only a single instance of the JBoss plugin in the agent, it doesnt seem clear to me without serious intervention that there is a way to support this. 

Would be helpful to know how prevalent this is as this involves a humongous ammount of work.

column1: Auto-discovered Tomcat webapps have a typo in their service names
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Having successfully auto-discovered the embedded services from a Tomcat 5.0 instance, I tried to issue a stop control action on one of the web apps.
The control action failed with the following error in the agent.log

2005-06-30 17:30:44,185 ERROR [Tomcat50ServiceControlPlugin] Error invoking method stop: javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException: MBeanServer cannot find MBean with ObjectName Catalina:j2eeType=WebModule,name=//localhost\jsp-examples,J2EEApplication=none,J2EEServer=none

The problem is that the control configuration property "serviceName" is used to build the ObjectName and it was set to 

//localhost\jsp-examples

Having set the serviceName to 

//localhost/jsp-examples (notice change in middle slash)

the stop control action worked fine.

column1: cannot auto-discover Apache Web Server v2.0.52

OK, so now I'll beg for help before I get too far along.

I installed Apache Web Server 2.0.52.  I didn't do anything funny this time (I'm not running it in Eclipse :-)

It's got registry entries in Windows and it is running as a windows service.

The registry entry is:

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Apache Group\Apache\2.0.52

I do a auto-discovery scan and it can't find it - either thru process scan or file scan.  I stepped thru the agent and noticed it is looking for the reg key "SOFTWARE\Apache Group\Apache\2.*"

But notice my key is in HKEY_CURRENT_USER - I recall a few months ago that somewhere I noticed it was looking in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.  My Apache reg keys are not in there - they are in HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

My web server is running, so I would have thought SIGAR process scan would have found it.

30/Jun/05 3:54 PM;mazz;I see this in apache plugin jar's hq-plugin.xml:

    <scan registry="SOFTWARE\Apache Group\Apache\2.*">
      <include name="ServerRoot"/>
    </scan>

I do have a ServerRoot (whose value is my install dir of apache).

Note also my Software node is capitalized (not all caps which is what is in this hq-plugin.xml).  Its also under HKEY_CURRENT_USER.  Because this registry attribute doesn't specify "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" or "HKEY_CURRENT_USER", I don't know what the default is - where does it know where to look under?  I guess it defaults to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE; if so, would explain why it can't find it using a registry scan.

column306: 21/Jul/05 5:15 PM;mazz;fixed and confirmed.[JBNM
column307:
21/Jul/05 7:23 PM;mazz;reopening - Apache is not getting auto-discovered via SIGAR's process table scan.

The PTQL actually works once I added the fix to use the new win32 PTQL string. However, it is auto-discovering the wrong root.  Here's what I found while stepping through a debugger.

When the plugin runs its autodiscover routine, it thinks the root directory is C:\apache.  I don't have a directory named C:\apache on my box at all so I was wondering where it got that from.  The executable it discovers is at C:\mazz\apache-httpd\Apache2\bin\Apache.exe (this is correct - that's the executable that is running on my box).  The code ends up getting into ApacheBinaryInfo.findRoot() with the value of "binary" parameter being C:\mazz\apache-httpd\Apache2\bin\Apache.exe.  The findDefine(binary, "HTTPD_ROOT") call returns C:\apache.  Stepping through findDefine, it looks like that executable has the string "-DHTTPD_ROOT=/apache" in it.  Must be a default in the executable code???  Anyway, it picks up that "/apache" from the executable file and it thinks that is the root.  I'm not sure what this findRoot() is trying doing looking inside the actual executable file (maybe it thinks its scanning a UNIX script file and looking for a command line argument -D HTTPD_ROOT????).  In any event, C:\apache ends up being the root directory in the auto-discovered Apache server as shown in the dashboard.

Note that if I auto-discover relying on Windows Registry entries, all works well.  It must use registry entries to find the root directory.

We need to have this issue fixed because someone might install apache in the way that it puts registry entires in the place where the plugin doesn't look (see this issue for more info on that).  In that case, we can't use registry entries as the way to auto-discover apache, we must rely on SIGAR to find it in the process table.

I guess since it see two different roots it thinks there are two different apache servers installed.

column312:
21/Jul/05 8:17 PM;mazz;I see.  If I look at my Windows Service (Apache2 is the service name), the "path to executable" is set to:

"C:\mazz\apache-httpd\Apache2\bin\Apache.exe" -k runservice

There's the process that SIGAR finds.  There is no -d argument.  This process must fork/exec another Apache.exe executable with the -d argument.

Perhaps we need to look for a -k in the args - if it finds it, it should ignore this process.  But I don't know if that valid for all use-cases of the -k argument
column313:
21/Jul/05 8:23 PM;mazz;further verification of what I see.

If I shutdown the windows service (tried both from the Apache Monitor tool and straight from the Windows Services GUI), both Apache.exe processes die.  SIGAR then only sees the ApacheMonitor.exe process alive.

If I start apache (again, I tried both from the apache Monitor tool and from the Windows Services GUI), the two Apache.exe processes start up (one with -k runserver and one with the -d).  SIGAR then sees both.
column315:
21/Jul/05 9:04 PM;mazz;Ok, that works - running that little plugin utility shows that only one apache is found with the proper root.

But riddle me this - how come the PTQL  queries for the -k runservice process, but what comes back from SIGAR is the process that has the -d argument?  They are two different processes.  It works though - but I don't see how :-)

I'll deploy with the entire server to see if it works inside the whole system.
column316: 21/Jul/05 9:14 PM;mazz;that works.  i don't know how, but it does :-)

column1: metric view error message is misleading
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
entered this metric command:

metric view -platform 10001 UserCpu

Notice the user error - I entered the wrong name for the metric alias - i should have entered CpuUser.  Had a difficult time figuring that out because the error message I got said:

"Error finding resource: No such entity!"

But that resource does exist - that's a valid entity ID.  The problem wasn't that the resource does not exist, it was a bad metric name.  The error message should say:

"Invalid metric alias name"
column56: Force check on the ID requested and catch AppdefEntityNotFoundExcept to display proper message;01/Aug/05 8:58 PM;leec;1800
column293: 05/Jul/05 2:27 PM;jsoltero;Assigning to charles
column294: 08/Jul/05 7:29 PM;leec;Fixed in code.  Should be in next code drop.
column295:
15/Jul/05 6:44 PM;mazz;The original problem was fixed but now the opposite problem occurs:

metric view -platform 10001 CpuUser

works OK but

metric view -platform 98765 CpuUser

results in an error message of "Metric CpuUser not found".

That would be confusing because the user enter a valid metric name but the platform ID is invalid.  The old exception message was OK in this case - I should still see the old error message, "Error finding resource: No such entity!"

To be clear:

If I enter an invalid entity ID (with a valid metric name), I should be told the entity ID was invalid (I should not be told that I entered a bad metric).

If I enter an invalid metric name (with a valid entity ID), I should be told the metric name was invalid (I should not be told the entity ID was bad).

If I enter both an invalid metric name and invalid entity ID - take your pick; report either one or both.

02/Aug/05 9:50 PM;mazz;FYI: wasn't in the 2.1.12 code drop which was released on Aug 1.  Charles Lee resolved this on Aug 1 so it might be that this code didn't make it in that drop.  Will leave this in resolved state until next code drop so we can test again.

Here's the commands I run and the results:

metric view -platform 10001 CpuUser  ==  OK
metric view -platform 10001 Foobar  ==  "Metric Foobar not found"
metric view -platform 98765 Foobar  ==  "Metric Foobar not found"
metric view -platform 98765 CpuUser  ==  "Metric CpuUser not found"

All exhibit correct behavior except for that last one.  The true reason for the failure was because the platform was invalid.
I'm inclined to think that the next to last one (-platform 98765 Foobar) should also indicate a bad platform too (but since the metric is also bad, the error message is technically correct).

column1: resourcetype view command not working, Boss layer throws NullPointerException
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
While going thru all the supported commands for testing/documentation purposes, I came across a problem with resourcetype view.  See the commands I issued below.  Note that I first do a list to ensure I can get the resource type definitions via list.  But I can't "view" them.

hq-shell::jbnadmin> resourcetype list -platform
Platform type listing: 7 entities found
ID      Name      Arch            OS        Version      Plugin
--      ----      ----            --        -------      ------
10002   AIX       powerpc-ibm     AIX       4.3.x        system
10005   FreeBSD   x86             FreeBSD   4.x          system
10004   HPUX      hppa-2.0        HPUX      11.x         system
10007   Linux     x86             Linux     2.4.x        system
10006   MacOSX    powerpc-apple   MacOSX    10.x         system
10001   Solaris   sparc           Solaris   2.x          system
10003   Win32     x86             Win32     NT/XP/2000   system

hq-shell::jbnadmin> resourcetype view -platform 10003
net.hyperic.util.shell.ShellCommandExecException: java.rmi.ServerException: RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is:
        java.rmi.ServerException: EJBException:; nested exception is:
        javax.ejb.EJBException: RuntimeException; CausedByException is:
        null
  [1]-NESTED-EXCEPTION:
  java.rmi.ServerException: RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is:
        java.rmi.ServerException: EJBException:; nested exception is:
        javax.ejb.EJBException: RuntimeException; CausedByException is:
        null

I also tried with other types, still the same problem. e.g. resourcetype view -server "JBoss 3.2"

Thru debugging, I came across the following NullPointerException.

This command ends up calling MeasurementBossEJBImpl, line 369:
   return this.getTemplateManager().findTemplates(mtype, null, null, pc);

Note that the second parameter in this call is explicitly set to a "null".

This ends up calling the findTemplates method on TemplateManagerEJBImpl, line 316.  On that line, you will see:

            if (!cat.equals(MeasurementConstants.CAT_AVAILABILITY)) {

However, "cat" is the second parameter to this method - which as mentioned earlier, is explicitly passed in as a null.  Therefore, this immediately throws a NullPointerException and fails.

I'm not sure what this "cat" is and even if its value is allowed to be null (the findTemplates() method definitely does not expect it to be null so I would assume its an illegal value).

column1: JDOM doesn't allow for spaces in directory name - license check fails
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
In order to integrate Slide and the WebDAV client library, we need to upgrade the JDOM library from the one that ships with core HQ.

In doing so, JDOM behavior is different.  SAXBuilder.build(File) converts the file to a URL that gets encoded - spaces are converted to %20 for example.

This causes an exception when SAXBuilder.build(URL) tries to build a SAX InputSource from the URL.

To work around this, we need to change HQ's net.hyperic.util.xmlparser.XmlParser class such that its parse(File in, XmlTagHandler tag) method doesn't call SAXBuilder.build(File).  Instead, we should get the input stream ourselves and use XmlParser.build(InputStream).

column1: Issue with "Configuration Properties" link in portal for new servers and services
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
Once a new service or server has been created (either manually or automatically) I have noticed an issue with the "Configuration Properties" link which appears at the top of the page when you browse the new resource.
The main issue is only observed if you are running the portal application not at the root context, e.g. http://localhost:8080/jbn/, so *not* when viewing the portal via the usual URL  e.g. http://localhost:7080/. [This situation I believe could occur if you are running the portal application on a standalone Tomcat instance rather than the one bundled with HQ and JBoss].

For a new Service clicking on the Monitor or Inventory tabs displays the "Configuration Properties" link. There are two issue with the URL behind this link (e.g. /resource/server/Inventory.do?mode=editConfig&type=3&rid=10151)

a) It does not contain the web application context root
b) It points to /resource/server/... rather than /resource/service.

Issue a) results in a 404 error when you click on the link.
Issue b) is really only for consistency since on the Control tab for the new Service the "Configuration Properties" link works fine, e.g. is /jbn/resource/service/Inventory.do?mode=editConfig&rid=10151&type=3

For a new Server the situation is similar but only issue a) is a problem. However the broken "Configuration Properties" link now appears on the Control Tab for the Server as well as the Monitor and Inventory tabs.
column293: 23/Jun/05 2:43 PM;leec;The context path is now inserted into the link so that the webapp can be deployed in tomcat.  The other issue where the link appears to be for a server, when it should be a service, is somewhat intentional for convenience.  It works the way it is.
column294: 13/Jul/05 1:24 PM;leec;Found another error that has the same issue, so code was fixed today.
column295:
18/Jul/05 5:14 PM;ccrouch;The original problem seems to have been fixed, but I am now observing the following when executing with a separate Tomcat instance:
a) Manually create a new IIS 6.x server
b) Hit the 'Configuration Properties' link
c) Hit the OK button while the server if off. An expected message appears saying an error occurred.
d) Hit the Cancel button. You are returned to the Inventory where the following message is displayed:

"This server is turned off or has not been configured properly.
The problem is: Agent error: Could not open Windows Service: W3SVC
Please turn on the server, or fix its Configuration Properties."

e) Hitting this new Configuration Properties link produces a 404 error, due to a missing context root in the URL

column293: 15/Jun/05 11:05 AM;mazz;code is checked in.  There is now a JBN_WEBDAV_BASE_URL configuration item in the database.  HQConstants now defines it.  TFS MBean server will use this to determine how to connect to the WebDAV server.

column1: add password to SessionManager data
column11: JBoss Network Management project.
column54:
To support the use of our WebDAV server and passing URLs refering to content in the WebDAV server, we need a username/password that components can use to authenticate itself when connecting to WebDAV.

Today, the Hyperic framework has the notion of WebUser in HttpSession - however, there is no way to get the HttpSession at the EJB or MBean level.  Also, this is only for actual Web GUI users - WebUser is not available when the client is a shell.

Need to enhance the SessionManager so it can maintain username/passwords associated with session IDs.

I'll be adding this capability to the core HQ framework.  I'm still not quite sure how it can be implemented, but I'm sure it can be done.  AuthManagerEJBImpl.getSessionId is the method called when a session is added to the Session Manager.  I think this is called both when a Web GUI user logins in and when a shell client logs in.  From here, I think I can squirrel away the password in the SessionManager.
column293: 14/Jun/05 11:03 PM;mazz;Finished.  AuthManagerEJBImpl needs to just call the new "SessionManager.putPassword"  method.  SessionManager now has putPassword and getPassword.  The password entry is invalidated at the same time the session is invalidated.
column294: 15/Jun/05 3:49 AM;mazz;code is checked in

column1: New plugin must support DataSource services in JBoss 4.0
column11: JBoss Network Management project.

09/Jun/05 7:25 PM;ccrouch;Great! 
I think the DataSources services should be added and the JCA Conn Pools kept as is, since they are fundamentally two disctinct resources.
column294:
09/Jun/05 8:05 PM;dougmaceachern;Just starting to look at the JBoss plugin enhancements.
Running 4.0.2 with the TrailBlazer app, I see 1 DataSourceBinding instance:

MBean: org.jboss.resource.adapter.jdbc.remote.WrapperDataSourceService
Name:  jboss.jca:name=DefaultDS,service=DataSourceBinding
0. Attribute: JndiName = DefaultDS
1. Attribute: UseJavaContext = true
2. Attribute: JMXInvokerName = jboss:service=invoker,type=jrmp
3. Attribute: StateString = Started
4. Attribute: State = 3
5. Attribute: ConnectionManager = jboss.jca:name=DefaultDS,service=LocalTxCM
6. Attribute: BindName = java:DefaultDS
7. Attribute: Name = WrapperDataSourceService
 Operation: start
 Operation: jbossInternalLifecycle
 Operation: destroy
 Operation: invoke
 Operation: create
 Operation: stop

Is this the correct MBean?  We can easily provide an availability metric and control actions for start/stop for this service.
column295:
10/Jun/05 11:23 AM;ccrouch;The filter "jboss.jca:service=DataSourceBinding,*" is the best way of returning a list of MBean associated with each DataSource deployed using a -ds.xml file. As far as I'm concerned the "correct" MBean for a DataSoource is not a well defined concept. The DataSourceBinding MBean is useful because you can dereference the ConnectionManager attribute to get a hold of the ConnectionManager MBean associated with the DataSource. From there you can get at the ConnectionPool and ConnectionFactory MBeans. Useful information about the DataSource is contained within all four of these MBeans. Take a look at the LGPL'd Admin Console code to see which MBean attributes we retrieve data from...

http://anoncvs.forge.jboss.com:8080/viewrep/~raw,r=1.1/JBoss/jboss-admin-console/src/main/org/jboss/admin/service/datasource/MBeanServerDataSourceHelper.java
column296:
10/Jun/05 1:15 PM;dougmaceachern;ok, the existing jboss plugin already has the connection pool metrics, defined in the HQ "JBoss 4.0 JCA Connection Pool" service type.
Looks like there's a couple more we can add.
column297: 13/Jun/05 12:30 PM;ccrouch;One piece of information which we will need to have stored in the model for DataSources is the location of the -ds.xml file which generated the DataSource. [Could maybe use the ResourceConfig or a regular attribute, not sure.] This is required to enable us to access the -ds.xml via the TFS inorder to read, and eventually update, attributes.
column298: 15/Jun/05 1:16 PM;ccrouch;It would be perfect if the path to the -ds.xml which got stored was relative to the root of the JBoss Server. So if the physical files was located at "C:\usr\projects\current\jboss_network\hyperic\runtimes\jboss-3.2-bin\server\default\deploy\hq-ds.xml", it would be great if what got stored in the config response was "deploy\hq-ds.xml".

column1: Javascript error in JBN Enterprise Management Portal

FireFox:

The problem appears to be in js/footer.js on Line 22. This is very strange since according to our cvs history this file has not been updated since the first Hyperic code drop. We retested with the original web app (Hyperic look and feel) and the problem did not occur.

column54:
When you click on a particular resource which is controllable you see the following tabs in the Hyperic UI:
-Monitor

column56: Added 'Manage' tab to Controllable Server resources;07/Jun/05 10:17 AM;ccrouch;7200
column293:
05/May/05 6:35 PM;ccrouch;Added Manage tab when viewing controllable Services. The gifs' for the Manage tab are deliberatley ugly to indicate the related functionality is not yet complete.

In order to add the Manage tab for other resources, e.g. Platform, Server, Application, etc, follow these steps. For a given resource NNN...

1) Add a new net.hyperic.hq.ui.action.resource.NNN.manage package and a new NNNManageAction class inside it. Use ServiceManageAction.java as a template. Update the specified 'view' method to add the portlet ".resource.NNN.manage.list.detail".

2) Update hyperic_hq\web\WEB-INF\tiles\portal-def.xml to include ".resource.NNN.manage.layout". Use ".resource.service.manage.layout" as a template.

3) Update hyperic_hq\web\WEB-INF\tiles\resource-NNN-def.xml so that ".tabs.resource.NNN" includes the new tab. Use ".tabs.resource.service" as a template. Also update this file to define ".resource.NNN.manage.list.detail", ".tabs.resource.NNN.manage" and ".tabs.resource.NNN.manage.list.detail". Use the corresponding service tiles as templates.

4) Update hyperic_hq\web\resource\common\manage\ListDetail.jsp to conditionaly insert the appropriate NNN tab tile, e.g. ".tabs.resource.service.manage.list.detail".

5) Add the following action mappings to hyperic_hq\web\WEB-INF\struts-config.xml
a) /resource/NNN/Manage, forwarding to .resource.NNN.manage.layout
b) /resource/NNN/NNNManager, input is /resource/NNN/Manage.do, and type is net.hyperic.hq.ui.action.resource.NNN.manage.NNNManageAction (The class created in 1).
column294: 12/May/05 7:55 AM;richardfriedman;This is information about how to add another tab to the management console.
column295:
07/Jun/05 10:30 AM;ccrouch;Additional steps required:

3) More tiles to be defined in hyperic_hq\web\WEB-INF\tiles\resource-NNN-def.xml:
i) ".resource.NNN.manage.collect.arguments"
ii) ".resource.NNN.manage.quickManage"


5c) /resource/NNN/manage/QuickManage
5d) /resource/NNN/manage/ExecuteAction
column296: 19/Jul/05 4:16 PM;ccrouch;The Manage tab has been added for Controllable Servers and Services. It will be added as necessary to other resources in subsequent phases.
column297:
12/Sep/05 9:25 AM;mazz;"Update the specified 'view' method to add the portlet ".resource.NNN.manage.list.detail". - where is this specified?  There is no "view" method in either ServiceManageAction or ServerManageAction.

I see things like:

	Portal portal = Portal.createPortal("resource.server.Control.PageTitle.Edit",
					    ".resource.service.control.edit");

Do I need to make "resource.server" and/or "resource.service" to "resource.platform"?
column298:
12/Sep/05 9:53 AM;ccrouch;Your new NNNManageAction should contain a map taking strings, e.g. "view", to method names, e.g. "currentManageStatus". Here currentManageStatus() is the "view" method which was being referred to.

This method needs to create a portal e.g
 Portal portal = Portal.createPortal("resource.NNN.ManageSchedule.Title",
".resource.NNN.manage.list.detail"); 

You will need to add a resource.NNN.ManageSchedule.Title property to WEB-INf/classes/ApplicationResources.properties

In your current case NNN=platform

column293:
13/May/05 4:54 PM;jsoltero;More clarification as requested by Rich...

The HQ platform will be able to monitor configuration and log resources on a per product basis for changes, and other events. The result of this will be that the agent will send information back to the server of the change or error that took place, and the server in turn will generate an "Event" which will be broadcast on the Events Topic of the HQ server.

By placing log or config change events on the JMS Topic, the HQ server can then alert off of them, as well as record their historical occurances alongside the resources that generated them. This behavior would be similar to that of the alert and control history.

Similar to other features in HQ, the server side implementation of this will deal with generic concepts of "Log Events" and "Config Events". The specifics of what these mean will be dealt with by the individual plugins. This frees up the implementation of plugins to support file-related config events (such as would be done for something like apache), JMX events, Windows EventLog events, Registry Configuration Changes, etc.

column293:
10/May/05 4:46 PM;richardfriedman;Assuming a four-hour work day 


First draft mark-ups of 1-2 main screens to solidify basic style: 2 days 
Gather/implement response/changes/suggestions: 2 days 
Compile a list of screens to change: 1-2 days (including discussion) 
Roll-out mark-ups of each screen: 1-3 hours per screen + 1 hr per screen for changes/discussion 
(1 hr for screens of previous layout, up to 3 hr for screen with new layout) 
Like with JBN, I can forward mocks for your consideration while moving forward. 


The above are real-world estimates that include no artificial padding.

column300:
13/May/05 1:07 PM;ccrouch;Please see the attached screen shots for the damage, :-), I was able to do relatively easily to the look and feel:

1)change background and text colors
To test this I changed absolutely every color in the CSS file to bright green. As you can see from the screenshot its possible to alter the color of all the text and background areas. The CSS classes look pretty fine grained, I've attached the file (win.css) to this bug. Obviously there will be more work if we want to make two components which currently use the same css class look different.

2)change main icons, e.g. Hyperic logo
Easy just drop in a new image. See screen shot.

3)change portlet icons
Again just images, should be no problem changing them.

4)add a banner at the top of the page
Looks like simply by altering portal/MainLayout.jsp we can add a common banner across all the pages. See new_header.png

 <mailto: lmewshaw@redhat.com <mailto:lmewshaw@redhat.com
To:Frank Merenda <fmerenda@redhat.com <mailto:fmerenda@redhat.com

High Level (Short) Description of Problem:
  attachment added by technician not visible to customer

Related Test Case Number (if any):  none

Environment (Dev/QA/Stage/Prod, or server name):  qa

http://cspserver2.app.dev.redhat.com:8080/jbossnetwork/
and
http://csp2.app.dev.redhat.com/issue-tracker/

Affected System (I-T, CSP, GK, Slide, Other/Unknown):  CSP and
 Issue Tracker

Detailed Description including URLs, error messages, expected vs
unexpected results:
  Expected that the technician could add an attachment and that
 thecustomer could see it

Reproducible at will (Yes/No): Yes

Steps to Reproduce:
 - open up a case in Issue Tracker as technician
 - add a public attachment to the case (no text in the comment)
 - flip over to the CSP, pull up the case
 - click on Attachments
    -- attachment not visible

Customer Login Used: testtest password redhat

Technician Login Used: lmewshaw

Misc:
column293:
04/Sep/07 11:14 AM;mamburn;> Lisa Davidson wrote:
 Hey guys,

 My understranding from Ahmad is that all JBoss Customer groups and
 JBoss product groups/queues will not be using "internal statuses",
 "categories" and "notifications". Maybe this information is not
 up2date any more...

>
> Correct. we set internal status for consistency inside of IT.
>
>
 On the group configuration, those three attributes are hidden from
 all JBoss groups to avoid confusions. Basically,  we  never add any
 "internal statuses" and "category" attributes to the JBoss groups.

 Looks like IT_144618, one of the test case created under user
 "testtest", was created in the backend database with an internal
 status as "Waiting on Support" actually.
>
> correct,we set it on creation of cases.
>

 My question is what's the policy on handling JBoss groups regarding
 those three attributes? And a  follow up question,  is CSP entering
 "Waiting on Support"  for new cases created for other business units,
 like Partner Center, CC, RHX?
>
> No, a new case is created as "New".
> We ignore the other three attributes.
>
> Is this related to attachments not showing up on cases at all in the
> CSP now? I don't understand the correlation? The attachment
> functionality was working correctly before. Is this some new bug or
> something?
>
> -f-
>

 Lisa
column294:

cases are showing up as "Waiting on Support" with no other options.  I'd
rather it either be 1) "No Internal Status"  or 2) have the right
internal statuses that GSS wants.  My understanding is that the jboss
team doesn't want to use internal status, so I'd much rather opt for #1

column1: GK Batch Scheduler fails on JBoss AS restart
column11: JBoss Network is a value add service offering for JBoss, Inc. customers.
column54: So the problem is with the hibernate start ordering.. CSP's hibernate instance must start up before GK's.  When GK is running a scheduled job.. it will start before you hit CSP.  I think there is an autostart feature in hibernate.. we need to initialize the mappings on startup or add a listener to start CSP hibernate on startup.
column56:
After testing several versions of the Hibernate Interceptors, Event, Listeners API Implementation in depth!  It seems, at this time,  the most reasonable fix will be simply to allow the (Tomcat) web container to be responsible for deploying/undeploying the Hibernate Application as opposed. To do this I created a Listener initializes and closes Hibernate on deployment and undeployment, instead of the first user request hitting the application. I have applied changes LOCALLY to the following files for testing:

web.xml,
hibernate.cfg.xml, 
SessionFactiory.java ,
HibernateListener.java,
JBoss-CSP README.txt

10/Jan/07 1:31 AM;lamon;Fixed the bug within the JSF Navigation Controls by making changes to the WEB-INF/faces-config.xml:

  <navigation-rule>
    <from-view-id>/restricted/monitor.jsp</from-view-id>    
    <navigation-case>        
      <from-outcome>processDefinitions</from-outcome>      
      <to-view-id>/restricted/process_definitions.jsp</to-view-id>    
    </navigation-case>  
   </navigation-rule>
   
  <navigation-rule>
    <from-view-id>/restricted/monitor.jsp</from-view-id>    
    <navigation-case>        
      <from-action>#{monitoringBean.showSearchInstances}</from-action>
      <from-outcome>showSearchInstances</from-outcome>      
      <to-view-id>/faces/restricted/search_instances.jsp</to-view-id>    
    </navigation-case>  
  </navigation-rule>

(16:10:46) fjm_lunch: bug:

column294:
21/Dec/06 5:41 PM;frank.merenda;I don't understand why this is not showing up. Lisa, can you please look at this. it seems to me that it should work. 

SELECT * FROM tickets t where t.tid = '95956';
- gid 72
- product - 799999

SELECT * FROM ticket_groups t where tid = '95956' LIMIT 0,1000
- gid 72 and 1134

product id 799999 = hibernate

group gid = 1134. group = 'Hibernate group'
column295: 21/Dec/06 5:41 PM;frank.merenda;I do not know what I am missing. Please let me know if I am missing some entry somewhere.
column296:
03/Jan/07 2:43 PM;llu;Frank,

The problem is that you didn't update ticket_groups.show_issue='t'.
mysql> SELECT tid,gid,show_issue FROM ticket_groups t where tid = '95956';
+-------+------+------------+
| tid   | gid  | show_issue |
+-------+------+------------+
| 95956 |   72 | NULL       |
| 95956 | 1134 | NULL       |
+-------+------+------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)

show_issue must be 't' if the ticket is associated with a specific group. Could be created in a group or escalated to a group. 
show_issue must be 'f' if the ticket is deescalated from a group.

By the way,
 gid=72 is not allowed to handle tickets. there is no products associated to that group.  There are two groups that are not intended for handling tickets:
   Red Hat, gid=72
  Management / Executive Adjust Scoring, gid=788.

Lisa

column1: Find a non-seam replacement to trigger actions on page load for REST behaviour
column11: JBoss Network is a value add service offering for JBoss, Inc. customers.
column54:
We need the execution of actions on page load, which JSF without doesn't offer by default. There's a couple of workarounds
* Oracle ADF has a page component with an onload, but it doesn't seem trivial to install. Maybe that should be the solution long term
* abandon the REST style and generate the state on the action that calls the page (e.g. view dashboard). That means that you can't directly link to a dashboard, which is lame and makes integration in the UI harder
* http://jsf-comp.sourceforge.net/components/onload/index.html has an extension that enables what we need, using a phase listener

See 
http://jsf-comp.sourceforge.net/components/onload/index.html
http://www.nabble.com/OnLoad-in-Myfaces---%3Esomething-like-in-Oracle-ADF--t680960.html

column1: Resolve Xid incompatibility
column54:
There is an issue between JBossTS Xid and JBMessaging Xid implementations not resolving to equal with same globalID, branch qualifier and format id settings.

It seems to be related to the fact that JBossTS Xids get padded to a fixed byte length which causes a mismatch in the equals() method implementation.

E.g.

Xid xid1 = new XidImple(new Uid("gbtxid1"), new Uid("bq1"), 123);   //JBossTS(GID, branch, format)
Xid xid2 = new XidImpl("bq1".getBytes(), 123, "gbtxid1".getBytes());
      
assertEquals(xid1, xid2);

returns false.

This is an issue since currently the JBMessaging does not enforce a single Xid implementation to be used but assumes Xid as a valid key based on its global tx id and branch qualifier contents. Furthermore this assumption of key equality is likely to fail due to comparison of format IDs which are expected by definition to differ across implementations.

The issue manifests itself during recovery where at server startup recovered prepared transactions are reinstantiated and populated into tx map using JBMessaging Xid implementations. Once the coordinator requests these transactions to be committed, it will pass as an argument its own Xid instances which will fail on lookup.

Discussing various options with Adrian, the best solution appears to be to modify the XAResource interface implementation to enforce single Xid implementation inside messaging by replacing all incoming Xid references with a known implementation. This will avoid the inconsistency within tx map when Xids are used as identifying keys.
column293: 02/Dec/06 7:00 AM;juha;Mods to MessagingXAResource done, recovery test with JBossTS Xid implementation passes.

The remaining failures on XATests were temporarily resolved by rolling back some Xid massaging changes that were part of original JBMESSAGING-407 patch. The reasoning was an unexpected Xid formatting from JBossTS. This is yet to be verified but if it is the case, another solution needs to be found.;28/Nov/06 8:24 PM;juha;25200
column293:
28/Nov/06 8:32 PM;juha;Fixed the failures raised by the JDBCPersistenceManager API change.

The remaining failures on XATests were temporarily resolved by rolling back some Xid massaging changes that were part of original JBMESSAGING-407 patch. The reasoning was an unexpected Xid formatting from JBossTS. This is yet to be verified but if it is the case, another solution needs to be found. This is part of JBMESSAGING-647.

If there really is a need for special Xid handling this would naturally fit into AS XAResourceWrapper implementation that is currently used for JBossTS/AS/Messaging integration (JBMESSAGING-645). However, XAResourceWrapper is not at this point decoupled from jboss.jar (see http://www.jboss.com/index.html?module=bb&op=viewtopic&t=95276). Therefore, something else needs to be done for standalone deployment and integration of JBossMessaging and JBossTS (this is assuming the original issue that lead to 'funny' xids from JBossTS reveals itself again while resolving issue #647).

column1: Open connections should not prevent jvm from exiting
column54:
If the client process attempts to exit without explicitly closing connections then it can cause the process to hang.

We should explicity close any open connections on jvm exit (install a shutdown hook to handle this) and log warnings (to system.err) so the programming error can be corrected.
column293: 30/Apr/07 9:14 AM;timfox;We have already ensured that open connections won't hang VM

column1: MessageConsumerTest::testTimeoutReceiveOnClose can randomly fail
column54:
If any GC happens during close and assertion happens, or any delay on creating the thread happens the test will fail.
We need to find a testcase that is not so fragile. Probably using two distinct threads and notification.

column1: Race Condition between Topic/Queue.getMessageCount and Deliver Thread
column54:
This is not necessarily a bug. It' s more a task, but I will assume it as a bug at this point.

QueueManagementTest::testMessageCountOverFullSize has a race condition between getMessageCount and Deliver Thread.

PagingChannelSupport::messageCount is an arithmethic expressions of messageRefs.size() + deliveries.size() + nextPagingOrder -  firstPagingOrder

deliveries.size is being controlled by Delivery Thread, determined by DeliveryRunnable that runs as-synchronously on Destination.

While getMessageCount might diverge momentarily it will eventually be fixed as soon as DeliveryRunnable has the appropriate time to send the result to the collection deliveries.

To fix this we would need to synchronize delivery and messageCount somehow, probably adding global lock, what we don' t want to add I assume. So, if this is correct the test has to be fixed somehow.

I have changed the test in such way it will make easier to identify the racing condition. Use tracing in your tests and you will see a retry routine that will eventually pass.

column1: postgresql-persistence-service.xml contains invalid SQL syntax
column54:
The UPDATE_UNRELIABLE_CHANNELCOUNT SQL in postgresql-persistence-service.xml uses "UPDATE tablename alias" syntax but PostgreSQL does not support this syntax.

http://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.1/static/sql-update.html
http://www.postgresql.org/docs/7.4/static/sql-update.html

To fix this, simply remove the aliases from the SQL.

The MessagingRecoveryModule and MessagingXAResourceRecovery are the supporting classes for recovery while XATest has one method which cretes a in-dboubt transaction (when you kill the program at approriate times).

The way I tested is - run the XATest, wait until all the prepared statements are successful and then kill the program (as the prepares are successful the in-doubt txs are created)

Then run the recovery program (attached) to do the recovery
column294:

This will work with any JMS that supports XA recovery
and is configured using a JMS Provider within JBoss.
http://wiki.jboss.org/wiki/Wiki.jsp?page=ConfigJMSProvider
column295:
16/Jun/06 6:06 AM;mskonda;The patch file is attached to this issue. . Also find the new recovery source code (please exclude the previously attached individual files as they do not conform to the jboss directory structure) under jboss directory structure(org.jboss.jms.recovery package).

There are couple of changes to the existing source code in order to reflect the recovery. The first section describes these exsting source code changes and second section desrcibes the newly introduced source code:

SECTION I : Existing source code changes

1. org.jboss.messaging.core.plugin.JDBCPersistenceManager.java:

a. The retrievePreparedTransactions is modified. This now takes into consideration of the existing transaction id (fetched from database). The list (variable transactions) is populated with these vectors which are replicas of JMS_TRANSACTION rows. (Before this change, all the time a new Transaction is created which gets a new Id (from the IdManager) although there's a already prepared in the database. Look at the issue description: http://www.jboss.com/index.html?module=bb&op=viewtopic&t=84877)


b. There's an additional method added: associateCallbackToResurrectedTx (Transaction tx): this method is called from the TransactionRepository once a Transaction is created (resurrected) to attach a TransactionCallback object for hooks to be exectued [ There's a bit of explanation is needed here, I guess: Under normal cicumstances, that is, when a message is sent to a destination, during the process of receivign and pesisting that message, the ChannelState adds a reference which internally attaches the call backs (TransactionCallback (and MemoryCallback, I think)) to the transaction. But, during the recovery, this process is not invovled hence, we have to attach a callback somehow for the commit hooks to be executed]. 

2. Interface org.jboss.messaging.core.plugin.contract.PersisteceManager.java:

The associateCallbackToRessurectTx method is added 

3. org.jboss.messaging.core.tx.TransactionRepository.java

a. The method loadPReparedTransactions() has been modified to fetch the Vector which consists of txId and Xid. These ids are then used to ressurect the transaction by calling resurrectTransaction() method (see point b below). Once a transaction is resurrected (it is the object that represents JMS_TRANSACTION row), a callback is assocaited by invoking associateCallbackToRessurecedTx() on JDBC persistence manager instance (see point b above)

b. A new method resurrectTransaction(long txId, Xid xid) is introduced. This method creates a new transaction with these IDs and adds to the globalToLocalMap (which are then queried by ServerConnectionEndpoint by calling getPreparedTransactions() method).

SECTION II : New source code 

There are couple of new source classes are introduced to be invoked the JBossTS RecoveryManager for recovery. These new classes are:

1. org.jboss.jms.recovery.MessagingRecoveryModule.java: 

This is a recovery module class (refer JBossTS manuals for more on module classes) that gets kicked off when the RecoveryManager is loaded (the class is quoted as a property in jbossjta-properties.xml, see below). When kicked off, this class instantiates another class (org.jboss.jms.recovery.MessagingXAResourceRecovery) and delegates the responsibility of fetching the XAResouce (JMS Server). Once it finds a XAResouce, it recovers and commits the transactions.

2. The org.jboss.jms.recovery.MessagingXAResourceRecovery: 

This class is a helper class that fetches the reference to messaging's XAResoruce and handovers to recovery module (above class)

<properties depends="arjuna" name="jta">

<property name="com.arjuna.ats.jta.xaRecoveryNode" value="*" />

..
</properties>

And

<properties depends="arjuna" name="recoverymanager">
..
 <property name="com.arjuna.ats.arjuna.recovery.recoveryExtension3" value="com.arjuna.ats.internal.jta.recovery.arjunacore.XARecoveryModule"/>
...
</properties>

column1: M3's CmdHELO is very naughty and violated 2821
column8: JBoss Mail ** Closed - moved to http://buni.org **
column11: CLOSED ** moved to http://buni.org
column54:
CmdHELO sends the AUTH methods when you issue a HELO which is disallowed:

"
3.2 Client Initiation

   Once the server has sent the welcoming message and the client has
   received it, the client normally sends the EHLO command to the
   server, indicating the client's identity.  In addition to opening the
   session, use of EHLO indicates that the client is able to process
   service extensions and requests that the server provide a list of the
   extensions it supports.  Older SMTP systems which are unable to
   support service extensions and contemporary clients which do not
   require service extensions in the mail session being initiated, MAY
   use HELO instead of EHLO.  Servers MUST NOT return the extended
   EHLO-style response to a HELO command.  For a particular connection
   attempt, if the server returns a 'command not recognized' response to
   EHLO, the client SHOULD be able to fall back and send HELO.
"

This makes some clients (ristretto which is what we use for M4) puke.

column1: Does not work under JBoss 4.0.3RC3 (unreleased)
column8: JBoss Mail ** Closed - moved to http://buni.org **
column11: CLOSED ** moved to http://buni.org
column54: Lastest stuff in head isn't working on JB403RC3 (Branch_4_0 branch from cvs).  First problem is the build depends on the existence of the hibernate deployer which is now gone (its functionality has been combined with SAR).  The second problem is that the packaging is no longer valid due to a documented 4.03  incompatibility.  Unpacked HARs now require the descriptor be called jboss-service.xml.  The third is some elusive classloader issue which causes the deployer to balk saying that FolderDO messages and then FolderDO is defined in duplicate.  I've tried a few permutations of packaging, but have not successfully deployed.  Tomorrow, I'll try deploying JBMS HEAD on older JBoss releases.  I'm starting to think we should just go ahead and punt on HAR altogether and move aggressively to a JDK5 only release based on EJB3 which I think will at least be more aggressively maintained and tested.

column1: Mail Route feature
column8: JBoss Mail ** Closed - moved to http://buni.org **
column11: CLOSED ** moved to http://buni.org
column54:
To compliment the use of Domain Groups for relay, we now need declared targets for routes.  Meaning:

<mbean code="org.jboss.mail.target.Host" name="jboss.mail:type=Target,hostname=bobford.superlinksoftware.com">
    <attribute name="DomainGroup">jboss.mail:type=MailServices,name=DomainGroup,group=Relay</attribute>
    <attribute name="HostName">bobford.superlinksoftware.com</attribute>
</mbean>

And obviously that has to be wired into something (probably a maillistener), and changes will have to be made to the SMTPSender code.

The effect is that for any domain in the specified DomainGroup the bobford.superlinksoftware.com host will be used as a target relay host.

column1: Create JavaMail replacement for outgoing mail

column54: JavaMail sucks and is a drain on our perfromance.  Moreover it has some nasty issues with IMAP and everything else.  Lastly the interfaces are nothing to smile about.  We don't need JavaMail compliance for our own outgoing transport.  We need more raw featureset.  This feature will capture a list of issues tied to it as well.
column56: I have used the ristretto api as a replacement for JavaMail.  It works well.  However we will need to maintain a patched version for use with JDK 5.  Also there is a bug in the handling of error messages when issuing a RCPT command.  This also has been patched.  However only a version for jdk5 has been compiled.  I will need to compile a version for jdk 1.4.;21/Aug/05 12:21 PM;mikezzz;14400
