column54: To increase code reuse the RemoteDelvieryMDB, LocalDelvieryMDB and MailingListMDB should be replaced with a single DeliveryMDB class.  For each type of delivery  an instance of DeliveryMDB will be configured with a MailListenerChain approriate to the type of delivery.
column56: Added the DeliveryMDB and removed LocalDeliveryMDB from the build.  Added a local delivery message listener and chain.  Any listeners that should be executed for local delivery should be added to that chain.  This could include things like SPAM filtering.;04/Sep/05 3:37 AM;mikezzz;28800
column293:
04/Sep/05 5:21 AM;mikezzz;Added a DeliveryMDB which has a single env-variable which is the name of the MailListenerChain that it sends the mails to.

Added 2 new mail listeners, for local and remote delivery.   Configured 2 new chains local and remote with the associated listeners last in the specified chains.  Moved chain XMBean descriptor into a seperate file as it will be reused across several MBean configurations.

column295: 13/Sep/05 9:40 AM;acoliver;One of the biggest things to come out of my testing so far is that we've done a really good job of cutting memory consumption down.  With Sun JDK5 we perform perceptually/subjectively okay in only 128m without ever blowing our heap in the specmail (I believe I can say that since it is not a specmail measure) on a really crappy machine even on Linux 2.4 kernel (screwed up RH hybrid).  Oddly with JRockit  GC was horrible and performance wasn't good.  My best tuning effort only stabilized but failed to improve performance.  I did these tests with Posgresql because I wanted a reasonable test (and mySQL's blob support continues to be a problem).

column1: Convert to izPack install
column8: JBoss Mail ** Closed - moved to http://buni.org **
column11: CLOSED ** moved to http://buni.org
column54:
convert existing build process to izPack (initial prototype).  Later stages will involve switching the overall packaging and configuration.

Features (clue to Shaun Connelly):

* Easy, attractive graphical user interface for initial configuration
* Support automation for repetitious installations
* Installs on any existing JBoss 4.0.2+ release 
* Will install JBoss 4.0.3 if not present
* Supports Java Web Start installation
* Supports JDK 1.4-5.0

column298: 29/Jul/05 6:12 PM;starksm64;We need a common key generation panel/config as this is something we need for jbossas setup of tomcat, jms, remoting ssl. Is this something that can be integrated into the jboss-izpack module for use across installer users?
column299:
01/Aug/05 9:36 PM;acoliver;Our panel will probably say different things than your panel.  Just because the "What is your name" is actually "What is your mail server's name" when dealing with TLS and friends.  

However, it can be done with the generic tools without any substantive difficulty:

in install.xml

...
 <res id="AntActionsSpec.xml" src="src/GRAPHICAL/antActionsSpec.xml" />
...
      <listener installer="AntActionInstallerListener"
         uninstaller="AntActionUninstallerListener" />
...
   <jar src="lib/ant.jar" stage="both" />
   <jar src="lib/ant-launcher.jar" stage="both" />
...


in userInputSpec.xml
   <panel order="8">
      <field type="staticText" align="left"
             txt="If you've specified any SSL services, we will need the location of your keystore.  If you do not have a keystore, we can create the keystore for you.  If you do not let us generate it, you will need to copy it into the JBOSS_HOME/server/CONFIG/conf directory"/>
      <field type="divider" align="center"/>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_PATH">
         <spec txt="name of keystore in server/CONFIG/conf" size="32" set="jbmail.store"/>
      </field>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_PASS">
         <spec txt="Keystore password (must be at least 6 letters)" id="text.label" size="32" set="jbmsrulez123"/>
      </field>
      <field type="divider" align="center"/>
      <field type="check" variable="GENERATE_STORE">
         <spec txt="Generate Keystore" id="text.label" size="32" set="true" true="true" false="false"/>
      </field>
      <field type="divider" align="center"/>
      <field type="staticText" align="left"
             txt="Answer the following only if we are generating a keystore for you."/>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_CN">
         <spec txt="Hostname" id="text.label" size="32" set="localhost.localdomain"/>
      </field>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_OU">
         <spec txt="Company/Organization Unit" id="text.label" size="32" set="BigCo, Inc."/>
      </field>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_O">
         <spec txt="Division/Organization" id="text.label" size="32" set="IT Group"/>
      </field>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_L">
         <spec txt="City/Locality" id="text.label" size="32" set="Durham"/>
      </field>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_ST">
         <spec txt="State/Province" id="text.label" size="32" set="North Carolina"/>
      </field>
      <field type="text" variable="KEYSTORE_C">
         <spec txt="Country (2 letter)" id="text.label" size="2" set="US"/>
      </field>
   </panel>

in antActionsSpec.xml

<antactions>
  <pack name="Base">
    <antcall order="afterpacks" buildfile="src/GRAPHICAL/ssl-gen.xml">
       <property name="INSTALL_PATH" value="${INSTALL_PATH}"/>
       <property name="SERVER_CONFIG" value="${SERVER_CONFIG}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_PATH" value="${KEYSTORE_PATH}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_PASS" value="${KEYSTORE_PASS}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_CN" value="${KEYSTORE_CN}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_OU" value="${KEYSTORE_OU}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_O" value="${KEYSTORE_O}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_L" value="${KEYSTORE_L}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_ST" value="${KEYSTORE_ST}"/>
       <property name="KEYSTORE_C" value="${KEYSTORE_C}"/>
       <target name="genssl-${GENERATE_STORE}"/>
    </antcall>
....

in ssl-gen.xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<!-- Define reference to file containing common targets -->
<project name="mail-izpack-ssl-gen" default="genssl-true" basedir="${INSTALL_PATH}" >

  <target name="genssl-true">
      <echo>Generating Keystore</echo>
      <echo>INSTALL_PATH is ${INSTALL_PATH}</echo>
      <echo>SERVER_CONFIG is ${SERVER_CONFIG}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_PATH is ${KEYSTORE_PATH}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_CN is ${KEYSTORE_CN}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_OU is ${KEYSTORE_OU}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_O is ${KEYSTORE_O}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_L is ${KEYSTORE_L}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_ST is ${KEYSTORE_ST}</echo>
      <echo>KEYSTORE_C is ${KEYSTORE_C}</echo>
         <genkey alias="jboss-mail" storepass="${KEYSTORE_PASS}" keystore="${INSTALL_PATH}/server/${SERVER_CONFIG}/conf/${KEYSTORE_PATH}" keyalg="rsa" verbose="true">
             <dname>
                 <param name="CN" value="${KEYSTORE_CN}"/>
                 <param name="OU" value="${KEYSTORE_OU}"/>
                 <param name="O"  value="${KEYSTORE_O}"/>
                 <param name="L"  value="${KEYSTORE_L}"/>
                 <param name="ST"  value="${KEYSTORE_ST}"/>
                 <param name="C"  value="${KEYSTORE_C}"/>
             </dname>
          </genkey>
  </target>

  <target name="genssl-false">
    <echo>Not Generating Keystore</echo>
  </target>
</project>
column300:
01/Aug/05 9:46 PM;acoliver;I've gotten all of the stuff into the build that I wanted.  I forgot generating datasources and the such off of the estimate.  So I adjusted the remaining time to like 3h.  

Tomorrow I will:

1. Generate a "test this" jbws install
2. integrate into the build
3. check everything in

Sadly, I don't think I can ditch mkunwrapped and essentially dev build targets for good yet (I am going to eventually so consider it deprecated) in favor of always using the izpack automated install script and maybe some incremental targets.  it may not be such a hot idea anyhow since this does add a lot of time to the build.  Maybe we can just use the velocity processor stuff for ant for our dev deploys in order to have one jboss-service.xml and hibernate-service.xml template.  

Secondly, izpack's automated install scripts appear to be broken in the edition that has the jboss stuff in it (not sure about other editions).  It generates duplicate entries in the output script and then doesn't properly assign properties when you run it (probably related to dupes).  Seems primarily associated with our userEntry screens.  Everything else looked right.  I'll file a bug on this issue tomorrow and post it as a "contribution opportunity".

I also spent a lot of time playing with EJB3 today.....  papa likes.  (minus persistence.xml ;-) )

-Andy

I consider this task finished.  All other issues I'll handle as part of a CUT M3-pre2 release once Mike is cool.

column1: Project edit portlet - info when there are two instances of the same portlet on one page
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54: In case a portlet is placed on a page twice, it's "windowUniqueId" property should be set to some unique string (on both portlets; one of it may be empty). This is needed to have nice URLs.

column1: Implement project.xml changes
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
1.  There are two ways to include project description:
<project>
        ...
        <description>projectDescription.html</description>
	<info> html content </info>
        ...
</project>

The first one is a reference to html page in a freezone directory. This one is usually used. <info> element content was to be displayed under "More info" header (see any project page at jboss.org). Seems now only JBoss Remoting uses this feature.

To my way of thinking having short and long project description is good idea, but both elements should link to freezone pages as freezone is a place for html files, not project.xml.

2. More types for repositories: ANONSVN, SVN, ANONCVS, CVS.

3. Field "repository" contains a list. Let's use "repositories" name instead. The same for "repoMonitor" and "issueTracker".

4. Please make RepoType JavaBean (add getters and setters). The same for other *Type classes. If it wasn't auto generated code, I'd do it on my own ;-)
column56: Adding most of it and rejecting the rest. Finished;13/Feb/07 1:27 PM;unibrew;3600

column1: Add <pages> element support to project.xml
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
The <pages> element will describe pages of a project.
It should have the following structure:
<pages>
   <page name="aaa">
      <portlet name="xxx" region="xxx" height="xxx">
         <preferences>
            <preference>
               <name>zzz</name>
               <value>yyy</value>
            </preference>
            (...)
         </preferences>
      <portlet>
      (...)
   </page>
   (...)
</pages>
column293:
02/Feb/07 8:33 PM;unibrew;<preferences> tag seems to be redundant. In object world it wold cause situation like:
Preferences preferences = portlet.getPreferences();
List<Preference> prefs = preferences.getPreferences();

In my opinion it would be better to just have:
<portlet ...............>
    <preference>
         <name>zzz</name>
         <value>yyy</value>
    </preference>
    (...)
</portlet>

column1: Productization Metrics
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
Implement a set of productization metrics for the JEMS Maturity Matrix.

This should include metrics concerning:
- available documentation (manuals, wiki, FAQ, javadoc),
- professional support / training possibilities,
- if product is packaged for download,
- easy installation (web installer or installation manual),
- JEMS integration.

column1: Find cause of Kosmos OOMEs
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
Shortly after server restart Kosmos throws OOM: PermGen space:

16:40:56,824 WARN  [RemoteInvocationTraceInterceptor]
Processing of HessianServiceExporter remote call resulted in fatal exception:
hu.midori.kosmos.protocol.SvnService.getRepositories
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space
16:40:56,845 ERROR [STDERR] Jul 27, 2006 4:40:56 PM
com.caucho.hessian.server.HessianSkeleton invoke
WARNING: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space
column56:
Investigating.
Trying various configurations to find out the root cause.
Updated Kosmos to the latest version available.

Noticed that:
- Only running Kosmos JIRA portlet results in OOM: PermGen space.
- The problem has nothing to do with Kosmos server.
- Increasing MaxPermSpace can help.;28/Aug/06 2:38 PM;wrzep;27000

column1: Pre-commit content checking hooks
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
Create a set of svn pre-commit hooks to check:
- all xmls with xmllint
- blog entries that they have the necessary properties
column293:
02/May/06 12:47 PM;adamw;The hooks are in the labs svn repo, in the portal-extensions/svn-hooks directory.
To install the hooks, do the following:
1. Edit pre-commit and change HOOK_PATH to the hook directory (where the hooks will be copied) and PATH to the appropriate bin paths (at least ones which contain grep etc, xmllint) - that is needed because hook scripts are exceuted with an empty environment
2. Copy them to the repositories hook directory and make sure that they are executable and have access rights to the repository files
column294:
02/May/06 12:49 PM;adamw;The full address to the hooks is:
http://anonsvn.labs.jboss.com/labs/jbosslabs/trunk/portal-extensions/svn-hooks/

column54:
1.  Architecture:  a general class diagram of how it functions with a few examples of method flows (i.e., sequence diagrams)
2.  What technologies it uses
3.  Identify all GPL code.,
4.  An analysis (good/bad features) of the persistence mechanisms used.
5.  A list of the features that forums has (i.e., secure logins, all admin features, roles required, ties to jboss portal)
6.  Tell me what is GOOD about  Forums, and esp. tell me what  is BAD about forums.
7.  Tell me what you think it will take to clean it all up.
8.  What it will take to make it LGPL if possible.

Extend the contributors portlet with the following items:

1. A checkbox to request committer access.
2. A separate approval process triggered by that request
3. A "sponsor" for the contributor so that we know that person isn't  a feral developer... i.e., "Julien Viet" sponsors "Roy Russo" and  Julien also follows a mechanical approval  process at the same time  before Roy is approved.
4.  A more robust way of specifying which projects the user is  contributing to instead of just free text.
5.  Integration with JIRA, as you said, to trigger workflows for each  case.

column1: Investigate Creating Maven Repository Hosted by Labs
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54: Adam, lets see what it will take to host a maven repository on Labs.   The JBoss Rules project is using Maven 2.0 and they have requested this feature.
column293:
08/Dec/05 10:44 AM;adamw;Here's what a repository requires:
1. Read-only access via http
2. Write access via ssh
(both to the same directory of course).

Whole directory structure is maintained by maven (to deploy a jar to the repository you just write "mvn deploy").

So, probably, there must be a special (linux) user who has write access to the repository, which is made available through http with apache.

column293:
15/Nov/05 10:13 AM;dsicore;Adam,

Make sure the following happens:

(via Eric Brown):

Per our previous email thread (see attached), I've removed some extra
services that don't need to be running (security risk):

  httpha-invoker.sar
  jmx-console.war
  jmx-invoker-service.xml
  management/console-mgr.sar

Also, these changes need to be in the standard log4j.xml on labs:

This is normally commented out, but need to be enabled or the logs are
huge:

   <!-- Limit JBoss categories -->
   <category name="org.jboss">
      <priority value="INFO"/>
   </category>


I added this to the last setup, but it didn't make it into the new
deployment.  I added it back a few min. ago:

   <!-- Limit Hibernate categories -->
   <category name="org.hibernate">
      <priority value="INFO"/>
   </category>

   <!-- Limit Blogjosm categories -->
   <category name="org.blojsom">
      <priority value="INFO"/>
   </category>

Thanks,
Eric

column1: Create a subversion hook on post-committ that triggers a content update
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54: Currently, in order to see updates to a project's forge page, the author has to wait a few minutes before the changes are posted as live on the labs website. It should be relatively easy to write a post-committ subversion hook (see here: http://svn.collab.net/viewcvs/svn/tags/1.2.3/subversion/libsvn_repos/hooks.txt?rev=15912&view=markup) that automatically calls into JBoss Labs' update function.
column294: 18/May/06 8:09 AM;ebrown;This assumes the CMS subversion repo lives on the same box as the Portal App.  We're moving CMS to it's own system, so this will not scale.... how about with mutiple app servers in a cluster?
column295:
18/May/06 8:20 AM;adamw;If you look at the scripts (http://anonsvn.labs.jboss.com/labs/shotoku/trunk/shotoku-svn/hooks/), you'll see they work a bit differently: they make a call to a servlet with appropriate data.

In case of a cluster, this would need to be multicasted somehow ... this could be done by the servlet, or maybe there's a better way, I don't know much about how clustering works in JBoss really.
column296:
18/May/06 8:28 AM;ebrown;Ah, ok... I was just going from the comments above.

column1: High Level Project Status Snapshot Dashboard Portlet
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
In the Development Dashboard we need a new portlet which is a "matrix" representation of a given project's current status.  

The first version of this matrix should consist of at least the following rows:

1.  Development Metrics such as:  downloads, number of lines of code, commits per day/week, number of forum posts, etc.

2.  Current QA status:  Test Code Coverage, Flag indicating QA actually exists

3.  JEMS Product Management Status:  Whatever flags that Shaun Connolly says should be here... we need to coordinate with him.

So... to lay this out:

Add a portlet to the Development Dashboard....

That portlet has a list of projects.... with their current "score"

Choose a project by clicking on one on the list...

This will give you their "JEMS Matrix" which is a list of scores for each row.

We need to make the matrix configurable by row and column... so a "Development Row" should be configurable... as should any other "Row"...

Let's start the discussion.  :)

column1: Cosmetic changes to labs website req
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
Marketing would like some cosmetic changes to the labs website project pages:

1. Remove the mandatory headers (Description, More informayion, Services, JEMS Integration, etc...)
2. Remove the "by JBoss" mandatory header after the project name.
3. Enable eloqua tracking across all pages. (include js in the header).

The main point here is that the landing page of all projects should be completely customizeable by the project lead, and no artificial items should be added that cannot be removed.

column1: HTML formatting in project.xml will add extra line-breaks
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
If I use or in project.xml, it will generate unnecessary line-breaks. In the project XML: Kosmos stands for Komposite Open Source Monitoring Suite.
... ...will become: Kosmos stands for K omposite O pen S ource Mo nitoring S uite.
The problem with this is that a "white-space line-break" means a space for the browser! So it will print "K omposite O pen S ource Mo nitoring S uite" which is not that cool.
column293:
23/Aug/05 6:43 PM;dsicore;We'll probably replace the project.xml style.. with something more 'freezone'ish... but.. that is a ways away.

Adam, what do you think?
column294: 24/Aug/05 11:49 AM;adamw;Regarding replacing project.xml, I think that it's good to have a uniform page with information about each project. Like a "fact sheet". Of course, sections can change - if you have any ideas on introducing a general section, let me know - it's very easy to include it on the pages.

column1: Change labs navigation to use render urls
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54: All portlets must use render urls instead of page urls - this was a way to pass information from one portlet to another - but didn't allow for any more advanced project-specific portlets. Now this is required by the new wiki and blog. So a way must be found to cheat the portal and still pass the "selected project" information.
column56: Looking for a possible solution to fix wiki links.;22/Aug/05 3:34 PM;adamw;7200
column57: Wiki tag, portal filter for setting attributes;23/Aug/05 3:25 PM;adamw;16200
column293: 22/Aug/05 3:13 PM;adamw;Unfortunately the page urls can't be replaced by render urls, as with them the page cannot be changed - they are only for one-portlet navifation. So, wiki portlet must be modified accordingly.
column294: 23/Aug/05 3:27 PM;adamw;For now, a temporary solution is implemented - using a special filter which sets the correct attributes basing on the chose URL and unsetting them using special request parameters. The wiki works by using a special tag. An elegant solution requires inter-portlet communication, which will be available in Portal 2.2. Until then, this is a fully functional solution which can be used.

column1: Blog entries are not generated from the HTML files added to the CMS repo
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
Since a couple of days (maybe since the failure of the Labs server around 18th?), the blog entries are not processed anymore: even if I add new HTMLs, nothing happens.
(This is actually quite annoying: no mailing list, broken Forums, broken blog -> hardly any way to communiate with the community.)
column56: Looking for causes of this problem.;22/Aug/05 10:39 AM;adamw;7200
column293: 21/Aug/05 3:44 PM;adamw;I restarted the as and the entries are visible now. No idea why didn't they appear before. I hope that such things won't happen again after the 1.0.2 release. If in this week, you won't see your blog entry after about 15 minutes of posting, please let me know. Also, did you update anything else (like - downloads descriptors, etc.) after posting the blog entries? If yes, did the site update successfully?
column294:
22/Aug/05 2:13 AM;aron.gombas;> Also, did you update anything else (like - downloads descriptors, etc.) after posting the blog entries? 
I've updated downloads.xml and project.xml JUST before adding the new entry to the blog.
There was no problem at all.
After playing with the blog, I didn't touch anything else.
column295: 22/Aug/05 10:41 AM;dsicore;Probably caused by a working copy corruption.
column296:
23/Aug/05 6:32 PM;dsicore;I think this was due to a corruped working copy.  So, may be very difficult to reproduce.

Worst case scenario:  Blogs don't get updated and people complain, we check out a new working copy.
column297: 15/Sep/05 6:03 AM;adamw;Fixed, but no cause found. Most probably caused by a WC corruption, which can be only fixed by hand.

column1: Integrate JIRA and Subversion
column11: The JBoss Labs project management, hosting, and incubator program.
column54:
Adam, find out what this is all about and give recommendations as to how this may help us:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Subversion+plugin
column56: Making a test install and checking the way the plugin works.;12/May/05 3:31 PM;adamw;3600
column293:
12/May/05 3:04 PM;adamw;I've installed it on the sandbox, just to check if it works (and it does). If you go to http://67.19.124.46:8080/jira/browse/FRG-1 and choose the "Subversion commits" you will see how it looks like after a commit. 

It's working principle is simple: the plugin just periodically scans the repository for changes, looks at commit comments and when it finds a name of an issue in it (on the sandbox, FRG-1), shows the information on the "Subversion commits" panel.

I think it would be quite useful when installed on this JIRA (jira.jboss.org):
- sometimes you wouldn't have to double comments (write them both when commiting and then as a comment to an issue); 
- when you, for example, change the API or just improve your code, you don't post a comment to JIRA and write it only in commit comments
- it would be a convenient way to track changes - you have all information about an issue in one place
- you can see how work progresses on issues
Everything provided that commiters are disciplined enough to write issue codes in comments :).

column58: Repository creation, setting up cruise control;12/May/05 11:08 AM;adamw;5400
column293:
12/May/05 11:16 AM;adamw;To check out the new project from svn execute:

svn checkout svn+ssh://jira.sicore.org/usr/local/forge/svn/portal-extensions portal-extensions

Builds are done through maven, to make a build you have to prepare a build.properties file (without checking it into the repo), there is an example file: build.properties.sample.

When you commit something into the repository, it will be checked out by CruiseControl and built (you can see the output here: http://67.19.124.46:8080/cruisecontrol).
While building, these things are done:
- a "build" goal is called for each sub-project (typically, it would be compiling and packaging the classes into a .war file)
- all ".*ar" files (that is, .jar, .war, .ear, etc) are copied from the target directory to the server's deployed directory.

When adding a new project you only have to define the "build" goal in your maven.xml.

column1: Problems with code completion in jsf tag
column11: The defacto JBoss development environment for Eclipse.
column54: Hi! When editing .xhtm page if you use #{} not in jsf tag then you get code completion for everything. If you use for example <h:outputText value=""></h:outputText> and in the value="" attribute i press ctrl+space it gives me code completion that exadel 4.0.4 gave before. If i write myself #{ in the attribute and than press ctrl + space it gives me completion for everything.
column293: 22/Aug/07 3:12 AM;maxandersen;so what is it you like to actually have ? :)
column294: 22/Aug/07 3:22 AM;amitev;To have completion for everything in jsf tag attribute.
column295: 12/Oct/07 6:29 AM;maxandersen;Alexey - is this a regression or expected behavior ?
column296:
12/Oct/07 7:43 AM;akazakov;The difirence is proposals with seam variables for seam projects.
So if you Ctrl+Space in <h:outputText value="|"> you get our JSF proposals + WTP proposals
If you Ctrl+Space in <h:outputText value="#{|}"> you get our JSF proposals + WTP proposals + our Seam proposals
If it is Adrian's problem we can fix it.
So for <h:outputText value="|"> we will get our JSF proposals + WTP proposals + our Seam proposals.
column297: 12/Oct/07 8:43 AM;amitev;It's not a big problem but it is useful
column298:
12/Oct/07 12:26 PM;maxandersen;so currently to get seam proposal you need to type #{ correct ?
But for other jsf components you don't need tto type #{ since it will just be filled in automatically.

Then yes, I think this should be fixed if there isn't any big showstoppers preventing it from being implemented since
column299:
17/Oct/07 10:20 AM;akazakov;Testcase:
1. EXECUTE: Create seam war project
2. EXECUTE: Open home.xhtml
3. EXECUTE: Type <h:outputText value=""/> on Line 11
4. EXECUTE: Ctrl+Space on <h:outputText value="|
5. ASSERT: There is list of proposals with seam variables: "#{actor}, #{applicationContext}, ..."
6. EXECUTE: Edit line 11: <h:outputText value="#{"/>
7. EXECUTE: Ctrl+Space on <h:outputText value="#{|
8. ASSERT: There is list of proposals with seam variables: "actor, applicationContext, ..."
column300: 17/Oct/07 11:28 AM;amitev;Thank you!

column304:
23/Aug/07 9:17 AM;akazakov;We refactored our jsf project templates.
New structure:
JSF 1.1.02 - Reference Implementation
   JSFBlankWithLibs - project with sun jsf 1.1_02 RI libs
   JSFKickStartWithLibs - project with sun jsf 1.1.02 RI libs
   JSFKickStartWithoutLibs - project without any jsf libs
JSF 1.2
   JSFBlankWithoutLibs - project without any jsf libs
   JSFKickStartWithoutLibs - project without any jsf libs
JSF 1.2 With Facelets
   FaceletsBlankWithoutLibs - project without any jsf libs
   FaceletsKickStartWithoutLibs - project without any jsf libs
   FaceletsKickStartWithRILibs - project with sun jsf 1.2 RI libs

column1: Deleting posts error
column11: The JBoss Forums is a portlet designed for the JBoss Portal product.
column54:
1. Fresh install of portal (2.4.1 bundled), deploy JBoss Forums
2. Start Portal
3. Create instance of "local.forums.JSFForumsPortlet" (called JBoss Forums)
4. Add a new page with just forums and navigation
5. Go to "First forum" and add a new topic (I used "subject" as the subject and "body" as the body)
6. Go to the post and press the "x" button to delete it

1. Go into Second forum, create two topics
2. Delete one
3. Both topics will be gone, topic / post count will be zero
4. Add a new topic
5. The topic that wasn't deleted will appear again, but the topics / posts count will be 1 (even though 2 topics are available)
6. This same pattern occurs with any number of topics except one.  Deleting one always causes all of them to vanish and the topics / posts count to reset itself to 0.
column56: I reproduced the problem udner same environement and then I was able to search for a cause and solve it. Commited to all 6 branches as this bug was affecting both releases. Additionally, I wrote posts on forums.;27/Apr/07 8:07 PM;unibrew;5400

column1: building sources
column11: The JBoss Forums is a portlet designed for the JBoss Portal product.
column54:
hi......I try to build sources of forums applicattion (taken from http://anonsvn.labs.jboss.com/labs/jbossforums/trunk).
Apparently it is ok but when I deploy jboss-forums.ear, I have the error that portal-forums-authz-plugin.sar is lost. Inside jboss-forums.ear infact it is not added. I added in build.xml row 162 of authz-jaae-plugin project theese rows:

       <copy todir="${forums.root}/resources/portal-forums-ear">
         <fileset dir="${authz-jaae-plugin.lib}" includes="portal-forums-authz-plugin.sar"/>
       </copy>
       <jar jarfile="${forums.lib}/jboss-forums.ear">
         <fileset dir="${forums.root}/resources/portal-forums-ear" includes="**/*"/>
       </jar>

so, when target output of forums is executed, portal-forums-authz-plugin.sar is added automatically  into jboss-forums.ear

 <fileset dir="${build.lib}" includes="portal-forums.war,portal-forums-ui.jar,portal-forums.sar,portal-forums-authz-plugin.sar"/>

column297:
10/May/07 5:20 AM;sviluppatorefico;you must to try without output directories of authz-jaae-plugin and forums project......so you'll see that portal-forums-authz-plugin.sar cannot be added into jboss-forums.ear because it is not yet created. I've seen that build.xml of build project begin with forums project and then with authz-jaae-plugin. I tried to invert the order modifiing build.xml of build project but without success. Then I thought to patch build.xml of authz-jaae-plugin so that at the end of creation of forums-authz-plugin.sar , it copy that file into jboss-forums.ear. I reconfirm that the last patch is correct. I rewrite you that piece to add at the end of output target of authz-jaae-plugin project :

      <copy todir="${forums.root}/resources/portal-forums-ear"> 
        <fileset dir="${build.lib}" includes="portal-forums-authz-plugin.sar"/> 
      </copy> 
      <jar jarfile="${forums.lib}/jboss-forums.ear"> 
        <fileset dir="${forums.root}/resources/portal-forums-ear" includes="**/*"/> 
      </jar>
column298:
10/May/07 7:38 PM;unibrew;Got it. Basicly, this is why I always use "sh build.sh deploy" but we can have it in both places. Soon, I'll change this whole build script to something more reasonable.

column1: Iteration over hibernate objects in Forums model classes
column11: The JBoss Forums is a portlet designed for the JBoss Portal product.
column54: In many classes of Forums model which were inherited from portal forums we can find iterations over lazy initialized hibernate objects. Many methods kill laziness of hibernate objects and cause common execution of N+1 selects issue. This is really significant bug because when Forums run on real data it causes OOM and java heap space problems.
column56:
- I identified code parts which can cause problems.
- I solved problem of getting PostCount for Forum in efficient way.
- I studdied a little Hibernate caching docs and I made one important improvement thanks to that.
- I found better way of getting PostCount and reimplemented it.
- Then testing and debugging;23/Oct/06 3:11 PM;unibrew;36000
column57: I improved efficency for showing topicCount and postCount on CategoryView and ForumView but after very detailed tests with jboss.com database it appeared that lastPost is still not enough good and I must find better sollution.;31/Oct/06 10:34 PM;unibrew;19800

column1: ForumsModule is overusing toList/toSet methods
column11: The JBoss Forums is a portlet designed for the JBoss Portal product.
column54: Many methods in ForumsModule are using wrongly Portal's Tools.toList() and Tools.toSet() methods. It can cause really serious efficiency problem and leads to Hibernate n+1 queries problem. It must be solved before deploying Forums in production.
column56: I investigated where problem arises and how to cope with it. I made most changes in code but I need to spend more time on detiled tests to be if it is ok now.;12/Oct/06 8:34 PM;unibrew;12600
column288: In some of those cases Hibernate.initialize() should be used. In other simply a lazy initialized collection should be returned.

column1: Refresh issue for actions

column58: refresh issue solved for delete, lock and unlock actions. Still problem exists for move action.;03/Jul/06 12:47 PM;unibrew;3600
column59: probably I have finally found the sollution for the rest of refresh issues;17/Jul/06 7:57 PM;unibrew;3600
column60: Finally I have found sollution. It was Hibernate session/transaction issue and can be solved by calling: getForumsModule().getHibernate().getSessionFactory().getCurrentSession().flush();;18/Jul/06 5:36 PM;unibrew;3600
column293: 23/Jun/06 8:22 PM;unibrew;Adding description to task
column294:
18/Jul/06 5:37 PM;unibrew;Solution:
Call getForumsModule().getHibernate().getSessionFactory().getCurrentSession().flush(); after database operations. It should be needed only when we move entity from one parent to another in hierarchy.

column1: TopicView usecase
column11: The JBoss Forums is a portlet designed for the JBoss Portal product.
column54:
View Topic Usecase

In general the aim of this usecase is to display to the user an ordered list of posts of specified topic. 

ViewTopic might be executed from:
- ViewSummary - by choosing topic to display
- ViewCategory -by clicking last post icon
- ViewForum - by choosing topic to display
- Posting view - when a new post is a reply on bottom of the page a simplified TopicView should be visible

Looking closer into specific features. TopicView should provide:
- clear tabular view of posts one under another in ascending or descending order
- pagination of displayed posts
- each post should be displayed with information about: create date, poster(short information, avatar, buttons to user accounts like: e-mail or communicators), last edit date, edit count
- first post of topic can have poll so TopicView must be able to display it
- posts can contain attachmets so TopicView must diplay them
- a link tree with links to: this topic, parent forum, parent category and root of forums
- links to previous and next topic
- a box for choosing sorting order
- a box for choosing to view posts from last: Day, Week, Month etc.
Depending on security checks, user role and that whether this Forum or Topic is locked
- buttons "NewTopic", "PostReply" and "Quote" to execute Posting view in order to create new topic or reply
- instant reply box with possiblity to submit and preview reply
- buttons to edit or delete post
- buttons to edit, delete, move, split, lock topic

23/Sep/06 2:47 PM;unibrew;It is possible in new Forums.
If you want to have summary view as the default setting for every user the only thing you have to change is one of values of managed bean called "defaultPreferences" found in forums-config.xml.
Setting value of property "summarytopiclimit" to 0 will turn off summary view. Nevertheless each user can override this value in his preferences value. So, if he want summary view he can have one just for himself.

column294:
20/Feb/06 2:03 AM;soshah;Explanation Proof of Concept prototype using Java Server Faces-

The Forums presentation tier in its current form consists of one ForumsPortlet that provides all the presentation tier logic such as (navigation control, usecase processing/routing, and permission based security enforcement). From an MVC perspective, the ForumsPortlet provides the Controller functionality for all the possible usecases, the View functionality is provided by JSPs, and the Model portion of the system is provided by a robust Hibernate based Module while the coarse grained business process layer consists of Command objects.

The primary purpose of the proof of concept is to refactor the Controller functionality provided by a single ForumsPortlet. The idea is to provide a more object oriented controller layer that provides different objects for the purpose of implementing different usecases in the system. Plus, the use of Java Server Faces as the MVC framework will eliminate any navigation control related logic from this layer.

The POC leaves the Model layer of the system untouched.

The POC architecture consists of the following entities:

1)  Managed Beans - there are two types of Managed Beans (View Controllers and Action Controllers). View controllers are Managed Beans that support template oriented usecases. These are typically non-conversational usecase such as View Topics of a Forum, View Summary, View a Category, etc. Action Controllers are used to support more interactive/conversational usecases like Create/Edit Topic, Post a Reply etc. Managed Beans are plain Java Beans and are managed by the JSF Framework

2) Facelets - The View layer of this architecture is implemented using Facelets. The JSPs from the current Forums typically map one-to-one with a Facelet based template. Facelets was selected as the view layer primarily for its built-in integration with JSF. Facelets makes access to the JSF component framework seamless. JSPs don't integrate as well with Java Server Faces. Development is very fast for JSF using Facelets as compared to JSPs. Plus, Facelets seem to be performing much better than JSPs.

3) MyFacesGenericPortlet - This is the MyFaces Portlet that integrates this proof of concept which  is developed as  stanalone JSF application and integrates it into the Portal.


Observations:

The architecture completely focuses only on the object orientation of the controller layer. It leverages the MVC capabilities provided out-of-the-box by the Java Server Faces technology. Even though, Java Server Faces as a component oriented framework provides the ability to create nice custom widgets and UI components, there is no need for that in the Forums. Forums is typically a Form based HTML application and we should be able to refactor the entire application using  *only* the core HTML components that come packaged with JSF.
column295:
20/Feb/06 2:15 AM;soshah;The proof of concept consists of the following usecases refactored from the original portlet

ViewController usecases:

ViewCategory - Displays a list of all the categories. ViewController - org.jboss.portlet.forums.ui.view.ViewCategory and Facelet - views/category/viewcategory_body.xhtml

ViewSummary - Displays a summary of Forum posts when the application is first launched: ViewController - org.jboss.portlet.forums.ui.view.ViewSummary and Facelet - views/summary/viewsummary_body.xhtml

ViewForum - Displays a list of topics associated with a Forum: ViewController - org.jboss.portlet.forums.ui.view.ViewController and Facelet - views/forums/viewforum_body.xhtml

ActionController usecases:

Create New Topic - This is an interactive usecase that lets a user post a new topic within the selected forum. As part of this usecase, the feature support consists of the ability to attach documents to the post, the ability to setup a poll for collecting votes, the ability to preview the post before finally posting it.

ActionController - org.jboss.portlet.forums.ui.action.NewTopic
Associated Facelets - views/topics/posting_body.xhtml and views/topics/posting_preview.xhtml

column1: EWS - release notes
column11: Issue tracker for this project has been moved to: Red Hat Bugzilla
column54:
Release notes are not in sync with plans for EWS. My impression is that the last pdf release notes I received need to be aligned with http://intranet.corp.redhat.com/ic/intranet/EWSReleaseNotes.html but there are some points about the latter that need to be clarified as well.

The most obvious difference is that the plan is to use the scripts startup.sh and shutdown.sh instead of tomcat# start/stop. Another thing is that to use the tomcat native libraries, one shouldn't need to set LD_LIBRARY_PATH but startup.sh should do that automatically based on CATALINA_HOME (JBPAPP-1754).

I see user creation commands missing from the PDF version.

Another issue in both versions is starting/stopping http. I think the correct one should read like:
--- as user "apache" or whatever customer likes to be using
1. cd install_path/httpd && ./.postinstall
--- as root if listen to port 80, as apache otherwise
2. cd install_path/httpd/sbin
3. LD_LIBRARY_PATH=install_path/httpd/lib ./httpd -f install_path/httpd/conf/httpd.conf -E install_path/httpd/logs/httpd.log -k start
4. LD_LIBRARY_PATH=install_path/httpd/lib ./httpd -f install_path/httpd/conf/httpd.conf -E install_path/httpd/logs/httpd.log -k stop 

I'm not sure I have tracked all differences. So I'd suggest you look at both step by step and choose what is relevant.

06/Mar/09 3:43 PM;permaine;I have updated the section on 'Using Apache Tomcat Native installed via zip:' in my copy of the Release Notes.

I've also update the very last part of the section on 'Using Tomcat (5/6) installed via zip:' to include a description of what needs to be done if they want to start tomcat as root.

For the section 'Using HTTP Server installed via zip', I've kept the section on sudo as for the rpm, the process is ran under the user apache for the rpm, so I wanted to keep the instructions there if the user wanted to do that, but I also added additional info for running as root.
column294:
08/Mar/09 12:36 AM;akostadinov;> For the section 'Using HTTP Server installed via zip', I've kept the section on sudo as for the rpm, the process is ran under the user apache for the rpm, so I wanted to keep the instructions there if the user wanted to do that, but I also added additional info for running as root. 

I don't see sudo used in the rpm instructions. The commands to start/stop httpd are "service httpd22 start/stop". These commands are executed as root but apache changes UID to the corresponding regular user.
It should be the same for ZIPs. One needs to execute few commands as root. Let them decide how to do that and don't suggest sudo, because it could lead to serious security holes if user is not experienced with the tool.

column1: GDP deployer servlet not working
column54:
The jBPM Designer is unable to test the connection to jBPM in order to deploy a process definition. It is unable, as well, to perform the deployment.

The "Test Connection..." button delivers a very uninformative error, but the JBoss AS console shows this line:

12:04:49,344 INFO  [[GDP Deployer Servlet]] Servlet GDP Deployer Servlet is currently unavailable
column56:
When starting up JBoss AS an exception used to apper in the log:

17:54:36,291 ERROR [[/jbpm-console]] Servlet /jbpm-console threw load() exception
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/commons/fileupload/FileUploadException
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:2357)
        at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:2671)
        at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Class.java:321)
        at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:303)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapper.loadServlet(StandardWrapper.java:1104)
        ...

Even though the apache-commons upload utility library is clearly contained in the lib directory of the jbpm-console war file.

It seems that the java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError thrown when starting up the AS is the cause of the process uploading problem.

The upload servlet definition, in file ${JBOSSESB_HOME}/lib/jbpm.esb/jbpm-console.war/WEB-INF/web.xml , contains this lines:

<!-- This is the GDP's deployer servlet -->
<servlet>
    <servlet-name>GDP Deployer Servlet</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>org.jbpm.web.ProcessUploadServlet</servlet-class>
    <load-on-startup>1</load-on-startup>
</servlet>
	
The value '1' in element "load-on-startup" means this servlet must be loaded ASAP by the container. And I believe for some reason this happens before the classloader has access to the apache-commons upload utility class.

I commented out the load-on-startup element, thus allowing the container to load the class whenever it deemed convenient, after which the problem went away (as well as the startup error). I haven't found as of now any secondary effects of my action, so I dare to believe it is an acceptable solution to the error. ;21/Sep/07 7:14 AM;bruno;7200
column293:
21/Sep/07 7:19 AM;bruno;Confirmation of the solution I propose, as such, would be greatly appreciated. I still don't understand the internal classloading mechanism, and the reason why this jBPM configuration, which used to work just fine in jBPM alone stopped working when embedded as an ESB.

Regards.
column294:
21/Sep/07 7:22 AM;kconner;Thanks Bruno.

I'll take a look at the classloader and see what is going on under the covers.

column1: Document reliability characteristics as far as message delivery is concerned
Changed body contents is not propagated
column54: When the message body is manipulated inside the service called from BPM then the changed message is not propagated back to BPM engine. See bpm_orchestration1 for example of this behaviour.

column1: Allow for different Message views of the payload at creation time
column54: Means that marshalling and unmarshalling of Messages must preserve the type structure too, i.e., if it was a TextMessage going on to the bus, then it should come out as a TextMessage too.

column294:
26/Apr/07 8:33 AM;kconner;Hiya Prabhat.

The setup is really quite simple. 

We currently have two CI images, one running linux and the other running windows.  Each is executed using ant (via continuum).

Each image runs a local instance of AS, purely for JMS, and requires access to an FTP server.

The repository is at https://svn.labs.jboss.com/labs/jbossesb/trunk and the tests are currently executed, from the top level directory, using the following command.
   ant -f integration-build.xml -Dorg.jboss.esb.properties=/home/integration/product.properties

The property file referenced on the command line overrides those committed into the repository, specifying the configuration of the ftp account.

The linux configuration is currently
  org.jboss.esb.build.deprecation=yes
  org.jboss.esb.build.optimize=off
  org.jboss.esb.build.frominstall=no
  org.jboss.esb.build.debug=yes
  org.jboss.esb.build.tests=no

  org.jboss.esb.alltests.build=yes
  org.jboss.esb.jboss.home=.
  org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.hostname=ftp.ncl.jboss.com
  org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.user=lintest
  org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.pwd=lintest
  org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.dir=/home/lintest/test

but it is only the ftp ones that are relevant.

All notifications are currently sent to jbossesb-tests@googlegroups.com.

   Kev

P.S. The windows CI has been failing for a few weeks, someone broke it while I was on holiday.  I haven't had a chance to look at it yet but will do once our codefreeze has occurred.

There are four properties that you need to configure for ftp access.  You should change these to match whichever ftp server is accessible in your local environment.

org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.hostname  -  The ftp server hostname
org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.user            -  The user name for login
org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.pwd             -  The password for login
org.jboss.esb.test.ftp.dir               -  The base directory for the tests

Kurt has recently asked for the build to be changed to use an embedded ftp server but overriding in this fashion will still be supported.

column305:
22/May/07 11:04 AM;prabhat.jha;There are two issues with to leave AS running:

1. Other testsuite that also requires running AS wont be able to start another instance on the same machine.
2. It will avoid potential problems like you saw with windows which required cleaning up data and temp folder.

I think you can add server start and sever stop target as:

<target name="startserver">
	<java jvm="${java.home.dir}/bin/java" classname="org.jboss.Main" fork="true" spawn="true">
		<arg line="-c default -b localhost"/>
		<jvmarg value="-Xms32m"/>
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx200m"/>
                <sysproperty key="java.endorsed.dirs" value="${jboss.home}/lib/endorsed"/>		
		<classpath>
			<pathelement path="${jboss.home}/bin/run.jar"/>
			<pathelement path="${java.home.dir}/lib/tools.jar"/>
		</classpath>
	</java>    
    </target>
    
    <target name="stopserver">
	<java jvm="${java.home.dir}/bin/java" classname="org.jboss.Shutdown" fork="true">
		<arg line="--server=jnp://${localhost}:1099 --shutdown"/>
		<classpath>
			<pathelement path="${jboss.home}/bin/shutdown.jar"/>
		</classpath>
	</java>
    </target>

column1: Added message properties
column54:
From Burr:

I do like the concept of having things like: 
- name of file before it was sucked in 
- the file ext 
- the hostname/ip address it came from 
- the directory it came from 
- the date/time it was sucked in 
- the size of the file in bytes (perhaps that is easy to calculate since it is in an array)

column1: remove action pipeline
column54:
I think we should discourage action pipelining as it muddies to waters. I think each action should be it's own service, and that all communication is service2service. This way each .esb archive does not have to package up all the Smooks jar (and dependencies). If we think this adds to much overhead then we should fix this by adding smarts to our framework, where it figures out if it can make a local call (go over a local transport). It also muddies the waters from the perspective of a service description if we allow action chaining.

This also removes the need for TwoWayCouriers, since we might as well forward it onto the next service, in stead of replying to the current one. I do think we should make an option for a blocking gateway, where the gateway waits for a a reply from an ESB Service.
column56: There were discussions with Tom B., Esteban and the team last week. The decision was the do this in 5.0 as there will be no perceived benefit at this stage.;17/Apr/07 10:23 AM;marklittle;300
column293: 10/Apr/07 5:52 PM;marklittle;Just as a FYI, take a look at the 5.0 code in the rearch2 branch: that provides one-way comms as the defacto style, with synchronous request-response layered on top as an abstraction.
column294:
12/Apr/07 8:07 AM;tfennelly;Re removing the ability to chain actions... I don't think we should be throwing out the baby with the bath water.  Not saying I'm a big lover of action chaining in its current form, but I'd suspect removing the option completely and replacing it with nothing more than "singleaction + service2service" will meet with some disapproval from the likes of Burr (and others).

When we got Rosetta first, this was effectively what we had.   Plugging "actions" (code that operates on a message) together meant defining separate services and routing the message between them.  Otherwise you had to write monolithic actions (un-reuseable).  IMO, either option was a total pain in the ass from a usability/reuseability perspective.

Why can't we have a happy medium of some sort, where chained actions are still supported but we make "troublesome" actions (for scoping reasons or whatever) into standalone Services as Kurt describes.
column295:
12/Apr/07 8:59 AM;burrsutter;My initial take on this thought is that before we can consider removing action chaining we need to first have the following:
- In VM service2 service invocation/transport
- interceptor/AOP capabilities
- an easier way to visually "see" the flow.

The current action pipeline feature provides these capabilities at a basic level today.   

I like Tom's suggestion about "troublesome" actions such as Transformation, CBR or BPM (I'm guessing these are the ones he is thinking about) that carry a lot of JAR dependencies. We recommend you make those whole services by themselves.   

We might throw this discussion into the Design/Developer forum/list to get feedback from a wider audience as well.
column296: 12/Apr/07 10:45 AM;marklittle;Let's take this to the forums. We've already discussed how action chaining can be supported in jpdl and eventually through DSLs. I see action chaining as a way of building services: it's not core to the ESB because I may want to create my services using something else entirely. The multi-dialect approach I've outlined before would allow us to support action chaining as just one way of creating services, not the only way which is essentially the impression we give users today.

column1: ftp post-directory issue
column54:
When configuring an ftp-message-filter and specifying a post-directory the file still ends up in the directory specified in the directory attribute.

The method renameInRemoteDir(String p_sFrom, String p_sTo) in EdtFtpImpl has a line that looks like this:

m_oConn.rename(getRemoteDir() + "/" + sRmtFrom, getRemoteDir() + "/" + sRmtTo);

The getRemoteDir() method always returns the value of m_sRemoteDir, and as far as I can tell this is never changed after being set to the directory attribute in ftp-message-filter. 

I could not find any unit test for EdtFtpImpl in the svn trunk and was wondering if this would be something I could write. We are currently using an embedded ftp server to test the functionality of the ftp listener via the ESB. My though would be that I could write junit tests for the EdtFtpImpl.java using an embedded ftp server. Let me know if this would be of interest to you. 

Thanks

Daniel

column1: Refactor Notifiers
column54:
These comments are based on the JMS notifiers but will probably apply to the other notifiers as well:

1. The notifiers should be more like listeners where you get one (or more instances). Until they get recycled when there is a config change. Right now the JMS onces
connected and disconnect with every message, which causes stress on the JMS provider when running in high load mode.

2. They should get their 'provider' configuration from the configuration, just like the listeners. Right now you cannot connect to other JMS providers.

3. The notifiers should get hooked up to the same life cycle management as the listener infrastructure.

In other words: They really should be 'inverse gateways', the model is broken and there shouldn't be a distinction between notifying and sending a message via couriers+listeners. The fact we support different transports (and in different ways) for notifiers than for the "core" ESB is just wrong.
column293: 23/Jun/07 9:35 AM;marklittle;No time to refactor and we'd have to support the old style anyway for backward compatibility. Let's just make sure this code is hardened and encourage other approaches (e.g., JCA) for getting outflow to non-ESB components in 4.2. After the GA we can look at doing something else.

column1: getTemporaryReplyTo broken
column54: In some circumstances getTemporaryReplyTo can generate an EPR that will be functionally identical to the original To EPR. If the client and service share the same transport mechanism (e.g., JMS queue) then it's possible that replies to the client may be lost because they get picked up by the service again.

column1: Spring integration example
column56: Added the quickstarts along with readme.txt. Tested the quickstarts and created unit tests for specific Spring related wiring checking. Added a couple JMS queues to the default JBossMQ and JBossMessaging jms destination file.;18/Jun/07 7:35 AM;james.williams;28800
column293:
02/Jun/07 8:32 PM;james.williams;I am almost finished with 3 different Spring quickstarts:

1. spring_helloworld - simple Spring implementation that looks up and invokes POJOs using multiple spring configuration files. 
2. spring_jpetstore - a complicated Spring implementation that turns a JMS transported XML petstore order into a DB inserted record. Leverages SpringAOP, SpringTX, DB connection pooling via Spring and is a nice example of how existing Spring beans can be re-used and integrated into the ESB.
3. spring_aop - a simple SpringAOP example that intercepts a method call and makes changes to a JMS transported POJO outside of the ESB action.

column1: File, ftp and jdbc couriers are not obtaining poll latency from configuration.

column1: Convert documents to Open Office format.
Need support for notification generatoin from within ActionProcessor.process method
column54:
In version 4.0, the Action Processing pipeline management code raises notifications in response to an exception from the ActionProcessor.process method.  The pipeline managemnt code calls the getOkNotification (no exception) or getErrorNotification (exception) to get the notification message.

For many reasons, this is a very flawed model.  Notifications should be raised from within the process method by means of attaching the notifications (error or otherwise) to the message (the mechanism is a design issue).  Once the process method returns, the pipline processing management code can check the message for notifications.  If there are errors, it can/should (?) abort the message processing, send the error notification (by whatever notification options are configured on the listener) and signal the failure to the calling process (by whatever failure config is configured on the listener).

The getOk and getErro methods can then be removed.
column293: 09/Oct/06 7:27 AM;tfennelly;Just another though... In the case of an error being raised, we need to tie that together with the message Fault in some meaningful way.  Perhaps error "notifications" and processing "faults" need to be rolled together.  The process method could simply raise a fault on the message, the pipeline processing management code could then do 2 things - raise an error/fault notification as well as signal the caller with the fault.  Just a thought - sorry if you think I'm jumping the gun ;-)
column295: 11/Oct/06 4:56 AM;tfennelly;Ups, sorry about the formatting there - obviously doesn't support preformatted text.
column296:
30/Apr/07 8:25 AM;marklittle;Have been working on the following changes to the chaining.

If a message comes back from process and it has a Fault defined, then the processing stops and the message will be sent back (it's an error message).

If an error happens at any point in the chaining and/or results in an exception, then a specific error message will be sent back (it will have a Fault defined).

The destination of these error messages will be based on:

(i) FaultTo on original message
(ii) if no FaultTo set, then ReplyTo on original message
(iii) if no ReplyTo, then From on original message.
(iv) if no From then default ReplyTo should have been set at the sender anyway.

Any message returned from process can have its own Call section in the message. In which case, a Fault message returned will be routed giving preference to that information over anything that came in on the original received message.
column297: 01/May/07 6:33 AM;marklittle;Changed handling to use exceptions only in order not to break the new action chaining rules.

column1: Parameter loading doesn't check for XML validity
column54:
The current ParamRepository approach has a File implementation. It all appears to work on Strings (with the comments indicating how the strings should be formatted for structured attributes). However, some user classes assume the String is XML. Parameters should be provided to application classes through name/value pairs. How those pairs are loaded into the system (XML, strings, file, etc.) should be hidden.

We also need an ESB schema.

column304: 18/Dec/06 8:47 PM;kurtstam;The jbossesb.xml is monitored by the ConfigurationController. When the timestamp on this file changes, the file is validated against the jbossesb-1.0.xsd. If it passed validation, it is given to the Generator, to generate the jbossesb-listener.xml and jbossesb.gateway.xml. The latter two files are read into the esb engine, and they have no xsd, since they are pretty much free format.

column1: Change the suffix for the docs
column54:
To avoid confusioin, text files should have the internationally recognised ;-) .txt extension. Word docs have .doc

Our current doc uses the .doc extension when it's really only a text file.

column1: Remove dependencies of new user classes in JBossEsbPersistHandlerBean (and EJB interfaces)
column54:
Public local and remote interface of the persistence handler EJB now takes BaseBusinessObject as argument for several methods.  An unwanted consequence of this signature, is that if future users wish to use the object store,  implementation of the persistence handler would have to be aware of these user classes (for example via a user jarfile in the classpath).

It is advisable to replace references to BaseBusinessObject in EJB method signatures, by references to BobjStdDTO.  All classes (current and future) have a toDTO() method, and the base BobjStdDTO is enough to manipulate the object store.  By doing so, current and future implementations of the IpersistHandler interface will not need to know about user specialization of the BaseBusinessObject class.
column56:
FInished removing BaseBusinessObject, replacing by BobjStdDTO.
Getters and setters had to be added to the DTO.;16/Jul/06 2:17 PM;estebanschifman;86400
column293:
16/Jul/06 2:23 PM;estebanschifman;The persistence handler now depends only on BobjStdDTO.
All locators for objects that go to the store are now added to the DTO just prior to sending it to the store.
Persistence handler now takes locators from the DTO.  It  is now able to store objects without needing to be aware of user classes that extend BaseBusinessObject.

column1: Property name convention
column54: What naming convention should we use for property names? The one from JBossTS is <product package>.<name>, which I prefer.
column293:
27/Jun/06 9:44 AM;estebanschifman;We have been trying to encapsulate as many properties as possible in the org.jboss.soa.esb.common.EsbSysProps class (project EsbCommon)
As long as we can put all of them there, and the source code always uses the class mnemonics, changing the naming convention should be simple.
Properties for the application server have been also encapsulated in a properties file ("jbossEsb.properties" with corresponding change in the properties-service.xml).  The file mover example that Daniel has set up should have that file in the .../conf  directory.
column294:
27/Jun/06 9:47 AM;marklittle;org.jboss.soa.esb.common.<property name> for properties that configure things in common and org.jboss.soa.esb.listeners.<property name> for properties that configure things in listeners etc?

If so, that's pretty much what I had in mind too.
column295:
27/Jun/06 10:35 AM;estebanschifman;Not quite sure Mark.  That would somehow imply that properties correspond to a package.  Do they ? 
if you leave it at   org.jboss.soa.esb.property.XXX they would still belong to ESB but not related to any package in particular

In any case, it doesn't make a big difference
column296: 27/Jun/06 11:44 AM;marklittle;Here's the reasoning behind a finer grained approach along the lines of org.jboss.soa.esb.listeners.<foo>: as the ESB project grows, the size of the documentation will grow and so will the complexity. If we scope the properties so their names clearly indicate what they are concerned with, then it makes it easier for users to cross reference them in manuals and javadocs.

column1: Create HTTP listener/receiver
column54:
Either create one or leverage something that already exists (though for inclusion with JBossESB it should have a small footprint, i.e., not drag in a load of other non-essential classes).

What this means is that we need an HTTP-server side stack so that clients can send HTTP requests (PUT, POST, GET) and the ESB will interpret them appropriately. Currently JDK libraries provide only the client-side to HTTP interactions and no server-side.
column293: 27/Apr/06 8:08 AM;jokum;Is there any technical documentation available about implementing this? Are there any guidelines?
column294: 03/May/06 4:28 AM;marklittle;What we're looking for is an HTTP server implementation: the client side is already covered by what's in the JDK. Something that we can send POST/GET/PUT requests to and have a service deployed on the other end. It may be easier to look at taking something like apache/tomcat and using that straight, rather than reimplement from scratch.
column295:
12/Jun/06 4:07 PM;jokum;That's what I initialy understood using the description. But than there was somthing about deployment and I got confused.

Ok this is what I'm thinking off :

Build a REST servlet which can handle GET, POST and DELETE requests.

GET : will do a receive from a certain service and returns the result. For example : GET http://www.mycompany.com/rest/ordersQueue will get the first message on a JMS queue named ordersQueue

POST : do a synchronous call to a service endpoint and return the result

PUT :do a synchronous call whithout returning a result

DELETE : will do a receive from a certain service whithout returning the result

Like this every service should be accessible using a HTTP method

What do you think about this design?

What I would like to know before I can start developing is how I can delegate the request to the service itself.
column296:
10/Jul/06 5:11 AM;jokum;I created a RestConnectorServlet. Using this servlet you we are able to send and receive events from the ESB. The servlet uses the REST style of request processing.

I added som TODO in the code, here we should integrate with the ESB kernel to look for service endpoints, to send and receive the message itself.

When we can use the RosettaNet kernel I can integrate my code with it.
column297: 10/Jul/06 11:42 AM;marklittle;Thanks. We're going to refactor the codebase in svn and create a place where you can check this in. I'll let you know when.
column298: 22/Aug/07 11:54 AM;scoccera;Have these classes or has this functionality been added to the newest version of the JBoss ESB?  I can't find these classes anywhere and there are no examples of using synchronous HTTP directly (except for a separate service which uses the ESB directly).

column298:
08/Feb/10 5:54 PM;nickboldt;While it should be crazy obvious, documentation should state somewhere that the migration path between JBDS 2.1 and 3.0 is to NOT run update; instead a new installer is required (though old workspace and runtimes should be usable). 

If needed to explain this to users, the reason for this is that the Eclipse platform, EMF, and WTP move in lockstep every year and adopt the newer, faster, better APIs available in each new annual release; so while some things may work on an older platform, many do not and thus a full install is required rather than a simple update.

Additional 3rd party plugins (eg., m2eclipse, mylyn, CDT, PDT) that users may have installed into JBDS 2.1 may work when re-installed into 3.0, but they are unsupported by JBDS and nothing is guaranteed. Chances are new versions (compatible with Eclipse 3.5, not 3.4) will be required.
column299: 09/Feb/10 1:30 PM;OChikvina;As far as I understand besides the things Maxim and Nick wrote about, this guide should mainly contain the  detailed info on how to migrate from an existing JBDS 2.1 installation to JBDS 3.0.0(as it was described in the previous version - http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Developer_Studio/2.1/JBDS_2.0_to_2.1_Migration_Guide).I tried to do the migration like it was described there -using the update site https://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/ but it seems that the link has changed.Does anybody know what link should we use now for studio migration?
column300:
09/Feb/10 6:25 PM;nickboldt;Issue #1:

http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Developer_Studio/2.1/ (and all three links to the migration guide) throw 404s for me. 
* http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Developer_Studio/2.1/en/JBDS_2.0_to_2.1_Migration_Guide/html/index.html
* http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Developer_Studio/2.1/en/JBDS_2.0_to_2.1_Migration_Guide/html_single/index.html
* http://www.redhat.com/docs/en-US/JBoss_Developer_Studio/2.1/en/JBDS_2.0_to_2.1_Migration_Guide/pdf/Getting_Started_Guide.pdf

Issue #2:

You cannot upgrade directly from 2.0 or 2.1 to 3.0; instead, you have to install a fresh JBDS 3.0. As I alluded to above, JBDS 3.0 uses Eclipse 3.5, whereas JBDS 2.x uses Eclipse 3.4; because of this platform change, a full install is required to migrate. Then, once the new install is complete, you can point your new JBDS at your old workspace directory, or create a new one and import old projects into the new workspace.

As to the URLs for JBDS 2.1 and 3.0 updates, they are here:

http://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/2.1/ or https://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/2.1/
http://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/3.0/ or https://devstudio.jboss.com/updates/3.0/

(The 3.0 site contains 3.0M4, not yet the GA release.)

column1: jdocbook:diff plugin
column11: Red Hat CodeReady Studio (formerly Developer Studio) is an IDE which includes a subset of the plugins from JBoss Tools plus various third party plugins in an installable package together with Eclipse and JBoss platforms.
column54:
Investigate whether it is possible to use http://www.jboss.org/maven-jdocbook-plugin/diff-mojo.html instead of diff:mk for docs comparing and diff markers adding.
diff:mk corrupts master_output.xml files by replacing entities on their actual values (e.g. it makes & from &)

column1: JBPM Tools Reference Guide JUnit problem with assertNotNull

column54:
6.1. Creating a Hello World Action

They JUnit test shown in "Figure 6.2. A Simple Hello Action" 

		assertNotNull(
				"The greeting variable should not exist ", 
				instance.getContextInstance().getVariable("greeting"));

always seems to fail as there is no "greeting" variable before it is created in the "transition" from the "start" to the "auction" state. Is this not true? The JUnit succeeds if changed to assertNull

- Text in guides with ent styles is hardly seen (see font.png)

column1: During startup, farm deployment should only pull applications from the cluster coordinator
column11: A cross cutting project encompassing clustering issues related to common clustering utilities and clustering layer integration.
column54:
Change farm deployment code to only pull applications from the cluster coordinator.  Introduce the concept of there being a cluster coordinator that we can pull the applications from.

The cluster coordinator will be known internally as the oldest cluster member to be replaced by the next oldest member in case the coordinator node goes down.
column293: 24/Jun/05 2:06 PM;smarlow;Fixed in 4.0.3 + later
column294: 24/Jun/05 2:07 PM;smarlow;Fixed in 4.0.3 + later.

column1: First deploy after joining a cluster is not farmed
column11: A cross cutting project encompassing clustering issues related to common clustering utilities and clustering layer integration.
column54:
There a problem in org.jboss.ha.framework.server.FarmMemberService that shows during service startup.
It happens with the following scenario.

1- server starts up and joins the cluster, /farm applications are pulled from remote node.
2- farmDeploy() is called for the applications, remotelyDeployed gets filled with their names
3- scanner thread is started and begins calling deploy() for each application
4- by chance, deploy() executes while service status is still STARTING so it call super.deploy() and applications are deployed but their names are not removed from remotelyDeployed
5- you remove application from /farm and farmUndeploy() is invoked.
6- you put again application in /farm, deploy() is called, super.deploy() is called, BUT remotelyDeployed is still dirty from the preceding deploy so farmDeploy() is not invoked and the application won't get farmed

Then everything cleans up and for subsequent deploy/undeploy works correctly.

I tested the solution proposed by Scott Marlow Novell to move the clearing of "remotelyDeployed" flag before the "getState() == STARTING" test and it looks to be working.
column56: Spent 2 minutes making code changes and the rest of the time trying to reproduce.  Once I reproduced it, the rest was smooth sailing.;19/May/05 1:48 PM;smarlow;10800

column1: Stop/start HAPartition from the jmx-console
column11: A cross cutting project encompassing clustering issues related to common clustering utilities and clustering layer integration.
column54:
- take any jboss version
- start it with the "all" configuration
- go to the jmx-console
- go on the "jboss.system:service=ServiceController" mbean
- launch the "stop" operation with the arg = "jboss:service=DefaultPartition"
you should see the stop operation complete on the server console

then
- go back to the mbean
- launch the "start" operation with the same argument

you should see the error message in the console:
  ERROR [org.jgroups.stack.ProtocolStack] no down protocol available !

31/May/05 3:04 AM;ben.wang;This is not a bug. After the ClusterPartition in node1 is stopped and started, you will need to re-deploy the clustered ejb(s) to signify that the replicants have changed. Otherwise, the DRM on node2 has no way of knowing that you have started again.

ClusterPartition simply acts as channel connection. It has no control of re-deploying ejb when starting up.
