column1: Use of isUserInRole from jsp does not work for JACC
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: Use of isCallerInRole from a jsp page is failing because the (javax.security.jacc.WebRoleRefPermission jsp X) permission references the page as via the name "jsp" and there is no default mapping for this. We need to create such a permission mapping for every web.xml security-role element.
column293: 14/Apr/06 5:50 AM;dimitris;Anil, wanna take it?
column294:
20/Apr/06 2:13 PM;anil.saldhana;The problem does not exist because of the permission mapping based on the servlet-name, but rather due to the way the jacc permissions are created based on the metaData while the roles applicable to the caller exist in the JBossGenericPrincipal.

Please refer to the forum thread for more details.

21/Apr/06 2:17 PM;anil.saldhana;Resolved for 4.0.4.GA.  
Needs to be resolved for jboss-head.

column298: 22/Apr/06 2:32 AM;anil.saldhana;Resolved in 4.0 and HEAD with the Appendix (B.19) guideline in the jacc spec.

column1: Small '?' Bug in JBoss AS 4.0.4.CR2
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
There is a small bug in this version that wasn't there in 4.0.3SP1.

If you were to type a path to a servlet, for example the jmx-console, with a backslash at the end:
http://localhost:8080/jmx-console/
Nothing goes wrong. If you entered:
http://localhost:8080/jmx-console
The browser (for me it's Firefox) will display it as:
http://localhost:8080/jmx-console/?

Functionality-wise nothing changes, but the '?' is sorta weird, if not irritating.

I do not know if it is reproducible in other computers, but it is definitely reproducible on mine. I'm using JDK1.5.0_06 in Windows XP SP2. I've tried the manual self-install package and it reappears everytime for the default configuration. For the installer, I tried the ejb3 configuration and it appears too.
column293:
03/Apr/06 10:24 AM;dimitris;I can verify this with IE on the .zip distro too, or latest 4.0.x.

Something to do with the tomcat upgrade, Anil?
column294:
03/Apr/06 10:55 AM;anil.saldhana;Without a backslash at the end, tomcat does a redirect to the url with the backslash enabled. 

I am guessing that on IE, because of the redirect, since there is a GET, it adds the "?" 

It is suggested to always have a backslash at the end of the url, to save the unnecessary http 302 happening.
http://www.jboss.com/index.html?module=bb&op=viewtopic&t=72406&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=10

Let me look around a bit on this in the tomcat space, to see if we have a fix for this.
column295: 03/Apr/06 11:35 AM;anil.saldhana;This is a known issue in TC 5.5.16 which was introduced to a bad fix made by a committer, that has been reverted back, to make it into the next TC release.
column296:
03/Apr/06 11:41 AM;anil.saldhana;The related bug reported in Tomcat and the rollback done by Remy have been documented at:
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=38113

We will fix this in JBoss 4.0.5.CR1
column297:
06/Apr/06 6:00 PM;anil.saldhana;There is like a week left for the TC 5.5.17 build to happen, that has a fix for this issue along with the one mentioned in http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=38113 

So there is a possibility of this making into the 4.0.4GA.
column298:
17/Apr/06 11:25 AM;anil.saldhana;With an upgrade to Tomcat 5.5.17, this issue no longer appears. Tested it on IE.

I am resolving this issue.

Isaac can close this issue, after verification.

column1: NullPointerException at org.jboss.web.tomcat.tc5.WebCtxLoader.start(WebCtxLoader.java:130)
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: Call to org.apache.catalina.Deployer.start() always causes NPE if the application had been previously stopped by calling org.apache.catalina.Deployer.stop(). Looking at the source code WebCtxLoader().stop() clears reference:  this.webContainer = null; which is never re-initialized again. WebCtxLoader().start() assumes that webContainer is never null, hence the NPE.
column294:
08/Apr/06 11:49 AM;vladislavi;yes, I'm using <attribute name="UseJBossWebLoader">true</attribute> and looking at the source I guess it will never work if I use Tomcat's deployer to reload the app. It would be nice though if in such situation start/stop throws an appropriate lifecycle exception to make it clear whats going on.

I use Tomcat Deployer instance directly to restart context. I guess it is a wrong way to do that if useJBossWebLoader=true.

Once i set useJBossWebLoader=true it seems to bypass WebCtxLoader altogether and everything works.

Is it at all possible to reload context with JBoss WebLoader ?
column295:
12/Apr/06 6:38 AM;dimitris;Now it will throw a LifecycleException rather than NPE when restarted (WebCtxLoader is not reloadable).

If you want to restart your webapps you'll need to use in the tomcat deployer config:

<attribute name="UseJBossWebLoader">false</attribute>

Or else just redeploy the whole webapp.

column1: JARDeployer rejects packed deployments with .xml files in deeply nested directories under META-INF/
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
The JARDeployer won't accept jar files that contain .xml files in the META-INF directory, assuming this is a deployment for other deployers (e.g. EJBDeployer).

This is true if the deployment is unpacked and it is the expected behaviour (I believe).

But if the deployment is packed, the whole META-INF/ subtree is traversed (not just the immediate children files) so any nested .xml will cause the un-acceptance of the deployment.
column288: Just deploy the .jar file, and any enclosing deployment, unpacked.
column293: 06/Apr/06 10:00 AM;dimitris;JBAS-1680 externalized the .xml files that should be looked up in the META-INF/ directory in order to reject a .jar deployment.
column294:
06/Apr/06 11:03 AM;dimitris;Done in all branches.

JARDeployer shouldn't check for .xml descriptors in META-INF/ subdirectories, in packed jar deployments

column297: 18/Mar/06 12:49 PM;dimitris;Anil, could you take a look on this failing test, please?
column298: 18/Mar/06 1:23 PM;anil.saldhana;This certainly has to do with the test configuration then.  JBQA-269 is an outstandinding JIRA issue in this regard.
column300:
19/Mar/06 3:46 AM;anil.saldhana;Correction. This is bust in "default" config also.

The fix seems to be in the EnterpriseContext - getCallerPrincipalInternal() method where it should not rely on the SecurityAssociation.getPrincipal but rather on the principal that is set in the EnterpriseContext - the principal that made the call (the real CallerPrincipal).....
column301:
19/Mar/06 9:30 AM;rrajesh;In the testsuite/build.xml "tests-jacc-securitymgr" target, the newconf is set as "jacc-securitymgr" which looks for the jacc config files under testsuite/src/resources/test-configs/jacc-securitymgr which does not exist.

When the newconf is updated to "jacc" it uses the files under testsuite/src/resources/test-configs/jacc to create the "jacc-securitymgr" config. After which the test works.

  <target name="tests-jacc-securitymgr"    description="Tests run against a jboss server with JACC configured + security manager">
    <create-config baseconf="default" newconf="jacc-securitymgr">
column302: 19/Mar/06 11:45 AM;starksm64;I want to look at the current difference in behavior as there was already a change made for this audit testcase as mentioned in the forum thread.
column303: 20/Mar/06 2:55 AM;starksm64;The beanPrincipal is now synched with the incoming call principal by calling getCallerPrincipal so that its correct for the duration of the call.

column1: RMIAdaptor hashs not compatible between 3.2.8 & 4.0.x
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
The jboss-4.0-compatibility-matrix tests 3.2.x clients against a 4.0.x server. These tests are currently failing. 

http://cruisecontrol.jboss.com/cc/buildresults/jboss-4.0-compatibility-matrix 

Clebert did some debugging and determined this is failing due to changes in the org.jboss.jmx.adaptor.rmi.RMIAdaptor interface between 3.2.x and 4.0.x. 

Here is the error: 

Failed to find method for hash:-1844321052135939888 available={3851446659803776630=public abstract void javax.management.MBeanServerConnection.removeNotificationListener(javax.management.ObjectName,javax.management.NotificationListener,javax.management.NotificationFilter,java.lang.Object) throws javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException ... 
        at org.jboss.invocation.MarshalledInvocation.getMethod(MarshalledInvocation.java:407) 
        at org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.InvokerAdaptorService.invoke(InvokerAdaptorService.java:234) 
... 

This test uses the org.jboss.j2ee.Serialization flag on the *client*. No serialization flags are passed to the server: 

  <test-compatibility client-version="3_2_x" serialization-flag="-Dnone" client-serialization-flag="-Dorg.jboss.j2ee.Serialization"/> 

Here is the diff between RMIAdaptor on 3.2 vs 4.0: 

http://anoncvs.forge.jboss.com/viewrep/JBoss/jboss/src/main/org/jboss/jmx/adaptor/rmi/RMIAdaptor.java?r1=1.2.2.3&r2=1.6.6.1
column56: Time used investigating possibilities of fixes.;20/Feb/06 12:48 PM;clebert.suconic;28800
column293:
14/Feb/06 12:39 PM;dimitris;From Scott: 

One way to address this without breaking any version would be to register the methods of all interfaces in the hash mapping. So for methods in the MBeanServerConnection there would be a mapping of the method, and it would be recalculated using the RMIAdaptor subinterface name instead of the MBeanServerConnection.
column294:
20/Feb/06 8:09 PM;clebert.suconic;I"m marking this issue as done.
But I would like someone to validate the changes (since I'm not a JMX expert).

Scott, if you think the changes are okay, please close the issue.
column295: 20/Feb/06 10:58 PM;starksm64;I checked the 1.3.2.6  version of the RMIAdaptorImpl and it looks correct.

column1: TimerService timeout fired within timer-creation transaction
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: Please use the forum reference for more information and a short test case.
column293:
12/Apr/06 2:28 PM;dimitris;Scheduling of a timer is delayed until commit time, when a transaction is active.

This solves the problem of receiving a timeout, while still in the create transaction.

With this change, a secondary issue is what happens when scheduling a timeout, e.g. 500msecs from now, when commit takes place 1000ms from now.

The current behaviour is that by commit time the timeout will happen immediately after the commit. We could revise this so the timeout is recalculated to commit time + timeout.

There is no issue with absolute timeouts, nevertheless.
column294: 12/Apr/06 2:29 PM;dimitris;Fixed in 4.0.x/HEAD

column1: Create a AuthenticationManager/AuthorizationManager plugin testcase
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: We have users integrating custom security managers implementing the AuthenticationManager/AuthorizationManager interfaces, but we don't have an integration testcase that validates the declarative security works with such a usage. We need a simple ear deployment that contains all types of secured components with a test security manager that incorporates the authentication/authorization configuration as part of its service deployment. Ideally all existing declarative security tests should just work against a jboss server with this security manager plugin deployed.

column1: Calling getEJBObject not allowed in ejbPassivate
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: The associated forum posting indicates that the check for calling getEJBObject from ejbPassivate is incorrectly setting the caller's state to be that of an IN_EJB_HOME method. It's really a home method invocation of another bean that is causing passivation to occur.
column293: 13/Jan/06 1:00 PM;starksm64;Need to update the org.jboss.test.cts.test.StatefulSessionUnitTestCase and org.jboss.test.cts.test.StatefulSessionLocalUnitTestCase to validate that getEJBObject can be called from ejbActivate/ejbPassivate.
column294:
18/Jan/06 7:40 AM;dimitris;The problem was that inMethodFlag was not set at all during SFSB passivate/activate so whether getEJBObject() / getLocalEJBObject() (and probably other methods) worked during passivation/activations was more or less random, based on what happened to be on the top of the inMethodFlag stack.

It should be fixed now.
column295: 10/Jan/07 11:59 AM;dimitris;Closing resolved issues.

column1: DeploymentException when deploying archive with a dot in its name
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: The class org.jboss.deployment.SARDeployer incorrectly assumes that the first dot in the simple filename of an archive file separates the name from the extension, but this might not be the case, for example when the the archive file using a naming convention that includes a version number, such as somename-1.0.har.  See the forum entry for a more detailed description.

column1: Need ability to update MBeans using deployment service
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: Currently, the deployment service provides the capbility of creating new MBeans. The administration console project requires the ability to update existing MBeans, for example, for doing things such as modifying the properties of the MBeans that make up the messaging service.
column56: Patch was checked into CVS, along with unit test cases.;01/Jan/06 10:52 PM;peterj;144000
column57:
Resolved two issues.

First, when an mbean is updated a warning appears stating that any comments associated with the mbean could now be out of synch with actual data values.

Second, the issue raised by JBADMCON-134 was resolved.  You can now update mbeans whose names contain multiple attributes, and it doesn't matter what order those attributes appear in.  Of course, a unit test was added to test this functionality.
;08/Feb/06 8:10 PM;peterj;57600
column58: Implemented the ability to update existing data sources.  There is now a new method, updateDataSource, with the same signature as the existing createModule method.  See the comments at  org.jboss.services.deployment.DeploymentServiceMBean.updateDataSource for more details.;01/Mar/06 10:32 PM;peterj;57600
column59: Corrected the lookup of the existing -ds.xml file.  The file will now be found even if it is not located in the defined deployment directory for the deployment service.;09/Mar/06 10:40 PM;peterj;14400
column60: Implemented the ability to remove existing data sources. There is now a new method, removeDataSource, with the same signature as the existing updateDataSource method. See the comments at org.jboss.services.deployment.DeploymentServiceMBean.removeDataSource for more details.;20/Mar/06 6:44 PM;chilin;144000
column293: 20/Dec/05 6:43 PM;peterj;The related admin console work item is JBADMCON-79.  That JIRA issue also contains a proptotype of the patch.  Once I get some test cases ritten, I will commit the patch (after some clean-up such as removing debugging code) and the test cases.
column294:
01/Jan/06 10:50 PM;peterj;I have checked in the changes necessary to implement this capability.  Refer to the method org.jboss.services.deployment.DeploymentManager.updateMBean.

Additionally, I have added unit test cases to org.jboss.test.deployment.test.DeploymentServiceUnitTestCase.

The code checked in includes a fix for an issue that Chi noticed - it the MBean property is not simple text but rather XML (see DefaultSecurityConfig of SecurityManager for an example).  A unit test case was included that verifies that such attributes are handled properly.

This patch should close this JIRA issue, but I will leave it one for another week to verify that no further changes are necessary.
column295:

I will attempt to change the generated XSLT such that the xpath will match the node no matter in what order order the parts of the name appear.
column296: 08/Feb/06 8:12 PM;peterj;See work log for recent patch.  One more issue remains - updating existing data sources.
column297: 01/Mar/06 10:33 PM;peterj;I will close this issue once the admin console team has verified the latest patch.

column1: OutOfMemory error when repetatively deploying and undeploying with 10 minute interval
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
Using a manual copy and delete mechanism with the server\default\deploy folder the sample ear (attached) caused an outofmemory error eventually after 90 repetitions.
The min and max heap settings were configured as : -Xms128m -Xmx512m
The time delay after dropping/deploying the ear at each repetition was set to 10 minutes after which the ear is deleted/undeployed followed by a 10 second sleep till the next deploy cycle.

I find this behaviour strange because http://jira.jboss.com/jira/browse/JBAS-1319 is supposed to have fixed this issue.

The lines from the server.log surrounding the java.lang.OutOfMemoryError are as follows:

2005-09-24 06:04:31,413 DEBUG [org.jboss.mx.loading.UnifiedClassLoader] New jmx UCL with url null
2005-09-24 06:04:31,413 DEBUG [org.jboss.mx.loading.RepositoryClassLoader] setRepository, repository=org.jboss.mx.loading.HeirarchicalLoaderRepository3@e51e50, cl=org.jboss.mx.loading.UnifiedClassLoader3@c90207{ url=null ,addedOrder=0}
2005-09-24 06:04:33,057 ERROR [org.apache.commons.digester.Digester] Begin event threw error
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
2005-09-24 06:04:33,057 ERROR [org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[jboss.web].[localhost].[/XMPVXE0Partion/VXE1_ContentTestService]] StandardWrapper.Throwable
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
2005-09-24 06:04:33,057 ERROR [org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[jboss.web].[localhost].[/XMPVXE0Partion/VXE1_ContentTestService]] Servlet /XMPVXE0Partion/VXE1_ContentTestService threw load() exception
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
2005-09-24 06:04:33,072 DEBUG [org.jboss.mx.loading.UnifiedClassLoader] New jmx UCL with url null


The following two jars were added to the server\default\lib folder. 
commons-validator.jar --- version 1.1.3
struts.jar ---- version 1.2.4

 -Xms32m -Xmx32m

column296:
27/Sep/05 8:46 PM;adrian.brock;Part of the problem appears to be related to the new RunAsListener (see subtask JBAS-2305)

I would doubt that is the whole problem? Since a redeploy should clear the threadlocal.
I am also seeing links via reflection to a constructor generated through Tomcat's digester.

I also see struts/tiles using static datastructures, as I said on the related/original bug report this Apache/Jakarta code
is notorious for causing memory leaks with static collections. That is an issue for the struts project.
I'm certainly not going to debug old versions of Struts.
column297: 27/Sep/05 11:22 PM;starksm64;The same deployer thread should also be used, so the RunAsListener issue should have only been causing a leak of the last deployment. Unless this can be shown to be really a jboss problem this will be closed as rejected since we do not rely on any of the frameworks that seem to be causing the problem.

column299:
28/Sep/05 5:02 PM;adrian.brock;The issue is commons-beanutils using a static commons-collection FastHashMap see the attached Data.txt which shows hard references to struts classes. FastHashMap This is beanutils 1.6 that comes with Tomcat, but it isn't fixed in the latest release either.... org.apache.commons.beanutils.PropertyUtils::clearDescriptors /** * Clear any cached property descriptors information for all classes * loaded by any class loaders. This is useful in cases where class * loaders are thrown away to implement class reloading. * *

For more details see PropertyUtilsBean.

* * @see PropertyUtilsBean#clearDescriptors */ public static void clearDescriptors() { PropertyUtilsBean.getInstance().clearDescriptors(); } Given Sun's JDK1.4 also has a memory leak on cached PropertyDescriptors http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4809008 just fixing commons-beanutils won't solve the problem anyway.

We should investigate writing either a Tomcat valve or a more general DeploymentInfo hook
where arbitrary cleanup (via beanshell?) can be performed per (web context) undeployment.

We can then write a beanshell script that attempts to "fix" known broken caches.
column301: 27/Sep/06 8:50 AM;dimitris;Clebert, I suppose you are not working on this?
column302:
27/Sep/06 1:53 PM;clebert.suconic;Common-BeanUtils is broken:

org.jboss.web.tomcat.tc5.WebAppClassLoader@6455597
!--- class org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet
!--- !--- [Ljava.lang.Class;@15889588
!--- !--- !--- java.lang.reflect.Method@2653351
!--- !--- !--- !--- [Ljava.lang.reflect.Method;@14422877
!--- !--- !--- !--- !--- java.util.Hashtable$Entry@23818829
!--- !--- !--- !--- !--- !--- [Ljava.util.Hashtable$Entry;@18693832
!--- !--- !--- !--- !--- !--- !--- java.util.Hashtable@17102985
!---!---!---!---!---!---!---!--- StaticFieldReference private static java.util.Hashtable org.apache.commons.beanutils.MappedPropertyDescriptor.declaredMethodCache  Detail


There is a list of declaredMethods (Reflection) being referenced inside of MappedPropertyDescriptor.

BeanUtils is now being bundled with JBoss/JSF at this point.


If you want to avoid this bug for this specific application, having BeanUtils deployed within the application + classLoader isolations will make BeanUtils to keep circular references inside the classLoader what would avoid the contention.


We should look for a way to contribute a fix for apache.

Besides this reflection cache, it looks also they have a circular reference on their WeakHashMap, having the classLoader on the value. (but I'm not sure about that one).
But I know for sure BeanUtils is broken.

Dimitris, since this is a Beanutils bug, what should we do here? Close, postpone? It's your call now.
column303: 27/Sep/06 1:55 PM;clebert.suconic;Dimitris: I'm assigning this to you, just to you take a look on what to do next. If you want me to take a look on this again during 4.0.6, I can look at it. For now I'm assigning this to you just for you take a decision.
column304: 27/Sep/06 1:59 PM;clebert.suconic;I just realized Adrian's comment on BeanUtils. So I didn't discover anything new here.
column305: 28/Sep/06 7:09 AM;dimitris;It's too late for 3rd party updates at this point, so let's revisit this in the next release. Thanks Clebert!
column306:
28/Sep/06 10:30 AM;clebert.suconic;We could update BeanUtils to use SoftReferences on reflection.
The easiest way to do this would be to use PersistentReference (a package I created for JBossSerialization) and recreate reflection automatically in case the SoftReference is released earlier than expected.

We could contribute PersistentReferences to Apache and use it on BeanUtils. (But I don't know if we want to do this. I know we could since I"m the author of the package)

http://fisheye.jboss.org/browse/JBoss/jboss-serialization/src/org/jboss/serial/references/PersistentReference.java?r=1.3

svn co http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/beanutils/trunk/ bean-utils
cd bean-utils
wget --no-check-certificate https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12378445/BEANUTILS-291-FixMemoryLeaks-v2.patch

18/Apr/08 1:23 PM;mmillson;I found the issue with the notifcation listener. It was importing com.sun.org.apache.commons.beanutils.MappedPropertyDescriptor from jsf-impl.jar instead of org.apache.commons.beanutils.MappedPropertyDescriptor from commons-beanutils.

After this change, the notification listener removed commons-beanutils from paths from GC root. I did get OOME, but with a different paths from GC roots to classloader.

column1: org.jboss.invocation.pooled.interfaces.Optimized*Stream break object serialization contract
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54: In looking into why a 4.0.3RC2 PooledInvokerProxy could not be read by the 4.0.2 codebase, the problem is that the override of the writeClassDescriptor/readClassDescriptor in the Optimized*Stream classes is throwing away information that would allow binary compatible changes such as the addition of new fields to the ServerAddress class to be dealt with. Instead, such a change is resulting in an EOFException. The same proxy when read over a standard ObjectInputStream during the bootstrap lookup from jndi is read without any problem.
column293:
11/May/06 6:04 PM;clebert.suconic;To have an older version of PooledInvokers working with the current version you need to define a System property called:
org.jboss.invocation.pooled.Legacy
column294:
12/May/06 1:36 AM;clebert.suconic;Compatibility tests are failing.
From what I could see,  the fix I made works but there still some incompatibilities hence I'm reopening this same issue instead of opening a new one
column295: 12/May/06 4:34 AM;dimitris;Need to fix the compatibility testsuite!!!
column296:
12/May/06 4:58 PM;clebert.suconic;It's not possible to fix this issue on the way it was originally created. 

PooledInvokers on 4.0.x won't be compatible with 4.0.2. If we come up with a fix on 4.0.2 than 4.0.3 and 4.0.3.sp1 will be broken.


What we did was change Optimized*Stream to send the correct versioning information, this way we won't have this problem happening again.

Final test suite behavior:
If any servers failed to shutdown before timeout should get destroyed and test suite execution continue. 
The whole execution of the "tests" test suite target is recorded in output/tests.log on INFO level.
Last action in the "tests" test suite target is to check if any servers failed to shutdown and fail the build.

Compare number of test cases executed to number of test cases reported so we catch cases where reports get overwritten. (see  	 JBAS-4103)

column1: TimeoutFactory should expose thread pool
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
The TimeoutFactory should expose its internal thread pool for both programmatic configuration
and JMX management.

The current implementation is no conducive to this concept since it is a singleton.
To avoid potential backwards compatibility problems, I'd suggest writing a separate class
that can be exposed as an MBean (like the thread pool) with the old singleton class
using the new class for its singleton.

Also, since there are no adequete tests for this feature and it is used in a number of places,
a comprehensive set of tests need to be written to avoid breaking this class.
column293: 22/Jan/06 9:54 AM;starksm64;This needs to be redone.
column294: 30/Jan/06 4:00 AM;dimitris;Restored the previous implementation, enhanced with new interface methods, so except for the singleton factory new TimeoutFactories using a user provided ThreadPool can be created and shutdown.
column295: 10/Jan/07 11:59 AM;dimitris;Closing resolved issues.

column1: XMBean Interceptor for InvokerAdaptorService to deal with NonSerializableExceptions
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
This patch add a Interceptor to org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.InvokerAdaptorService besides AuthenticationInterceptor that is responsable for prevent remote clients to launch NonSerializable exception.

The interception have 3 types of action: Invisible, Null and Wrapper. 

In the Invisible mode all NonSerializable fields are ignored so if you call getMBeanInfo all NonSerializable will be remove and returned to your remote client(twiddle, MC4J, etc). This mode is more tested so it is recommended.

In the null mode NonSerializable fields are visible but always return Null.

The wraper mode is not implemented, but the idea is replace the NonSerializable Class for another

The interceptor is only a class. The tests are in the patch too. Only test for invisible mode. I´m still doing tests for the other modes.

Any idea is very appreciated. I dont have sufficient time to work more in this code. But I hope to do soon.
column293:
24/Jun/05 2:08 PM;fabcipriano;File JBAS-1955a.zip is a patch of the patch :-D

Tests updated too to reflect bugs fixed
column294: 26/Jul/05 2:28 PM;fabcipriano;Updated patch
column295:
26/Jul/05 2:40 PM;fabcipriano;This patch was refactored to be more flexible.  Instead define among 3 types of actions we choose a Translator Class action that has a procedure that we want. There is 2 classes of translator implemented NullTranslator and InvisibleTranslator just describe above. Follow a example:

               <interceptors>               	
                  <interceptor code="org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.ValidateSerializableObjectsInterceptor"
                      translateToClass="org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.InvisibleTranslator"/>
                     <--  other action implemented is  org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.NullTranslator-->
               </interceptors>

New tests for the NullTranslator and fix to the InvisibleTranslator commented in the code and new more tests.
column296: 21/Feb/06 11:43 AM;dimitris;Essentially a new feature, so moving to the next release

08/Jan/07 4:26 PM;dimitris;Just in case Fabiano - can you get me one single .zip containing the latest version of those files?

Or do I need to use all 3 zip files to reproduce it?
column298:
08/Jan/07 4:46 PM;fabcipriano;Dimitris the last version it is the JBAS-1955a.zip  file. I could not remove the other files.

So just use JBAS-1955a.zip the last file added.

Thanks.
column299: 08/Jan/07 4:49 PM;fabcipriano;Another thing the code base used to make the patch was the 4.0.2 Final. If you want I can make another patch using the 4.0.5.GA code base.
column300:
09/Jan/07 2:30 PM;dimitris;I've used the patch as a starting point to create an interceptor with plugable polices:
org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.SerializableInterceptor
org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.SerializablePolicy

The default policy converts ModelMBeanInfo returned by getMBeanInfo into plain MBeanInfo, striping away the ModelMBeanAttribute infos that contain the non-serializable Descriptors that cause the trouble:

org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.serializablepolicy.StripModelMBeanInfoPolicy

This essentially emulates the behaviour we have with jboss 4.0.x when used with jdk1.4. I.e. you are able to read remotely over the jmx adapter  MBeanInfo for all registered mbeans. Howerver, if you try to read non-serializable fields you still get a NonSerializableException.

A different policy could be created to deal with this scenario, if necessary.

The interceptor is enabled by default in deploy/jmx-invoker-service.xml:
<interceptor code="org.jboss.jmx.connector.invoker.SerializableInterceptor"
policyClass="StripModelMBeanInfoPolicy"/>

Kudos to Fabiano for the original patch.

column1: New twiddle 'xmbean' command for producing skeleton xmbean descriptors
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
Writing xmbean descriptors for existing (standard) mbeans is tedious to do by hand.

Introduce a new command for twiddle, called 'xmbean' that prints out mbean metadata as an xmbean descriptor, 

Simply redirect the output and use it as a skeleton for the xmbean descriptor.

It can be used as a debugging aid, too, that prints out the detailed MBeanInfo information for a live MBean.

Usage: xmbean <object-name>

Maybe a flag to control this would do?

But this needs to make sure the replaced entries in the descriptor fully match the entity declaration in the DTD, plus it'll have to be changed whenever they change.

Do you want to contribute this? :)

column1: A BarrierController service to allow start/stop dependecies triggered by notifications
column11: This project represents the JBoss Application Server versions 6 and earlier.
column54:
In a nutshell, create a service controlling (starting/stopping) a secondary barrier service, on the reception of triggering events (e.g. server startup/shutdown).

Other services can in turn depend on the barrrier service (and follow it's starting/stoping lifecycle) using a simple <depends> element.

See the associated references

column1: Create next version of mod_jk (1.2.19)
column11: Issues related to integration of Tomcat, Apache Httpd, mod_jk, apr and other Apache projects with JBoss.
column54:
Make a next release of mod_jk:

The most important new features:

- Implement hierarchical worker configuration via attribute "reference".
- Load-Balancer: Combine different runtime states and configuration states into one runtime state and one configuration state.
- Logging: pass interesting result info as Apache notes, especially for load balancer
- Log use of deprecated properties
- All servers use same default log level INFO
- 40107: Rewrite is_socket_connected function. Non blocking socket is not used any more.
- Connection no-reuse patch
- Make rewrite_rule_map and log_level as non mandatory directives for isapi_redirect.
- Update GUI-handling for jk status worker forms; include auto-update.

column1: Create next version of mod_jk (1.2.18)
column11: Issues related to integration of Tomcat, Apache Httpd, mod_jk, apr and other Apache projects with JBoss.
column54:
Changelog                                                                 
                                                                          
Preface                                                                   
  This is the Changelog for Tomcat Connectors. This changelog does not    
  contain all updates and fixes to the Tomcat connectors (yet). It should 
  contain fixes made only after November 10th 2004, when the new          
  documentation project for JK was started.                               
                                                                          
Changes from the released JK 1.2.18                                       
  Native                                                                  
    fix    Using socklen_t in getsockopt. Also introducing jk_sock_t.     
           (mturk)                                                        
    update Allow recovery wait time below 60 seconds (new minimum is 1    
           second). (mturk)                                               
                                                                          
Changes from the released JK 1.2.17                                       
  Native                                                                  
    fix    Fix hanging jk status worker when certain attributes are being 
           updated due to double locking. (rjung)                         
    update Allow JkMount to behave like uriworkermap.properties by        
           parsing pipe symbol as two directive marker. (mturk)           
                                                                          
Changes from the JK 1.2.16                                                
  Native                                                                  
    update Added simple rewrite capability for IIS. Although simple it    
           will fulfill most needs. (mturk)                               
    update Added RECOVER_ABORT_IF_CLIENTERROR recovery_option that closes 
           the connection if client connection is broken during the       
           request. (mturk)                                               
    update Renamed cache_timeout directive to connection_pool_timeout.    
           (mturk)                                                        
    update Added connection_pool_minsize directive. (mturk)               
    update Deprecate recycle_timeout directive. (mturk)                   
    update Corrected some HTML syntax bugs in output of status worker.    
           (rjung)                                                        
    update Added the refresh=n parameter to the status worker. It will    
           update the display every n seconds. (rjung)                    
    update Balancer: Add attribute distance to balanced workers to        
           express preferences between workers. (rjung)                   
    update Balancer: Add attribute jvm_route to balanced workers to be    
           able to use the same target in different balancers. (rjung)    
    update Status: Add lb_mult to status. (rjung)                         
    update Balancer: Make different balancing strategies work in a        
           similar way (use lb_value, use decay during global             
           maintenance, use integer factors for weights. (rjung)          
    update Balancer: Improve locking. (rjung)                             
    update Balancer: Workers start slower after recovering. (rjung)       
    update Balancer: Make different balancing strategies work in a        
           similar way (use lb_value, use decay during global             
           maintenance, use integer factors lb_mult for weights). (rjung) 
    update Balancer: Move recovery check to global maintenance. (rjung)   
    update Balancer: Add global maintenance method, that is called in     
           only one process. (rjung)                                      
    update Extend our use of autoconf to find a 32Bit and a 64Bit         
           unsigned type and their printf formats. (rjung)                
    update Logging: piped loggers for JkLogFile and Apache 1.3. (rjung)   
    update Logging: Add PID to log lines for each log level apart from    
           REQUEST. (rjung)                                               
    update Logging: flush buffered logs to keep lines in correct order.   
           Output final newline together with log message. (rjung)        
    update Reducing shm size. (rjung)                                     
    update Only log removing of old worker, when we actually do it.       
           (rjung)                                                        
    fix    37469: Fix shared memory close for forked childs. The shared   
           memory will be closed by the parent process. (mturk)           
    fix    37332: Fix potential misuse of buffer length with snprintf     
           functions. (mturk)                                             
    fix    38859: Protect mod_jk against buggy or malicious AJP servers   
           in the backend. Patch provided by Ruediger Pluem. (mturk)      
    fix    38889: Use worker map sorting depending on the path elements,  
           to comply with Servlet spec. Patch provided by Steve Revilak.  
           (mturk)                                                        
    update 36138: Added Busyness lb method. Patch provided by Chris       
           Lamprecht. (mturk)                                             
    fix    Fix pessimistic locking mode. The patch correctly handles the  
           burst load, by syncing the access to the shared memory data.   
           (mturk)                                                        
    fix    38806: Reclycle worker even if it is disabled. This fixes      
           hot-standby workers in error state. (mturk)                    
    fix    37167: Allow building with BSD-ish like make. (mturk)          
    fix    ISAPI plugin (isapi_redirect.dll) did not provide correct      
           request data for IIS to include in the IIS log. (markt)

column1: set(* $instanceof{Type})->*) captures derived sets  where Type is introduced. execution(public $instanceof{Type}->new(..)) does not capture derived method executions if Type is introduced but it does work if Type is not introduced.
column11: Please review the template project and its related documentation for the recommended project management practices. http://jira.jboss.com/jira/browse/JBTPL
column54:
(After I submit this I'll be including a jar file with the source code and jboss-aop.xml).

I introduce a type, ex.ITrackedObject, into a class, ex.Address1 with the following:
	<introduction class="ex.Address1">
		<mixin>
			<interfaces>
				ex.ITrackedObject
			</interfaces>
			<class>ex.TrackedObjectMixin</class>
			<construction>
				new ex.TrackedObjectMixin()
			</construction>
		</mixin>
	</introduction>

When I use the following:
	<pointcut name="SkipTrackedObject" expr="!set(* ex.TrackedObjectMixin->*)"/>
	<pointcut name="SetImplementorFields" expr="set(java.lang.String $instanceof{ex.ITrackedObject}->*)"/>
	
	<bind pointcut="SkipTrackedObject AND SetImplementorFields" >
		<interceptor class="ex.SetInterceptor" />
	</bind>
All sets of all instance fields in Address1 are successfully intercepted by ex.SetInterceptor.

When I use the following:
	<pointcut name="ClearTrackingAfterThis" expr="execution(public $instanceof{ex.ITrackedObject}->new(..))"/>
	
	<bind pointcut="ClearTrackingAfterThis">
		<interceptor class="ex.ClearChangesAfterMethodInterceptor"/>
	</bind>

None of the constructors are intercepted by ex.ClearChangesAfterMethodInterceptor.

On the one hand, $instanceof{...} + set works with the introduced type, whereas $instanceof{...} + execution does not work.

If I instead directly implement ex.TrackedObjectMixin (which implements ex.ITrackedObject), as I do with Address2 (see uploaded example), all sets are intercepted and the constructor is also intercepted.

column1: Removal of AdviceBindings in runtime fails if aopc is used
column11: Please review the template project and its related documentation for the recommended project management practices. http://jira.jboss.com/jira/browse/JBTPL
column54:
The removal of AdviceBindings at runtime doesn't update class advisor interceptor chains when the user uses aopc.
Suppose this use case: the user classes are instrumented in compile time (through aopc), and the user, at runtime, adds and removes bindings. To remove bindings, the user invokes one of the methods "removeBinding" or "removeBindings" from aspect manager. Both methods invoke "clearAdvisors" on each AdviceBinding being removed. The "clearAdvisors" method, on the other hand,  uses "AspectManager.isAdvisorRegistered" method  in order to check if each advisor contained in the binding is registered in aspect manager. Only the advisors registered in aspect manager receive the "removeAdviceBinding" invocation, responsible for rebuilding the interceptor chains contained in the advisor. But the method "AspectManager.isAdvisorRegistered" not only checks if advisor is contained in "advisors" map, but also checks if the advisor class loader is registered in "registeredCLs".  The problem here is that advisors class loaders are registered during transformation, and the transformation occurs during aopc execution, instead of user classes execution (runtime). Henceforth, in this scenario, the advisors class loader aren't registered in "registeredCLs" and aren't notified of the AdviceBinding removal, and don't update their interceptor chains.
To make the bindings removal work properly in this use case, the advisor must register its class loader at runtime; this could be made in the attachClass method, for example.
column56:
Added the following code line to ClassAdvisor.attachClass method:
manager.registerClassLoader(clazz.getClassLoader());;04/Jun/05 12:36 PM;flaviarnn;900

column1: Sort out maven builds
column11: Open source highly scalable data grid platform
column54:
The maven setup has been refactored such that:

* Each module is built separately
* The parent POM is now in this distribution rather than an external project (as was the case in JBoss Cache)

What still needs to be done:

* distribution to be added as a module in the aggregator module
* mvn clean, mvn test (from root and from module directories) should *not* build javadocs unnecessarily
* mvn install should cause the aggregator module to:
   * collate javadocs from all other modules in a single, coherent apidocs dir which can be uploaded to docs.jboss.org
   * build distribution as a ZIP
* tests should work regardless of whether they are executed from within a module dir or in the root
column56:
distribution pom had the wrong relative path to parent.  corrected that.  

re: javadoc and test jar in created in distribution module
moved jar and javadoc plugin configuration to a profile enabled with the property build-jars, which is by default true and false in distribution module.    

ideally, this could be controlled by the packaging type.  this implementation could be revisited to adjust the profile to react only to modules who are not packaging type 'pom' which could get rid of the property build-jars.;09/Apr/09 7:59 AM;adriancole;3600
column57: previous approach didn't work used the <phase>none</phase> to disable plugins in distribution module instead;14/Apr/09 1:14 PM;adriancole;3600
column58: build failed from the root pom, related to filesystem issues.  changed tests so that they accept the testng provided ${basedir} from which the test path is built.  With this restructuring, the tests now pass.;15/Apr/09 10:36 AM;adriancole;18000
column59:
implemented the assemblies using moduleSet assemblies. 

The only non-intuitive one is single_jar.  

single_jar is a composite of all modules.  Currently, the maven assembly plugin does not have means to create a nested zip file.  As such, I added a plugin configuration to the top-level pom to create a composite jar via ant, which would be picked up later by the assembler.  

Next, the assembly for single_jar is currently inserting all modules' jar artifacts under the .ignore directory.  I sent a question on how to avoid this to the maven user group.

NEXT ACTIONS:
Q/A and hunt down .ignore issue;17/Apr/09 10:08 AM;adriancole;50400
column60:
eliminated transitive deps and core from sub-modules and excluded noted volatile directories

reworked single_jar attachment via ant so that it doesn't include module jars.  Currently, the only maven way to do this would be to introduce an assembly step for each module.  This is not a good option, as the assembly is a downstream concern.  When the maven assembly plugin matures, we should be able to get rid of the antrun configuration in the root pom.xml;17/Apr/09 1:06 PM;adriancole;10800
column293: 17/Apr/09 10:38 AM;manik;The current setup seems to have infinispan-core-...jar repeated in the various lib directories of all the modules, along with deps for infinispan-core.  This bloats the distribution significantly.  Any clever way to resolve this?
column294: 17/Apr/09 10:39 AM;manik;(the last comment was re: the all distribution).  The same applies to the test/modules dir, which duplicates not only infinispan-core but infinispan-core-test as well.
column295:
17/Apr/09 10:46 AM;manik;src: this package packages transient directories such as "coretarget" and "Horizon-BdbjeCacheStore" which should be excluded.

single-jar: infinispan-all.jar is missing!  Even though module jars are in .ignore

column1: Huge repos cannot be exported
column11:
Guvnor is one of the components supporting web tooling for Drools and jBPM. This JIRA project can be used for any issues relating to Drools web tooling.

See http://blog.athico.com/2013/06/goodbye-guvnor-hello-drools-workbench.html for details.
column54:
Repos larger than ~40k assets cannot be exported

So far we have tried with current Jackrabbit 1.4 and an upgraded version 1.5.2.
40k assets in a repo (just rules, no binary files) seems to be the limit.

column297:
09/Feb/09 6:01 PM;michaelneale;Will get a chance to look into it soon, I promise !

My main fear is that the export/import feature is not being used as intended. We are tied by the limitations of the JCR spec as to how it behaves - which is not always as expected (ie it resets the created date, and also doesn't import all the history). It is not intended as a backup by any means ( should use filesystem or database mechanism for this).

column1: Refreshed required after deleting container
column54: - Go to edit page --> select container tab on Page editor --> choose layout: columns layout ( 2 or columns) --> select application tab --> drag & drop application to one columns --> return to container tab --> move the cursor to the container does not contain application --> click delete container --> still delete container contain application --> Error.
column293: 11/Jan/10 4:28 AM;trong.tran;after following the reproduction, i refresh the browser and it seems everything still works fine in server side
column294: 13/Jan/10 3:53 AM;hoang_to;To handle container-related issues like this one. We need to have final agreement on container concept. At the moment, any container ( row, column, tab, mixed...)  is bounded by an outer container (merely a decorator from UI view ). We need a firm decision on keep/remove that outer container once all the inner ones are removed.

column293:
29/Nov/09 10:17 PM;hoang_to; In fact, reported bug happens in following following step

- Step1:  Edit any page, have 'Show-max-window' checked, then save the process in Portal Composer

- Step2:  At this moment, we could see the page layout changed. Browse to any page belongs to another navigation

- Step3: Go back to edited page, the page is displayed in normal mode


In reported scenarios, the Group Navigation page belongs to Portal navigation ( whereas edite page is in Executive Board group navigation ). That follows exactly above steps.
column294:
02/Dec/09 2:32 AM;hoang_to;That issue is harder than i expected and up to now, i have not found a completed solution to it. 

 I 've tried the most assured way, rebuild UIPage during the switch of a page ( with model Page retreived directly from the DataStorage ) but the result was not always what we expected. At this point, i guess the most likely causes are

1. The 'show-max-window' property of a Page is not properly  saved/read  via DataStorage

2. The binding method on UIForm failed sometimes ( in our case is the binding between the checkbox in UIPageFrom and the field 'showMaxWindow'  of associated UIPage )

column1: Use the Closure compiler in the Javascript serving engine
column54: http://code.google.com/closure/compiler/
column293: 27/Jul/10 11:11 PM;hoang_to;Estimate 1 day for research on Closure compiler
column294:
05/Aug/10 6:51 AM;thanh_tung_do;I have used the Closure compiler in the Javascript serving engine.
If use JSmin, the size of merged.js is 210KB.
If us Closure compiler  the size of merged.js is 158.3 KB (save 24.6%).

But I didn't found any Maven repository that contain Closure compiler .
Because that, These are some steps to use Closure compiler:

1: import "compiler.jar" into Local Maven Repository:
Use command: mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=com.google -DartifactId=closure-compiler -Dversion=1.0 -Dfile=compiler.jar -DgeneratePom=true -Dpackaging=jar

2: Apply attached path file (2010-08-05-GTNPORTAL-198.patch)

NOTE: copy compiler.jar into tomcat/lib before run tomcat server
column295: 05/Aug/10 7:23 AM;thanh_tung_do;If we use Closure Compiler, we will resolve GTNPORTAL-1182

column298:
22/Feb/11 9:59 PM;vstorm83;I've attach new patch to use the Closure-Compiler on maven (r706)

Closure use Guava library (http://guava-libraries.googlecode.com/) . This is the replacement of google-collections (http://code.google.com/p/google-collections/)  --> Need to change the <GateIn>/gadgets/server/pom.xml --> use the Guava instead of Google-Collections. If not closure-compiler can run properly
column299:

column54: Commiters should use in future appropriate code style, for example there musn't be NodeFigure constructor with one argument, or it should set iconName to null. What I mean is that  there shouldn't be direct connection between names of UI elements and at least filenames.
column293: 26/Jul/06 6:55 AM;ikoblik;I have fixed some stuff of what I was talking. There is a partial russian localization of GPD. I'll continue with translation as it is a must for my work. (Not many people speak english here).
column294: 27/Jul/06 5:14 AM;ikoblik;Make "TRANS" your task keyword to see all places to be changed. Some comments are already obsolete, sorry for this, anyway new edition is coming soom, maybe tomorrow.
column295: 27/Jul/06 9:21 AM;ikoblik;Translated palette entries. Not much left to finish it. Feel free to add your own localization, simply find all the files messages.properties and copy them with a new name messages_??.properties, where ?? is two letter signature of your language. All the strings values should be in UTF-8 encoding, for example russian word "???" will look like: "\u0412\u0438\u0434". If you need a utility to do such a translation tell me about it and I'll post it here.

column1: Error converting client characters
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
Error converting characters into server's character set. Some character(s) could not be converted

This error occurs during insertion of data (insert or bcp) when Adaptive Server fails to convert a character to the required character set.
Error usually occurs for one of the following reasons:

- the character exists in the client character set but it does not exist in the Adaptive Server character set.
- the character exists in both the client and the Adaptive Server character set, but is represented by a different number of bytes in the client character set than in the Adaptive Server character set.

This error occurs during normal processing and it prevents query execution.

column54:
For older versions of Sybase ASE we need a workaround for the error:
SQLException(JZ016: The AutoCommit option is already set to false)
The error occurs on several call of dbConnection.setAutoCommit(false);

But with the Sybase v15.0.2 JConnect v6.0.5 (Build 26564 / 11 Jun 2009) the workaround makes bad work and we have errors on the Repository start. 
The workaround will be commented in the code for CR1.

column1: Check if the ItemReferencePool of the SessionDataManager can be implemented with WeakValueHashMap instead of a WeakHashMap
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54: Up to now we use a WeakHashMap to store the items by id which means that the entry is removed when the String Object corresponding to the Id of the Item is garbage collected. It could be more convenient to use a WeakValueHashMap instead of a WeakHashMap, in order to remove the entry only when the value which means the item has been garbage collected. This will probably help to release quickly the Items that are no more used.

column1: Cleanup the JBC config
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
We need to review all the current JBC configs (in conf/standalone and conf/cluster) and apply the following recommendations:

1. The lockAcquisitionTimeout should not exceed 10000 or at worse 20000 because don't forget that usually a TimeoutException is due to a deadlock so no need to make the end user wait for nothing too long
2. The JDBCCacheLoader for the lock persistence should be shared since the database is shared
3. The algorithm class of the eviction policy used by the cache of the Indexer should be org.jboss.cache.eviction.FIFOAlgorithm since this cache is more a queue than a real cache and FIFO is more convenient for a queue
4. The multiplexer should be used in the cluster config to avoid opening too many sockets, see an example below:
   <clustering>
      <sync />
      <!-- Here is where we specify the multiplexer stack to use. -->
      <jgroupsConfig multiplexerStack="fc-fast-minimalthreads"/>
   </clustering>
column293: 19/Jan/10 5:30 AM;nfilotto;Moreover with the current config there are conflicts between JBoss-Cache-Indexer-Cluster_db and Boss-Cache-Lock-Cluster_db since the start_port and mcast_port are the same. Check if recommendation #4 correct this issue otherwise change the ports

column1: Do not enlist XAResource into JOTM transaction manager without a transaction context
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
TransactionServiceJotmImpl tracks XA resources (on enlist) into the manager without a transaction context also.
Change TransactionServiceJotmImpl to be able to manage the enlistResource behaviour via configuration. 

By default the tracking will not be performed.

To enable the tracking (to be compatible with previous eXo Kernel) use parameter "track-without-transaction=true":
   <component>
      <key>org.exoplatform.services.transaction.TransactionService</key>
      <type>org.exoplatform.services.transaction.impl.jotm.TransactionServiceJotmImpl</type>
      <init-params>
         <value-param>
            <name>timeout</name>
            <value>5</value>
         </value-param>
         <value-param>
            <name>track-without-transaction</name>
            <value>true</value>
         </value-param>
      </init-params>
   </component>

column1: XASession should not be involved in transaction commit in Cacheable data manager
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54: If JOTM TransactionService used (not checked for JBossTS), the current XASession will be involved in transaction commit in Cacheable data manager. But it shouldn't as XA transaction for JCR session should be managed from JCR API code (client code).
column293: 16/Jan/10 1:48 AM;tolusha;When transaction began the transactanable data manager did not started.
column294:
16/Jan/10 10:25 AM;pnedonosko;XASession will not be involved into a global and not started currently transaction within JOTM TransactionService due to a fix of the service (rev.1443).

To involve (useless with JCR now) add parameter  "track-without-transaction=true" to the TransactionService configuration .
Note that by default this parameter "false", i.e. the service will not add enlisting XASessions (becomes on session login) to join them a future transaction latter.
column295:
19/Jan/10 7:03 AM;pnedonosko;Done.

XASessionImpl enlisting/delisting reworked. Enlist will be called on session creation (login), delist will be called on logout.

All storage related write operations (cache now) will be executed in dedicated transaction. 
To apply that we do current XA transaction suspend and start one new for JCR persistent operation. In such way JCR storage writes will runs in dedicated XA transaction, i.e. only related resources will be involved. After the internal transaction will be done (commit or rollback). We'll resume original XA transaction.

Note: if a global transaction is committing, i.e. JCR Session save(s) involved in XA transaction, actual save will be performed as part of XA transaction commit. 
But exact commit to the JCR storage resources will be run in internal dedicated XA transaction. If this dedicated transaction will be failed, due to any error, an XAException will be returned to a TransactionManager. The XAException will wraps (as cause) an Exception of internal transaction. 

If several JCR session involved into a global transaction and someone fails after the other sessions success the transaction branch will be heuristically committed and rolled back (javax.transaction.HeuristicMixedException should be thrown by the user transaction commit()).

column1: Persisted ValueData should be Serializable
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
Persisted ValueData should be Serializable.
Additionally we need a logic to implement in WorkspacePersistentDataManager for BLOB Values (file or stream) caching and replication in a cluster.
column293:
20/Jan/10 12:06 PM;pnedonosko;Done.

Logic implemented: 
During the replication of cached Property only path of the file related to a Value will be send. Other node will treat it as path to a Value file if denoted file exists, otherwise the Value will be re-read from the storage in CacheableWorkspaceDataManager, i.e. from database or file-system storage. 
But as we'll have file-system storage (Value Storage) shared the logic actual for a swapped Values (from database or any other source).
I.e. each node will have own file-system swap an shared Value Storage.

column294:
14/Jan/10 3:16 PM;nfilotto;Hi Nadia,

I tested it on my local machine and it seems to be due to the transaction timeout fixed to 20 seconds that is too low for certain operations. To solve this issue:

1. I upgrade to revision 1399 or higher
2. I replace the content of config/test-jbosscache-config.xml with:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<jbosscache xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="urn:jboss:jbosscache-core:config:3.1">

   <locking useLockStriping="false" concurrencyLevel="50000" lockParentForChildInsertRemove="false" lockAcquisitionTimeout="3600000"/>

   <!-- Configure the TransactionManager -->
   <transaction transactionManagerLookupClass="org.jboss.cache.transaction.JBossStandaloneJTAManagerLookup" />
   
   <!-- Enable batching -->
   <invocationBatching enabled="true"/>

   <!-- Eviction configuration -->
   <eviction wakeUpInterval="5000">
      <default algorithmClass="org.jboss.cache.eviction.LRUAlgorithm">
         <property name="maxNodes" value="5000" />
         <property name="timeToLive" value="120000" />
      </default>
      <region name="/" algorithmClass="org.jboss.cache.eviction.LRUAlgorithm" actionPolicyClass="org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.dataflow.persistent.jbosscache.ChildListEvictionActionPolicy" eventQueueSize="1000000">
         <property name="maxNodes" value="20000" />
         <property name="timeToLive" value="120000" />
      </region>
   </eviction>
</jbosscache>
3. In config/test-configuration-benchmark.xml, I replaced 
  <component>
    <key>org.exoplatform.services.transaction.TransactionService</key>
    <type>org.exoplatform.services.transaction.jbosscache.ArjunaTransactionService</type>
   </component>
with
  <component>
    <key>org.exoplatform.services.transaction.TransactionService</key>
    <type>org.exoplatform.services.transaction.jbosscache.ArjunaTransactionService</type>
    <init-params>
      <value-param>
        <name>timeout</name>
        <value>300</value>
      </value-param>
    </init-params> 
   </component>

column294:
16/Jan/10 5:16 AM;skabashnyuk;Possible dead-lock use-case

1. Node 1 wants to save node /A
2. Node 2 wants to read node /A
3. Node 1 save node /A to DB
4. Node 2 try to found node /A in cache but not found
5. Node 2 found node /A in DB
6. Node 1 put /A in cache
7. Node 2 put /A in cache
8. Node 1 try to replicate /A
9. Node 2 try to replicate /A

column299:
20/Jan/10 8:53 AM;nzamosenchuk;Seems that latest changes much improved stability on joining the cluster under load. Those changes are:
1. Create structure nodes (/$CHILD_NODES, /$ITEMS and etc.) immediately after cache start and locally without transaction.
2. Additional check before creating those structure nodes (EXOJCR-423).

22/Jan/10 9:51 AM;areshetnyak;The steps to reproduce that issue :

Node1 - TestLoadIndexerWriterWithModes - coordinator 10 threads 
Node2- TestLoadIndexerQuery - 20 threads 

1) run Node1 with test to write.
2) run Node2 with test to query.
3) wait 5 minutes.
4) stop Node1.
5) wait 5minutes.
6) stop node2.
7) run node2.
8) run node1.
9 ) wait 5 minutes.
10) stop node2.
11) stop node1.
12) goto step 1.

column1: Siblings reordering may update not all the child-items  in cache
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column56: - JBossCacheWorkspaceStorageCache research and debugging, search for way to fix a bug;;14/May/10 11:17 AM;sergiykarpenko;28800
column57:
- make a tests which shows a bug;
- debugging JBossCacheWorkspaceStorageCache;;17/May/10 11:14 AM;sergiykarpenko;21600
column58:
- make remove nodes tree in evictionAction;
- debugging;;28/May/10 4:20 AM;sergiykarpenko;18000
column59:
- remove nodes tree in evictionAction - tested eviction based evict and removeNode;
- eviction that removes full nodes tree from cache is too expensive (test goes 14 min instead 6 min) so need remove node tree only on samename nodes;;31/May/10 4:38 AM;sergiykarpenko;28800
column60: - make test that makes many reorderings, try to catch samename sibling node eviction;01/Jun/10 4:45 AM;sergiykarpenko;28800
column61: - Make update all items in cache that are descendants of reordered samename nodes. updateTreePath() now takes each item in cache (not only visible childs for updated node, as before) and check - is it descendant of updated node. Then replece it with updated item.;03/Jun/10 4:12 AM;sergiykarpenko;18000
column62:
- check how reordering will work, with a lot of nodes in cache;
- test runnning and debugging;;10/Jun/10 3:58 AM;sergiykarpenko;21600
column293:
14/Jan/10 4:22 AM;nzamosenchuk;I.e. there is such a node structure in workspace:
node1:1(uuid=1)
node1:2(uuid=2)
node1:1(uuid=1)/node11(uuid=11)
node1:1(uuid=1)/node12(uuid=12)
node1:1(uuid=1)/node13(uuid=13)
node1:1(uuid=1)/node14(uuid=14)

Cache will be filled as following:
$ITEMS/1
$ITEMS/2
$ITEMS/11
...
$ITEMS/14
$CHILD_NODES/1/node11
..
$CHILD_NODES/1/node14

Then reordeing performed on 
node1:1(uuid=1)  <-> node1:2(uuid=1)
node1:2(uuid=2)  <-> node1:1(uuid=2)
Now cache updates paths of of children "node1x".  JBossCacheWorkspaceStorageCache.updateTreePath() is invoked. This method uses $CHILD_NODES tree in cache to iterate over node's children.  This will find node11..node14 and will update QPath in their nodeData in /$ITEMS section.
But! Imagine that eviction removed some nodes from $CHILD_NODES/1/* or even all of them. Then data (QPath) of child nodes of node1 in /$ITEM won't  be updated.
column294: 07/May/10 10:15 AM;nfilotto;Is-this still up to date?
column295:
11/May/10 4:16 AM;nzamosenchuk;Partially tis was fixed, storing child-nodes as lists in cache, but need to be investigated deeply. I.e. if this serialized child-list of node1(uuid=1) is evicted but nodes node11, node12 ... node13 are still present in the cache, their path's after reordering will be incorrect.
Seems that this case still can't be fixed.
column296: 14/May/10 10:55 AM;sergiykarpenko;We can fix such usecase "I.e. if this serialized child-list of node1(uuid=1) is evicted but nodes node11, node12 ... node13 are still present.." in next way  - check is there childNodesList for parentNode, if not - load new  childNodesList into cache. But such a way is not so good, because full nodes tree (with properties) will be loaded to cache, not only node11, node12 ... node13 and subnodes present in cache. And JBossCacheWorkspaceStorageCache needs to have dataManager inside.
column297: 17/May/10 9:28 AM;sergiykarpenko;There is a test which shows that reordering, or remove samename sibling nodes (which cause reordering) may not update all child nodes for reordered nodes, in case if /$CHILD_NODES/samenameNodeID/childNodeName will be eviced (forced remove in test).
column298: 17/May/10 9:49 AM;sergiykarpenko;In addition to previous version of bug fix, there is another way. We can change ChangesLog of orderBefore. If this ChangesLog will contain ADDED and REMOVED states, for all affected nodes (reordered nodes and child nodes), cache will update all nodes correctly. What is bad - if reordered node will contain a big childs tree, changesLog will be huge. This method has slower performance than previous - because full node tree will be removed and added in cache, instead of list of child nodes will be fetched only if cache do not contains such one. What is good - this is very simple way to fix this bug.
column299: 25/May/10 7:43 AM;nfilotto;To refresh the path of the children, we can use the childNodesList and childPropsList, if they don't exist we get only the uuids from the Database (which means that new methods should be implemented in JDBCStorageConnection) in order to get the list of uuids without reloading everything from the db.
column300:
25/May/10 9:06 AM;pnedonosko;JDBCStorageConnection it's only an impl of WorkspaceStorageConnection interface, we have several implementations of it.
Do you propose to change our internal API (WorkspaceStorageConnection) once again?

Another point: the cache knows nothing about persistence, contract of cache is clear now. 
But with this change we'll mix the cache and persistence responsibilities. And we still will traverse a whole subtree in the cache.

With such success we can just traverse a whole subtree and remove Items with descendant path of reordered node. It's the approach we have used in old impl cache. And it will be more efficient comparing to use of a database to fix cache content.

So let select from two:
- traverse cache and remove descendant items
- fill changes log with all affected items

WDYT?
column301:
25/May/10 9:50 AM;nfilotto;>> traverse cache and remove descendant items 
<< I thought that it was what we currently do, if so, I don't understand how it fixes the issue
>> fill changes log with all affected items
<< I'm not sure that I understand this approach. Does-it mean that if node A has a child node B and node B as child node C, and I move A then, I will add into the change log B and C?
column302:
25/May/10 10:58 AM;pnedonosko;We didn't traverse a whole cache for a subtree descendant nodes. We only traverse the subtree nodes with prev path. But if any child item was evicted we lose hierarchy and some part of subtree lies with old path.
Ways to solve this it's to traverse a whole cache or prepare a right change log to onSaveItems(). Right changes log it's most efficient way, as we'll go from the point where it creates.
column303: 25/May/10 11:42 AM;nfilotto;I must admit that I'm not fan of any of those solutions because they are both costly in term of performance but I think that cache traversing is better since it should be less memory consuming. Indeed, if we rename a root node of a huge tree, the change logs will be terribly big and thus will consume a lot of memory which could cause OutOffMemoryError or worse.
column304:
26/May/10 3:16 AM;pnedonosko;Yes, it can consume a memory. It's why we didn't do that before.

But proposal to change the internal API also is bad. As a result, we'd to implement such functionality for all the interface implementations: SJDBC, MJDBC, CQSJDBC, CQMJDBC, SimpleDB, SP and any new we can have.
Change of WorkspaceStorageCache interface contract and mixing it with the persistence layer also isn't best way. And it will not prevent the traversing of the cache, but will add calls to a database there.

We should find something better to keep API stable and contracts clear.
We just discussed idea of specialized eviction. Actual problem comes from eviction of one of descendant nodes having SNS path. Let think this way also.
column305: 26/May/10 3:28 AM;nfilotto;Another way would be to never store the path in memory (i.e. into PersistedItemData.qpath) and only get it on demand from the database.
column306: 26/May/10 4:00 AM;nfilotto;Since the path seems to be used everywhere into the JCR code base, getting the path from the db doesn't seem to be a also good approach
column307: 26/May/10 12:52 PM;nfilotto;BTW how did we fix this issue with the old JCR Cache?

*********

the reason is that we use everywhere, besides one or two components, the
version 2.4. So currently both versions are deployed.

***********

also declaring a dependency on the commons-lang:2.3, although the
pom.xml does not mention it at all. Can that be either removed or
altered to 2.4?

the kernel.packaging.module.js is also referencing jgroups-all:2.5.2
although the pom.xml contains jgroups.jar:2.6.12.GA. Shouldn't it be
synchronized?

column293:
12/Jan/10 8:22 AM;nzamosenchuk;Efficiency of BufferedJBossCache as dead-lock avoider was proved with the help of manual test TestCacheDeadLockDetection.
LockAcquisitionTimeout in JBC XML configaration was set to 10s (10000). Then Sorting was commented in BufferedJBossCache and mentioned test was launched. In few second two exceptions were encounted:

org.jboss.cache.lock.TimeoutException: Unable to acquire lock on Fqn [/$CHILD_NODES_LIST/2235b1da7f0000014f62cf6a381e342f] after [10000] milliseconds for requestor [GlobalTransaction:<null>:243]! Lock held by [GlobalTransaction:<null>:244]

org.jboss.cache.lock.TimeoutException: Unable to acquire lock on Fqn [/$CHILD_NODES_LIST/2235b1d67f0000017209d9af66cfae9a] after [10000] milliseconds for requestor [GlobalTransaction:<null>:244]! Lock held by [GlobalTransaction:<null>:243]

They means that TX244 waits for TX243 and contrary (TX243 waits for TX244). When sorting was enabled, test was working for 4 minutes without any problems.
column294:
14/Jan/10 8:25 AM;nzamosenchuk;Ordering is applied with the help of BufferedJBossCache class it stores all changes in list and on commit this list is applied on JBossCache instance.
It was proved as dead lock avoider with manual test (see comments).

column1: Nodes in response after SEARCH are duplicated
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
When nodes are added through webdav (JCRWebdavConnection is used currently), then SEARCH method returns duplication of such a node in response.

1. Add node through webdav (i.e."/node/addedNode").
2. Make query through webdav  (i.e. "SELECT * FROM nt:base WHERE jcr:path LIKE '/node[%]/%'")
3. Response will contain XML, where "addedNode" is described twice:

{code}
	<D:response>
		<D:href>http://localhost:8080/rest/jcr/repository/production/node/addedNode
		</D:href>
		<D:propstat>
			<D:prop>
				<D:getcontenttype>application/octet-stream</D:getcontenttype>
				<D:creationdate b:dt="dateTime.tz">2010-01-04T15:45:53Z
				</D:creationdate>
				<D:getlastmodified b:dt="dateTime.rfc1123">Mon, 04 Jan 2010 15:45:53
					GMT</D:getlastmodified>
				<D:getcontentlength>6</D:getcontentlength>
				<D:resourcetype />
				<D:displayname>addedNode</D:displayname>
			</D:prop>
			<D:status>HTTP/1.1 200 OK</D:status>
		</D:propstat>
	</D:response>
	<D:response>
		<D:href>http://localhost:8080/rest/jcr/repository/production/node/addedNode
		</D:href>
		<D:propstat>
			<D:prop>
				<D:getcontenttype>application/octet-stream</D:getcontenttype>
				<D:resourcetype />
				<D:creationdate b:dt="dateTime.tz">2010-01-04T15:45:53Z
				</D:creationdate>
				<D:getlastmodified b:dt="dateTime.rfc1123">Mon, 04 Jan 2010 15:45:53
					GMT</D:getlastmodified>
				<D:getcontentlength>6</D:getcontentlength>
				<D:displayname>addedNode</D:displayname>
			</D:prop>
			<D:status>HTTP/1.1 200 OK</D:status>
		</D:propstat>
	</D:response>
{code}
column293:
05/Jan/10 4:50 AM;nzamosenchuk;Situation is as following:
Search manager found:
* /node/addedNode
* /node/addedNode/jcr:content

but node "/node/addedNode/jcr:content" is internal and specific node so webdav cut it to "/node/addedNode/jcr:content". Thats why it is duplicated in response.

column1: Invoke post read after permissions check

column54:
Invoke post read after permissions check in read methods of SessionDataManager (ItemImpl actually).
Now the action postRead willbe called before the permissions check and the action may be notified on rejected later read of an item.

column1: Copy Property data value on copy operations
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
In current implementation of JCR core we reuse (for performance) ValueData on copying or cloning of a Property. It's simplifies the code (a bit) and doesn't broke persistence consistency. 
But it can cause cache issues with ValueStorage in some usecases (originated from org.exoplatform.services.jcr.api.writing.TestCorrespondingNode). 
I.e. it's possible that Value (file) from one Property will be used in another Property (as result of clone or copy). Until cache eviction this can cause inconsistency if the file will be changed or deleted on one of the properties.

Do copy of a Values on copy operations.

column1: JCR cache implementation using JBossCache
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
Implement JCR cache using JBossCache.
Concepts of the implementation:
- cache transparent: or item cached or not, we should not generate "not found" Exceptions
- child properties/nodes lists should be evicted from parent at same time
- consistency based on XA transactions (using JTA and JBoss TM by default, but via eXo's TransactionService - another task)

column1: Make broadcasting of events of ListenerService asynchronous
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
At present broadcasting events through the ListenerService is synchronous.
It can make the whole system slow if the logic in the listener is slow.

It would help to improve easily the user experience by making listener executions asynchronous.
column56:
- make a test for asynchronous event broadcasting;
- make implementation;;26/Jul/10 3:25 AM;sergiykarpenko;28800
column293: 14/Dec/09 7:03 AM;nicoulaj;Besides, it would allow isolating the execution of the event handlers. Right now, if an event handler throws an exception, the next one are not executed.
column294:
07/May/10 10:10 AM;nfilotto;Please also add a try/catch block around listener.onEvent(event) (line 126) to ensure that if one listener fails, the other ones will be called.

About this feature itself, I think that switching from synchronous broadcasting to asynchronous broadcasting is too dangerous and will create some side effects. For example, when we create a new account, several listeners are called to initialize it so it is important to call them synchronously to know exactly when the account is properly initialized. However some listeners could be called asynchronously under special conditions. So the idea will be to add a new method to the abstract class "org.exoplatform.services.listener.Listener" that will be "public boolean synchCall(Event<S, D> event)". To ensure backward compatibility this method will always return true by default. If this method returns true then the method onEvent must be called synchronously otherwise it must be called asynchronously.

In the ListenerService, we will then call this method before calling listener.onEvent in order to know if it must be called synchronously or asynchronously thanks to an Executor
column295: 07/Jun/10 12:49 PM;nfilotto;In order to avoid modifying the current API interface, a better way to implement this feature would be to use a dedicated annotation such as (@Asynch). If this annotation has been added at onEvent method level, the task will be given to a dedicated thread pool that will manage the asynchronous actions. By default the actions will be launched synchronously by the calling thread.
column296:
07/Jun/10 2:11 PM;nfilotto;Recommendations about how to implement it:
* Add an init param that will allow us to define the pool size of the Executor that will execute the task asynchronously (such asynch-pool-size), by default the pool size will be one
* Use the method Executors.newFixedThreadPool(int nThreads, ThreadFactory threadFactory) to create your excecutor in order to define an understandable name for the threads
* Check if the annotation exists only once when the Listener is added to the list of listeners in order to limit impact at Runtime. Once we know if it has to be executed asynchronously or synchronously, you can wrap the listener in an internal class, in which you will store the result (i.e. asynch or synch) and the Listener.
* When you check if the annotation exists, don't forget to check the parent classes since the annotations are inherited
