column293:
23/Dec/09 5:37 AM;sergiykarpenko;- Properties may hav not value, so new getChildPropertiesData query must support this usecase.

 This query is incorrect because property may have not value
 GET_PROPERTIES_BY_PARENTID =
      "select I.*, V.ORDER_NUM, V.DATA, V.STORAGE_DESC from JCR_MITEM I, JCR_MVALUE V"
        + " where I.I_CLASS=2 and I.PARENT_ID=? and V.PROPERTY_ID=I.ID order by I.ID";

This works as expected:
      GET_PROPERTIES_BY_PARENTID =
         "select I.*, V.ORDER_NUM, V.DATA, V.STORAGE_DESC from JCR_MITEM I LEFT OUTER JOIN JCR_MVALUE V ON (V.PROPERTY_ID=I.ID)"
            + " where I.I_CLASS=2 and I.PARENT_ID=? order by ID, ORDER_NUM";


- Reference property may be multivalued and values may contain same uuid. So getReferencesData must return same property many times for this uuid. With new query it's impossible (it returns single property, but values count is multiplicated);

FIND_REFERENCE_PROPERTIES =
         "select P.ID, P.PARENT_ID, P.VERSION, P.P_TYPE, P.P_MULTIVALUED, P.NAME, V.ORDER_NUM, V.DATA, V.STORAGE_DESC"
            + " from JCR_MREF R, JCR_MITEM P, JCR_MVALUE V"
            + " where R.NODE_ID=? and P.ID=R.PROPERTY_ID and P.I_CLASS=2 and V.PROPERTY_ID=P.ID order by P.ID, V.ORDER_NUM";

column1: eXo JCR indexer on shared FS implementation
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column56:
Implemented CacheLoader and SingletonStoreCacheLoader for indexer cache. Designed structure of classes needed to support Indexer functionality is cluster. They are ChangesFilters that are responsible for changes list delivering to indexer. IndexerChangesFilter is an abstract superclass for DefaultChangesFilter and JbossCacheChangesFilter. The second is a default provider for stanalone mode that delivers data immediately and directly from WorkspacePersistentDataManager. The last one uses JBoss Cache between WorkspacePersistentDataManager and indexer and actual data is delivered through CacheLoader under JBoss Cache.
Indexer classes are now extended to handle IO mode: READ_ONLY, READ_WRITE. Mentioned hierarchy partially implemented and tested.;11/Dec/09 10:26 AM;nzamosenchuk;86400

11/Dec/09 3:59 AM;dkatayev;Webdav usecases:
AddNode - uses webdav PUT method
GetNode - uses webdav GET method
RemoveNode - uses webdav DELETE method
GetNodeByUUID - can't be test via webdav, because this operation is never directly used in webdav
CreateProperty - uses webdav PROPPATCH nethod 
SetProperty - uses webdav PROPPATCH nethod on previosly created property.
RemoveProperty - uses webdav PROPPATCH nethod on previosly created property.
GetPropertyValue - has the same semantiv as GetNode usecase (webdav GET method reads and returns the value of "jcr:data" property)

column293: 09/Dec/09 10:05 AM;nzamosenchuk;Final proposition is to use SingletonStoreCacheLoader . This feature ensures that only one node of cluster performs write operations. Any other node of cluster simply reads index from shared FS. JBoss Cache is used transport to deliver lists of added/removed JCR nodes to coordinator with the help of replication.

column1: Implement the method clone to speed up our way to create safe copies (proxy) of our Objects
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54: we get better performances when we use the method clone to create a copy of an object. So we have to implement the method clone of the objects related to PersistedItemData Objects (such as PersistedNodeData and its subtypes and all the type of the variable such as QPath, InternalQName, AccessControlList, ValueData)

column1: Get rid of LocalWorkspaceStorageDataManagerProxy
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54: I think that all objects that come from the database or the cache should be immutable (such as PersistedNodeData and its subtypes and all the type of the variable such as QPath, InternalQName, AccessControlList, ValueData) in order to avoid to create safe copies even for read operations. Because creating a clone consumes CPU and memory which could be avoided for read operations. We should get rid of LocalWorkspaceStorageDataManagerProxy and only create a copy of the data for write operations to convert the immutable objects into a mutable objects.

column1: Test the scalability
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54: To test the scalability, we first ensure that the data is totally loaded into the memory, then we call the same method with more and more thread in parallel (each thread use its own JCR session and access concurrently to the same method on the same node). The scalability limit is reached when it takes more than 1 second per thread or we get an OutOfMemorryError with a Java Heap Size of no more than 2Gb. The expected result is the total amount of threads used to reach the limit. Ideally, we would like to get up to 200 threads in a normal machine

1382Mb (1715Mb)

We see increase perfomance from 2nd reap operation, when datas already presents in cache. But unfortunately 1st read operations shows decreas perfomance. We need time to identify the cause of this problem.

column1: Implement Lazy Loading mechanism for the method Node.getNodes
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
To propose an alternative of getNodes to applications that don't really care about the consistency, we will add 1 new methods that will be out of the JCR Spec (such as setLimit and setOffset for the Query) so people will have to cast the node object to an ExtendedNode to access to this method:

# public NodeIterator getNodesLazily() throws RepositoryException, this methods will allow to lazy load the nodes page by page. The page size is configurable. By default the page size will be 100.

About caching: we will check first if we already have all the nodes in the cache if so we will use this list as result otherwise we will get/store into the cache the each page and any time a new child node is added or removed we invalidate all the pages to ensure consistency (only implement it for JBC and ISPN, throw UnsupportedOperationException in case of LinkedWorkspaceStorageCacheImpl).

About Db access: we will use queries very close to what we did for the node indexing and we will implement it only for CQ, throw UnsupportedOperationException for old queries.
column293: 11/Jul/11 6:18 AM;nfilotto;I removed get properties from the scope since the most common/important usecase will be to be able to manage thousands of sub nodes
column294: 01/Aug/11 7:56 AM;nzavalko;QA met a problem with test - TestGetNodesLazily, for more info, please see: http://tests.exoplatform.org/JCR/1.14.0-GA/rev.4684/functional-testing-reports/jcr.core/hsql/api_usecases_impl/multi_cache_is_turned_off/surefire-report/surefire-report.html
column297:
11/Aug/11 11:46 AM;nfilotto;Hi Nikolay,

here are my remarks about your last commit:
* 75 as min page size is quite big, could you please decrease it to 20?
* Looking at the code, it looks like if the page set is < min, we will get a warning at each session creation which is too annoying, we should have this warning only once at workspace startup.
column298: 12/Aug/11 6:27 AM;nfilotto;This sounds better however in case the value set is lower than the min why not simply setting the new value in ContainerEntry directly to prevent having to implement the same logic in SessionImpl? This way we would have all the logic centralized in one place which would be in SessionFactory
column299:
16/Aug/11 7:24 AM;nfilotto;Good Job Nikolay,

I have 2 last things to do (unplanned)
# Could you please allow to call getNodesLazily when we call getNodes thanks to a system property in order to allow other product teams to easily test it just by setting a system property. In the doc, we will describe this system property but we will add a comment saying that it is experimental for now so it needs to be used with caution.
# Could you please create a 2 new tests for the QA, one that calls node.getNodes and the other that calls node.getNodesLazily, and for both of them it will iterate over the NodeIterator (unlike the current test jcr-benchmark/trunk/src/main/java/org/exoplatform/jcr/benchmark/jcrapi/node/read/NodeGetNodesTest.java)
column300:
18/Aug/11 9:13 AM;nzamosenchuk;Done. 
1) Added a possibility to substitute getNodes() call with getNodesLazily() with the help of system property. Documentation on wiki-int ( https://wiki-int.exoplatform.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=42172583 ) and in docBook updated.
2) Added two parametric Japex tests:
* org.exoplatform.jcr.benchmark.jcrapi.node.read.NodeGetNodesAdaptiveTest
* org.exoplatform.jcr.benchmark.jcrapi.node.read.NodeGetNodesLazilyAdaptiveTest
and usecase scanario "JCRAPI-getNodes.xml".

Test can be configured with the help of the following parameters:
{code:xml}
      <param name="childNodesNumber" value="30" />
      <param name="childPropertiesNumber" value="3" />
      <param name="skipNumber" value="0" />
      <param name="readNumber" value="15" />
{code}
* *childNodesNumber* - size of child list, the number of child nodes;
* *childPropertiesNumber* - defines how many properties each child node owns;
* *skipNumber* - number of nodes to skip before iterating;
* *readNumber* - number of nodes to iterate.

            throw new RuntimeException("Failure to marshal argument(s)", e);

column1: LockManager: re-implement using JBCache
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column56: SessionLockManager created with appropriate lock storage through DataManagers. Reworked token logic, logic of LockData entity, LockImpl.;18/Nov/09 11:09 AM;nzamosenchuk;43200
column57: initial LockManager implementation, as for current issue done and tested. But should be tested once, when whole proto is finished.;24/Nov/09 3:48 AM;nzamosenchuk;14400
column293:
16/Nov/09 8:42 AM;nzamosenchuk;Main idea is to store Locks in cache in order to be fully replicable. WorkspacePersistentDataManager-on-JBossCache is designed to store locks in "/$Locks" subtree in cache. New LockManager implementation is designed to use only getLock() and getLocks() methods from DataManager, in order to be independent from realization of persistent(replicable) layer.
This issue also expects Token-logic change. LockData is now thought to be unmodifiable, storing only token's hash. LockManager should store lists of session's tokens. And asked, lock manager checks whether hash of session's token is equals to hash stored in LockData
column294: 24/Nov/09 9:47 AM;nzamosenchuk;As proposed LockData  is now stored in cache (through data managers). LockManager is moved to session-layer, and refactored to fit the needs.

JBossCacheStorageConnectionTest extended to test LockData operations.;18/Nov/09 10:57 AM;nzamosenchuk;28800

column1: Ensure that a JCR node cans have as many child nodes as we want whitout affecting the performances
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54: Up to now, we assume that a JCR node cannot have more than 100 direct children if we want to keep good performances. This limitation is much too restrictive for the product, so we need to find a way to allow a JCR node to have 1 000, 10 000, 100 000 or even 1 000 000 direct sub nodes without affecting the performances.

column296: 19/Nov/09 11:24 AM;nfilotto;EXOJCR-258 shows us that we can really improve the method getChildNodesData if we better use the capabilities of each database
column297: 20/Nov/09 2:08 AM;tolusha;Benchmark testing results for NodeImp.addNode() & NodeImpl.getNodes() for 10.000 nodes http://tests.exoplatform.org/JCR/1.12.0-OPT-SNAPSHOT/rev.760/daily-perfomance-testing-results/jcr.core/index.html
column298:
20/Nov/09 3:37 AM;nfilotto;Hi Anatoliy,

Another good study, will be to test to call NodeImpl.getNodes() by several thread in parallel (you can fix for example the total amount of subnodes to 10.000 and test with more and more threads in parallel) to check if the throughput is still about the same and more important to check how the memory behaves since it looks like we create a safe copy of all the subnodes even for a simple read (in LocalWorkspaceStorageDataManagerProxy.getChildNodesData)
column299:
20/Nov/09 4:05 AM;nfilotto;I think that all objects that come from the database or the cache should be immutable (such as PersistedNodeData..) in order to avoid to create safe copies even for read operations. Because creating a clone consumes CPU and memory which could be avoided for read operations. We should get rid of LocalWorkspaceStorageDataManagerProxy and only create a copy of the data for write operations to convert the immutable object into a mutable object. 

Please remember for your study that the most important operations are always the read operations. We need to make the read operations scale the most we can and for read operations to scale means that we have to support as many concurrent read access as we can.
column300: 20/Nov/09 4:33 AM;tolusha;It is a good study, but the best way is to create a new issue for the next sprint for researching.
column301:
20/Nov/09 4:48 AM;nfilotto;Moreover as far as I can see in the code of LocalWorkspaceStorageDataManagerProxy we make a safe copy of the list of subnodes within a synchronized block (to avoid potential ConcurrentModificationException) which can be a big bottleneck if we have several thousands of sub nodes to copy. I think one more time that this bottleneck could be avoided for the read operations.

And finally to avoid the synchronized block, we could store the list of Nodes in a java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList (i.e a ThreadSafe List) instead of an ArrayList (i.e a not ThreadSafe List) see the method JDBCStorageConnection.getChildNodesData(NodeData parent).

column54:
Design and prototype JCR persistent layer using JBoss Cache.

Level1
Change hierachy of org.exoplatform.services.jcr.dataflow.PersistentDataManager and remove org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.dataflow.persistent.CacheableWorkspaceDataManager. The new manager will handle integration with JBossCache

Level2
Persistence layer, where changes saved in JCR becomes stored. The layer will be attached to a jBossCache as a CacheLoader implementations.

Level3
Adaptation of existing Database, Lucene and Observation implementations as a CacheLoaders
column293:
21/Dec/09 7:36 AM;skabashnyuk;Nicolas Filotto: I decided to stop using JBC with a CacheLoader behind
Nicolas Filotto: we will use JBC as a JCR Cache
Nicolas Filotto: and JBC will keep on manage the replication as it does now
Nicolas Filotto: but it won't manage the data storage anymore
Nicolas Filotto: most of our work should be still compatible
Nicolas Filotto: we "just" replace JBossCacheStorageConnection by JBossCacheWorkspaceStorageCache and we get rid of JDBCCacheLoader

Test results can be found http://tests.exoplatform.org/jcr_1_12_0_JBC_SN.html

The JCR cache will be replicated, cluster members will see particular changes of some node via the cache. 
Database persistence will be managed by JCR itself. 

Most of our work is still compatible (done in EXOJCR-199) 
#1 new indexing strategy (1 writer with a share file system) 
#2 data structure in JBC ($NODES/...) 
#3 locking based on JBC 
#4 ValueStorage stored into JBC 
#5 Test for eXo JCR cluster

column1: Allow to specify properties to an Extension Action
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
Allow to specify properties to an action of type "org.exoplatform.services.command.action.Action".

Up to now, when we create an action we can only specify an "actionClassName" to the class "org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.ext.action.ActionConfiguration", the value of this field is then used to create a new action instance. It would be very interesting to be able to set directly an object of type org.exoplatform.services.command.action.Action instead of only specifying the classname in order to be able to use the same action with a different context.

In other words, we only need to add a field of type "org.exoplatform.services.command.action.Action" in the class "org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.ext.action.ActionConfiguration" and check in the method org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.ext.action.SessionActionCatalog.addPlugin if an action has been defined otherwise we execute the current code ((Action) Class.forName(ac.getActionClassName()).newInstance().

Original issue: http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR-804
column293:
04/Sep/09 4:35 AM;pnedonosko;The feature request can be implemented outside the JCR Ext using dedicated Action implementation.

E.g. Action will be a stub for requested behaviour, i.e. the action can have a setter for runtime CustomAction set, and if the CustomAction is not set the one "default" will be executed via code inside the Action - ((CustomAction) Class.forName(customeConfig.getCustomActionClassName()).newInstance() etc.

Mechanism of JCR Ext Actions (org.exoplatform.services.command.action.Action) very flexible and gives you many ways to implement custom logic. 
It will be better to integrate it instead of change.

column1: Cannot combine jcr:path with the operator OR
column11: This JIRA moved to http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR and is read-only.
column54:
According to the specification (see page 289 section "Descendant or self" of the JSR 170), the following requests should work but they don't work:

    * select * from nt:base where jcr:path = '/books' OR jcr:path='/books/mybooks'
    * select * from nt:base where jcr:path LIKE '/books/mybooks/%' OR jcr:path='/books/mybooks'

We get an exception of type javax.jcr.query.InvalidQueryException: Invalid combination of jcr:path clauses: Invalid combination of jcr:path clauses: Invalid combination of jcr:path.

The following code throws the exception described above

case 1 :

QueryManager queryManager = session.getWorkspace().getQueryManager() ;
String queryS = "select * from nt:base where jcr:path = '/books' OR jcr:path='/books/mybooks' ";
Query query = queryManager.createQuery(queryS, Query.SQL);

case 2 :

QueryManager queryManager = session.getWorkspace().getQueryManager() ;
String queryS = "select * from nt:base where jcr:path LIKE '/books/mybooks/%' OR jcr:path='/books/mybooks' ";
Query query = queryManager.createQuery(queryS, Query.SQL);

Here is the stack trace
javax.jcr.query.InvalidQueryException: Invalid combination of jcr:path clauses: Invalid combination of jcr:path clauses: Invalid combination of jcr:path clauses
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.sql.JCRSQLQueryBuilder.createQuery(JCRSQLQueryBuilder.java:171)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.sql.QueryBuilder.createQueryTree(QueryBuilder.java:38)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.QueryParser.parse(QueryParser.java:56)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.lucene.QueryImpl.<init>(QueryImpl.java:100)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.lucene.SearchIndex.createExecutableQuery(SearchIndex.java:197)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.QueryImpl.init(QueryImpl.java:123)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.SearchManager.createQuery(SearchManager.java:182)
at org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.query.QueryManagerImpl.createQuery(QueryManagerImpl.java:81)


Original issue: http://jira.exoplatform.org/browse/JCR-826
column57: - have tried to make "descendant or self query" using current search implementation. Unsuccessfull.;28/May/10 4:24 AM;sergiykarpenko;10800
column293:
27/May/10 4:33 AM;sergiykarpenko;Query debugging and code research result:

- InvalidQueryException it's not a bug. Current query parser architecture do not supports combination of independent jcr:path predicates. JCRSQLQueryBuilder merges all jcr:path predicates in single one.

- Potentially we can make support independent jcr:path predicates. But we need to make new lucene queries, and make serious architecture refactoring. The hardest thing is independent path queries.
column294: 27/May/10 4:50 AM;nfilotto;Yes but what about the specs? We don't support a feature that is part of the JSR 170. For you how long would it take to support it?
column295:
27/May/10 6:50 AM;sergiykarpenko;Current search implementation covers all queries except "Descendant or self in SQL dialect", but RI do not support such queries too, and there is no TCK covering such usecase. 
If we want support this query - search implementation need serious refactoring, so it may take more than week.

column1: Refactor EJB 3 onto the unified metadata
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column293: 12/Dec/07 4:14 AM;wolfc;For problems regarding EJB 3 and metadata new issues should be opened.

column1: Added test case to validate extended persistence context under clustering
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column54: I have copied the longlived test case over to test out the extended persistence context on clustering under clusteredsession.
column293: 19/May/06 3:16 AM;ben.wang;Note that clustering test case is failing now becuse of incorrect passivation.

column1: postActivate incorrectly called after failover
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column54: imagine the case when I failover to the remote node. So the first time, I will call getInstance and the bean is null. So as a result, a postActivation event will be emitted (even though this should be something like postReplicated event).
column293: 17/May/06 10:37 PM;ben.wang;Still, we should just use postActivate method call in StatefulBeanContext. To me it is a better place to be. For example, I am using JBossCache passivation now. We have a callback for the postActivation even already so there is no need to wait untill getInstance().
column294: 19/May/06 5:51 AM;ben.wang;Bill, I have fixed this issue. The Stateful unit test case passed now under cache.

column1: Refactored clusteredsession tests
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column54:
I have refactored clusteredsession by:

1. moving the tests from cache (regarding treecache) to clusteredsession, as agreed.
2. Create a new BeanUnitTestCase
3. Deprecate SimpleClusterUnitTestCase
4. Use a ejb3 ExplicitFailoverInterceptor to simulate the failover (instead of shutting down the AS explicitly).

column1: Use JBossCache passivation feature for clustered ejb3 SFSB
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column54: Currently the clustered sfsb uses its own passivation implmentation because JBossCache didn't offer that previously. However, now that it has this feature, we should refactor to use that. There is a corresonding Forum post for this discussion.
column293:
05/Apr/06 11:03 AM;ben.wang;Has a partial check in now. Currently it still depends on:

1. Update jboss-cache.jar using the latest snapshot that has two fixes for eviction and encoding
2. Debug why JBossCache passivation and activation doesn't work properly yet.
column294: 17/May/06 12:30 PM;ben.wang;Passivation works now. But still has problem to activate. As a result, one of the unit test still fails. Need to investigate on whether it is JBossCache problem.
column295:
25/Jul/06 11:33 AM;ben.wang;I have ported the solution both to 4.0 and head. The JBoss Cache version needed is 1.4.

Basically, the only change is that we are using the passivation feature in JBC now (ejb3-clustered-stateful-service.xml).

User can still tune the eviction thread wakeUpIntervalSeconds and also the location of the FileCacheLoader.

Additionally, if the bean is currently in use (and inactive for a while), we won't passivate/evict it untill it is no longer in use.

The rest of the configuration should stay the same.

column1: ClassCastException with SerializableProxy on lazy attributes
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column54: Opened issue as requested by Bill Burke. See forum.
column288:
Use a MarshalledValue to return the value.  The issue is related to ClassLoader on the remote layer. Using a MarshalledValue would solve the issue at least for now.
Look at the testcase /ejbthree440 and you will have an example on how to use a MarshalledObject/MarshalledValue
column293: 13/Feb/06 7:46 AM;oglueck;Added test case that reliably reproduces the problem. Adapt build.properties to your local settings. Adapt and deploy the datasource in the conf directory (a local PostgreSQL db). Run ant ear and deploy. Run ant test.
column294:
13/Feb/06 1:17 PM;clebert.suconic;A SerializableProxy is being set with an invalid result. 
Possibilities:
- readResolve on is not being called for some reason
- readResolve is being called and producing an invalid result
- The substitued object is not compatible, and it's generating incompatibilities on a second serialization operation.

column1: One-to-many relationship FetchType issues
column11:
This project represents the EJB3 implementation for AS 6 and earlier.

For the latest EJB3 implementation please go to the AS 7 project.
column54: The one-to-many fetchtype is ignored under certain conditions.  If you use a one to many FetchType of type LAZY and have specified a CascadeType then the LAZY FetchType is ignored and the EAGER type is used by default.
column55:
JBoss 4.0.3RC1
Eclipse
JSF
JTDS-1.1
SQL Server 2000

column297:
10/Aug/05 11:52 PM;freemanl;I have tried the RC1 build of EJB and this still seems to be an issue.

Can I ask, what behaviour should I be expecting?  

If I have an EntityA with a @OneToMany(fetch=FetchType.LAZY) link to EntityB and I do a query to find all EntityA objects, should the entity manager perform a series of "select * from entityb where entityb.fk = entitya.pk" queries?

This is what is happening for me regardless of whether or not I access the List<EntityB> property. 

My assumption is that the queries to retrieve EntityB object will only fire if I access the List<EntityB>  property.

Hope this was not too confusing.

If I have 2000 people with many stays/visits it would take a very long time!

The Database used is SQL server 2000.

column303:
17/Aug/05 8:40 PM;freemanl;Sorry again. I read the description in the JIRA email and got a bit confused. My mistake. I though it was a comment.

I have just updated my test case.  This one should be devoid of issues (I hope).  I have tested it on JBoss 4.0.3RC1 with the latest EJB3 installed and on JBoss 4.0.3RC2.

I have done a few more tests. I have tried:

    - removing the CascadeType from the @OneToMany relationship.  Doing so stops the errant behaviour but creates a separate issue for me.
    - changing the CascadeType to anything but ALL.  No difference.

It does, to me, seem apparent that in my case, setting the CascadeType and trying to do a LAZY fetch does not work.  I have reproduced this over and over again.  The only way I can get LAZY fetching to work is to take out the cascade. The cascadeType and fetchtype seem to be linked in regards to this issue. I dont think taking out the CascadeType is the intended fix though.

Running the testclient I get the following log output:

column1: expose link status to expressions in join conditions
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Mantain link status in the context instance.
Expose status of an activity's incoming links to the join condition associated with that activity.
Implement the bpws:getLinkStatus() extension function.

column1: manipulate properties occuring in variables
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Parse properties and property aliases in imported wsdl definitions (8.2).
Extract values of properties occurring in message variables (9.3).
Provide the extended function 'bpws:getVariableProperty()' (9.1).

column1: mantain correlation sets in the context instance
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Mantain correlation sets in the jpbm context instance; follow the representation proposed in the BPELJ white paper, section "BPEL Correlations with Java".
Initiate correlation sets with properties extracted from messages.
Observe the correlation consistency constraint.

column1: expose the process as a web service
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Defined the expected form and content of process-related port components.
Automate the assembly of process-related port components.
Deploy the process and related port components as a single unit.

column1: deliver/return messages to/from process instances
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Resolve the endpoint address at which an envelope arrives to a process and partner link.
Correlate the process name, partner link name and properties associated with a wsdl message to a single process instance.
Deliver the message to the process instance.
In the case of request/response operations, wait for a reply message and send it back to the client.

column1: receive an incoming message
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Receive a matching wsdl message to arrive and copy it to the corresponding variable. Such a message is targeted at the activity's partner link and operation, and its properties match the correlation sets carried by the process instance.
Validate the correlation consistency constraint, and initiate the remaining correlations.
In case the operation involved is request/response, create an outstanding request for the corresponding partner link, operation and correlation sets (initiated or not).
See the spec, section 11.4.

column1: reply with an outgoing message
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Read a message from the corresponding variable.
Validate the consistency constraint for non-initiated correlation sets, and initiate the remaining correlation sets.
Retrieve the outstanding request on the corresponding partner link, operation and non-initiated correlation sets, and deliver the reply message.
See section 11.4 of the spec.

column1: mantain bpel variables with xml types
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Introduce adapters that allow for mantaining BPEL variables with a WSDL message type, XML Schema simple type or XML Schema element in the existing jBPM context instance.
Follow the existing "data-per-token" mechanism to support variable scoping.

column1: evaluate variable-aware expressions
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Evaluate boolean, duration, deadline and general expressions in the presence of bpel variables.
Implement the bpws:getVariableData() extension function.
Provide a class for the Duration xml schema datatype.

column1: assignment to arbitrary locations in variables
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Assign values to variables, parts of messages, and location paths within message parts.
Provide the following forms of the <assign> activity:
<from variable='ncname' part='ncname'? query='queryString'?>
<from expression="general-expr"/>
<to variable='ncname' part='ncname'? query='queryString'?>
---
Make assignment destinations able to deal with a variety of source values. 
Offer automatic creation of nodes traversed by paths.

column1: encapsulate xpath expressions along with their evaluation context
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
Take into account the complete xpath evaluation context:
 -context node
 -variable bindings
 -function library
 -namespace declaration
instead of the namespace declaration alone.
Encapsulate xpath expressions along with their evaluation context for better organization.

column1: separate variable instances from their definitions
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54: Separate the current implementation of bpel variables, which encapsulate the instance value along with the definition, into two distinct objects.

column1: document linking for bpel 1.1
column11: Web services orchestrator, compliant with the BPEL (Business Process Execution Language) specification, version 1.1 and 2.0.
column54:
BPEL 1.1 does not specify a mechanism to indicate dependencies on external documents. In BPEL 2, <import> elements perform that role. The BPEL reader relies on <import>s to locate WSDL interface elements, but they do not exist in BPEL 1.1.

We need an alternate mechanism for providing the location of related WSDL documents in BPEL 1.1 deployments.

column1: There is no test case for tx_set_transaction_timeout

Our tests need to reflect this by asserting that the TX completes OK even if we delay the Resource Managers during prepare or commit. I updated AtmiBrokerOTS and the test case to reflect this.

add a sleep (in the test case) between begin and commit too - this is the only case that should cause commit to return TX_ROLLBACK

column11:

Port JBAS-3988 to the CP branch.

column293:
21/Feb/07 5:59 AM;galder.zamarreno;NOTE!!! I still can't select fix version 4.0.5.GA_CP02, so i'm chosing 4.0.5.GA_CP01

I can't see the patch instructions box that should appear when resolving the issue either,
so here're the patch instructions:

PATCH NAME:
        ASPATCH-164
SHORT DESCRIPTION:
        Upgrade removes classloader leaks and does not throw LogConfigurationException.
LONG DESCRIPTION:
        JCL (Jakarta Commons Logging) attempts to load a Log impl using the context classloader and instantiate it via reflection. In 1.0.4 this often fails with LogConfigurationException because the type of the impl's Log interface is different from the type seen by ContainerBase, due to the different classloader. JCL 1.1 is intelligent enough to detect this situation and fall back on looking for a Log impl using ContainerBase's classloader.
        Applications which use JCL should call LogFactory.release() as part of their shutdown work (often done in a ServletContextListener) still applies. JCL stores a reference to your app's classloader as a key in a map held in a static field. In JCL 1.1 this map has semantics basically equivalent to WeakHashMap, but still this arrangement has the potential to leak the classloader. The only reliable way to ensure that doesn't happen is to call LogFactory.release().
MANUAL INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS:
        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/lib/commons-logging.jar to "commons-logging.jar.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
         Copy the new commons-logging.jar to %JBOSS_HOME%/lib/"
COMPATIBILITY:
        JCL 1.1 is API compatible with JCL 1.0.x
DEPENDENCIES:
        N/A
SUPERSEDES:
        N/A
SUPERSEDED BY:
        N/A
CREATOR:
        Galder Zamarreño
DATE:
        21/02/2007

column305:
05/Mar/07 6:54 AM;galder.zamarreno;Updated instructions:

PATCH NAME:
        ASPATCH-164
SHORT DESCRIPTION:
        Upgrade removes classloader leaks and does not throw LogConfigurationException.
LONG DESCRIPTION:
        JCL (Jakarta Commons Logging) attempts to load a Log impl using the context classloader and instantiate it via reflection. In 1.0.4 this often fails with LogConfigurationException because the type of the impl's Log interface is different from the type seen by ContainerBase, due to the different classloader. JCL 1.1 is intelligent enough to detect this situation and fall back on looking for a Log impl using ContainerBase's classloader.
        Applications which use JCL should call LogFactory.release() as part of their shutdown work (often done in a ServletContextListener) still applies. JCL stores a reference to your app's classloader as a key in a map held in a static field. In JCL 1.1 this map has semantics basically equivalent to WeakHashMap, but still this arrangement has the potential to leak the classloader. The only reliable way to ensure that doesn't happen is to call LogFactory.release().
MANUAL INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS:
        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/client/commons-logging.jar to "commons-logging.jar.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
        Copy the new commons-logging.jar to %JBOSS_HOME%/client/
        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/lib/commons-logging.jar to "commons-logging.jar.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
        Copy the new commons-logging.jar to %JBOSS_HOME%/lib/
        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/server/all/lib/commons-logging.jar to "commons-logging.jar.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
        Copy the new commons-logging.jar to %JBOSS_HOME%/server/all/lib/
        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/server/default/lib/commons-logging.jar to "commons-logging.jar.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
        Copy the new commons-logging.jar to %JBOSS_HOME%/server/default/lib/

        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/server/default/deploy/jbossweb-tomcat55.sar/META-INF/jboss-service.xml to "jboss-service.xml.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
        Copy jboss-service.xml to %JBOSS_HOME%/server/default/deploy/jbossweb-tomcat55.sar/META-INF/

        Rename %JBOSS_HOME%/server/all/deploy/jbossweb-tomcat55.sar/META-INF/jboss-service.xml to "jboss-service-all.xml.replacedBy.ASPATCH-164.jar.old"
        Rename new jboss-service-all.xml to jboss-service.xml
        Copy jboss-service.xml to %JBOSS_HOME%/server/all/deploy/jbossweb-tomcat55.sar/META-INF/
COMPATIBILITY:
        JCL 1.1 is API compatible with JCL 1.0.x
DEPENDENCIES:
        N/A
SUPERSEDES:
        N/A
SUPERSEDED BY:
        N/A
CREATOR:
        Galder Zamarreño
DATE:
        05/03/2007
